original: cha shas ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a part of it and because it is not of its nature.

original: gong bu smos pa yang don med do //
analyzed: gong bu smos pa yang don med do //
translated: The mention of the mass is meaningless.

original: mkhrang par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mkhrang ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mkhrang par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mkhrang ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúcondensed‚Äù is a form of the term ‚Äúcondensedness.‚Äù

original: de dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit operates without distinction from that‚Äù means

original: de la mig de dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa'i ngang tshul yod pas na tha mi dad par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig de dang tha mi dad par 'jug pa'i ngang tshul yod pas na tha mi dad par 'jug pa'o //
translated: that the eye has the mode of operation of operating without distinction from that.

original: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /üîΩmig gi dbang po yang yin pa dang lhan cig 'jug @99a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te / mig gi dbang po yang yin pa dang lhan cig 'jug @99a * //
translated: This is what is being taught:üîΩThe eye is the basis of the mass of flesh that operates together with it.

original: pa'i sha'i gong bu de'i rten du gyur pa la mig gi sha'i gong bu gang yin pa zhes pa 'di nye bar btags te rten la brten pas btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i sha'i gong bu de'i rten du gyur pa la mig gi sha'i gong bu gang yin pa zhes pa 'di nye bar btags te rten la brten pas btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mass of flesh of the eye‚Äù is a designation of the basis by the based.

original: de lta bu yang sha'i gong bu smos pa'i nus pa las yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu yang sha'i gong bu smos pa'i nus pa las yin no //
translated: This is the case because of the power of the mention of the mass of flesh.

original: mig ni sha'i gong bu'i bdag nyid ma yin te dang po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig ni sha'i gong bu'i bdag nyid ma yin te dang po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye is not of the nature of the mass of flesh because it is of the nature of the first.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang mthun par gdags pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad dang mthun par gdags pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
translated: It is said in this way because it is designated in accordance with mundane convention.

original: 'jig rten na ni de'i rten sha'i gong bu 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bdag nyid can la mig tu 'du shes kyi dbang po la ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni de'i rten sha'i gong bu 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bdag nyid can la mig tu 'du shes kyi dbang po la ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the world, the eye is recognized as the fleshy part that is the basis of the eye, which is the nature of the primary elements and the derivative form of the primary elements, but not as the eye faculty.

original: gzhan du na mig la zhes bya ba kho na zhig bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mig la zhes bya ba kho na zhig bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be explained as the eye alone.

original: yang rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa brjod pas rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa brjod pas rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it is understood through the expression of the seven reasons.

original: de las dbang po tha mi dad par 'jug pa'i gong bu mtha' dag gi rten 'byung ba rnams rjes su bzung bas na /
analyzed: de las dbang po tha mi dad par 'jug pa'i gong bu mtha' dag gi rten 'byung ba rnams rjes su bzung bas na /
translated: Since the primary elements that are the basis of the entire fleshy part that is the basis of the eye and is not different from the eye faculty are accepted,

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdun pas bstan pa zhes bya ste rten gyi sha'i gong bu mtha' dag gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdun pas bstan pa zhes bya ste rten gyi sha'i gong bu mtha' dag gzung ba'i don to //
translated: for that very reason, it is called the teaching of the seven, meaning the entire fleshy part that is the basis is accepted.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin na /
translated: If the eyes and so on are not the nature of the primary elements and form and so on,

original: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin te zhes bya ba'i ston pa'i gsung dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin te zhes bya ba'i ston pa'i gsung dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would contradict the statement of the Master, ‚ÄúThis monk, this person is the six elements.‚Äù

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i khams dang mig la sogs pa'i khams rnams las tha dad par yod na skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes brjod par mi rigs so zhe na mngal du 'jug pa'i rdzas kyi gzhi bstan par byaüîΩba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i khams dang mig la sogs pa'i khams rnams las tha dad par yod na skyes bu 'di ni khams drug pa yin no zhes brjod par mi rigs so zhe na mngal du 'jug pa'i rdzas kyi gzhi bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: If the elements of earth and so on were different from the elements of form and so forth and the elements of eye and so on, it would be illogical to say, ‚ÄúThis person is the six elements.‚Äù

original: mdo ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mdo ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: But this is not contradictory because the s≈´tra is provisional.

original: de la nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi ste /
analyzed: de la nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi ste /
translated: The basis of the substance of sentient beings is the state of kalala and so on.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams yod bzhin du khams drug tu gsungs te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams yod bzhin du khams drug tu gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, the six elements are stated while form and so on exist.

original: de la gzhan dag na re reg pa'i skye mched rnams dang mig la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba bzhi tshan gyi bdag nyid de reg pa'i skye mched rnams ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rtsa ba'i rdzas yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa rnams kyang 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams ni rtsa ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re reg pa'i skye mched rnams dang mig la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba bzhi tshan gyi bdag nyid de reg pa'i skye mched rnams ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rtsa ba'i rdzas yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa rnams kyang 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams ni rtsa ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The bases of touch and the eyes and so on are the nature of the four great elements because the bases of touch are the substantial cause of the arising of consciousness and the eyes and so on are supported by the elements.

original: gzhan dag ni nying mtshams sbyor bar 'brel ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni nying mtshams sbyor bar 'brel ba'i tshe /
translated: Others say: The elements are the root because at the time of linking with conception

original: mig la sogs pa rnams med pas de dag ma gsungs @99b la ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams med pas de dag ma gsungs @99b la ;
translated: the eyes and so on do not exist and therefore they are not mentioned.

original: de'i tshe lus kyi dbang po yod mod kyi de'i de'i gnas skabs na grang ba la sogs pa yongs su gcod par mi nus pas yod kyang rang gi dgos pa mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni dgos pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi rgyu dang bcas
analyzed: de'i tshe lus kyi dbang po yod mod kyi de'i de'i gnas skabs na grang ba la sogs pa yongs su gcod par mi nus pas yod kyang rang gi dgos pa mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni dgos pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi rgyu dang bcas
translated: At that time the body faculty exists, but since it is unable to comprehend cold and so on at that stage, it does not perform its own function even though it exists.

original: par rnam par mi 'jog go snyam du sems so //
analyzed: par rnam par mi 'jog go snyam du sems so //
translated: That which is not endowed with its own function is not posited as having a cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khams drug po 'di dag sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khams drug po 'di dag sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin te /
translated: Therefore, these six elements are the substantial basis of sentient beings,

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi bar du dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas 'chi 'pho ba'i sems kyi bar du dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are necessary from the moment of the mind of reincarnation until the moment of the mind of death.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ci ldang ba'i sems kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ci ldang ba'i sems kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid do //
translated: The consciousnesses of those who are absorbed in the attainment of cessation are the immediately antecedent condition of the mind that arises.

original: lus kyi dbang po la yang 'o na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu sbyin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i rten gyi dngos po ni lus kyi dbang po'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la yang 'o na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu sbyin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i rten gyi dngos po ni lus kyi dbang po'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The function of the body faculty is to be the basis for the arising of the consciousness that is concomitant with it, because it is the homogeneous cause of that.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu sbyin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu sbyin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the homogeneous cause of that,

original: gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is concomitant with something else.

original: rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa yang sra ba la sogs pa rnams nyid de /
analyzed: rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa yang sra ba la sogs pa rnams nyid de /
translated: The substantial basis of the body is the elements of solidity, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rten rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rten rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: It is not the other substances, form, etc., that are the support of form, etc.

original: sra ba la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sems kho na 'ching ba dang thar par 'os kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba la sems kho na 'ching ba dang thar par 'os kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: It is the mind alone that is bound and liberated, not the other aggregates, feeling, etc.,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams sems kyi rten dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rnams sems kyi rten dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the support of the mind and they are concomitant with the mind.

original: kha cig na re bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re bdag med par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: because the non-existence of self is taught.

original: 'dir rgyu gang las rten ni sra ba nyid las gzhan pa kha dog la sogs pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu gang las rten ni sra ba nyid las gzhan pa kha dog la sogs pa rnams ma yin zhe na /
translated: Here, why is the support not color, etc., but rather solidity, etc.?

original: tshogs pa thams cad la khyab pa sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la yod kyi kha dog la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa thams cad la khyab pa sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid la yod kyi kha dog la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The characteristic of earth, etc., pervades the entire collection, but color, etc., do not.

original: 'di dag rten nyid dang kha dog la sogs pa skyed pa dang chen po nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag rten nyid dang kha dog la sogs pa skyed pa dang chen po nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: These are not established as the support itself, as the producer of color, etc., and as the great element.

original: 'di ston pa'i dgongs pa pa yin gyi yang 'byung ba tsam zhig bzhed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ston pa'i dgongs pa pa yin gyi yang 'byung ba tsam zhig bzhed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How do we know that this is the intention of the teacher and that he does not merely intend the elements?

original: yang reg pa'i skye mched drug gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang reg pa'i skye mched drug gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the six bases of contact are mentioned.

original: mdo 'di nyid las kyang reg pa'i skye mched drug gsungs pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar drug gsungs te de'i phyir 'byung ba tsam ma yin pa'i phyir khams drug gsungs pa @100a * //üîΩyin no zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las kyang reg pa'i skye mched drug gsungs pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar drug gsungs te de'i phyir 'byung ba tsam ma yin pa'i phyir khams drug gsungs pa @100a * // yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
translated: In this sutra, the six bases of contact are mentioned, from the base of contact of the eye to the base of contact of the mind. Therefore, we should understand that the six elements are mentioned because they are not merely the elements.

original: de lta ma yin na mig la sogs pa lnga po rnams sa'i khams la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir reg pa'i skye mched drug ces yang mi gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mig la sogs pa lnga po rnams sa'i khams la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir reg pa'i skye mched drug ces yang mi gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then because the five such as the eye are not different from the earth element and so on, the six bases of contact would not be mentioned.

original: de la mig nyid reg pa'i skye mched yin pa ni mig gi reg pa'i skye mched de /
analyzed: de la mig nyid reg pa'i skye mched yin pa ni mig gi reg pa'i skye mched de /
translated: The base of contact of the eye is the eye itself.

original: yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar ni sems las byung ba'i chos reg pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar ni sems las byung ba'i chos reg pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: up to the sense base of mental contact is the mental factor dharma that is the basis of contact.

original: sems las byung ba rnams med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it would follow that mental factors would not exist.

original: ci yin zhe na khams drug tsam yin pa'i phyir mdo las khams drug gsungs kyi 'byung ba las gyur pa ni yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci yin zhe na khams drug tsam yin pa'i phyir mdo las khams drug gsungs kyi 'byung ba las gyur pa ni yod pa yin no //
translated: What is that? The s≈´tra declares that there are just six elements because there are six bases of substance.üîΩBut the derivative elements exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rdzas kyi gzhi bstan pa'i phyir zhes sbyar ro //
translated: What is that? The s≈´tra declares that there are just six elements because there are six bases of substance.

original: gal te mdo las sa'i khams la sogs pa ltar mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams ma gsungs pas de rnams med par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te mdo las sa'i khams la sogs pa ltar mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams ma gsungs pas de rnams med par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the sense faculties such as the eyes and objects such as form do not exist because they are not mentioned in the s≈´tras, like the earth element and so on,

original: de ltar na tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyang ma gsungs pas de dag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams kyang ma gsungs pas de dag kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that mental factors such as feeling would not exist because they are not mentioned in the s≈´tras.

original: ci ste ji ltar 'byung ba rnams kho nas 'byung ba las byung ba yin pa de bzhin du sems nyid sems las byung ba yin gyi sems las don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin pas thal pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar 'byung ba rnams kho nas 'byung ba las byung ba yin pa de bzhin du sems nyid sems las byung ba yin gyi sems las don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin pas thal pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that just as the primary elements are derived from the primary elements, so mind is derived from mind, and mind does not become an object that is different from mind, then this consequence does not apply to us.

original: de'i phyir sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rgya zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa rgya zhes gsungs so //
translated: To respond: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúMind itself is not a mental factor, etc.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because it contradicts the sutras.

original: mdo las 'du shes dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo las 'du shes dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: The sutras say, ‚ÄúFeeling and, etc.‚Äù

original: yang sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir te mdo las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir te mdo las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, it is said that mind is associated with attachment, etc.

original: sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: sems nyid sems las byung ba rnams yin no zhes bya bar khas blangs pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to accept that mind itself is a mental factor.

original: gang gi phyir sems 'dod chags dang bcas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems 'dod chags dang bcas /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúMind is associated with attachment,

original: sems zhe sdang dang bcas /
analyzed: sems zhe sdang dang bcas /
translated: mind is associated with aversion,

original: sems gti mug dang bcas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gti mug dang bcas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: mind is associated with delusion.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba tsam ni 'ga' zhig yongs su spang bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam ni 'ga' zhig yongs su spang bar bshad do //
translated: The mere elements are explained as being completely abandoned.

original: lus kyi rten la sogs pa'i 'byung ba bzhin sra ba la sogs pa sna tshogs par 'gyur te 'ga' zhig ni gzung ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rten la sogs pa'i 'byung ba bzhin sra ba la sogs pa sna tshogs par 'gyur te 'ga' zhig ni gzung ba'o //
translated: The four elements are various, hard, etc., like the bodily basis, etc. Some are grasped,

original: 'ga' zhig ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: some are grasper.

original: 'ga' zhig mig gi dbang po'i gzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mig gi dbang po'i gzung ba'o //
translated: Some are the object of the eye faculty,

original: sra ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa dang sna tshogs pa @100b ma yin pa 'di ltar tha dad de /
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa dang sna tshogs pa @100b ma yin pa 'di ltar tha dad de /
translated: this variety and non-variety of hard, etc. is different.

original: sra ba la sogs pa mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin zhing kha dog la sogs pa yang lus kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin zhing kha dog la sogs pa yang lus kyis ma yin no //
translated: Hard, etc. is not grasped by the eye, and color, etc. is not by the body.

original: aee hye tam na gri hri ta mi bye ge /
analyzed: aee hye tam na gri hri ta mi bye ge /
translated: Ai! Hiei! This is grasped by the hand.

original: kha dog la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Color, etc. is also so.

original: de la 'byung ba tsam nyid de rnams kyang rnam pa sna tshogs pa so sor nges pa'i dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba tsam nyid de rnams kyang rnam pa sna tshogs pa so sor nges pa'i dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: There, those mere elements are various, each with a specific nature, and are grasped by the sense faculties.

original: de la gal te lus kyi dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa la sogs pa rnams ni mig gis gzung bya ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te lus kyi dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa la sogs pa rnams ni mig gis gzung bya ma yin te /
translated: If it is explained from the point of view of the object of the body faculty, then color, etc. are not objects of the eye,

original: dbang po'i gzung bya gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i gzung bya gzhan ma yin no //
translated: because they are objects of another faculty,

original: kha dog la sogs pa rnams kyang lus kyis ma yin no //üîΩai tyeta tpa re t'a bh++yu pa gamya ta ae ba na tve t'a pa t'a /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa rnams kyang lus kyis ma yin no // ai tyeta tpa re t'a bh++yu pa gamya ta ae ba na tve t'a pa t'a /
translated: and color, etc. are not objects of the body.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i bdag nyid dgag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'byung ba'i bdag nyid dgag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the nature of the elements such as form is refuted.

original: rigs gcig la yang sna tshogs pa mthong ste tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs gcig la yang sna tshogs pa mthong ste tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Even in one class of things, variety is seen, as in the case of feeling, etc.

original: dper na tshor ba kha cig ni phan 'dogs pa dang / kha cig ni gnod pa dang / kha cig rnam pa gnyis ka yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tshor ba kha cig ni phan 'dogs pa dang / kha cig ni gnod pa dang / kha cig rnam pa gnyis ka yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, some feelings are helpful, some are harmful, and some are both.

original: gang bshad pa'i dkar po pra bi ra la sogs pa mtshon pa'i don du kha dog la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba de la 'byung ba rnams kyi mchog dang tha ma'i dbye bas dkar po la sogs pa'i dbye ba bshad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang bshad pa'i dkar po pra bi ra la sogs pa mtshon pa'i don du kha dog la sogs pa rnams la zhes bya ba de la 'byung ba rnams kyi mchog dang tha ma'i dbye bas dkar po la sogs pa'i dbye ba bshad ces bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the divisions of white, etc., is in terms of the divisionsüîΩof the best and the worst of the elements.

original: 'byung ba tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams so zhes dgongs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'byung ba tshogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams so zhes dgongs pa'o ;
translated: The meaning is that the form, etc., which are the collections of the elements,üîΩare the best and the worst.üîΩIn that case, the statement ‚Äúcolor, etc., exist in the elements‚Äù is in terms ofüîΩthe cause, because the elements are the cause of color, etc.

original: / de la ni da mu tta ra sa tyam kha dog la sogs pa rnams la yod pa 'byung ba rnams la ni b'ar++ya sun ra kha dog la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams nyid ces rgyu mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de la ni da mu tta ra sa tyam kha dog la sogs pa rnams la yod pa 'byung ba rnams la ni b'ar++ya sun ra kha dog la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams nyid ces rgyu mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúcolor, etc., are the elements themselves‚Äù is in terms of theüîΩeffect, because color, etc., are the effects of the elements.üîΩThe explanation of the sutra is in terms of the division of the non-dependent

original: gang bshad pa'i mdo la mi brten pa dang brten pa'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas na bya h'a n+ya te /
analyzed: gang bshad pa'i mdo la mi brten pa dang brten pa'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas na bya h'a n+ya te /
translated: and the dependent.

original: gang gi phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin rnams 'byung ba rnams brten pa dang / reg bya bcu gcig pa bsdus pa rnams ma brten pa rnams so zhes pa 'di la yang lan du mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin rnams 'byung ba rnams brten pa dang / reg bya bcu gcig pa bsdus pa rnams ma brten pa rnams so zhes pa 'di la yang lan du mi sbyar ro //
translated: Because the elements are supported by the nature of derivative form, and the eleven tactile objects are not supported.

original: de ni 'dod pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa tsam ste /
translated: This is just a claim.

original: gzhi nyid dang sra ba nyid dang sogs nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi nyid dang sra ba nyid dang sogs nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis itself, solidity, etc., are specified.

original: de ltar rgyu cis gzhan la mi brten pa nyid ce na /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu cis gzhan la mi brten pa nyid ce na /
translated: Why are they not supported by others?

original: 'byung ba chen po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs par khas blang bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i dbang du byas nas gsungs par khas blang bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: It should be accepted that they are stated in terms of the great elements.

original: gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la gzugs can bcu kho na bsags pa zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba nyid kyis gzhan brgyad bsags pa ma yin @101a * //
analyzed: gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o // zhes bya ba la gzugs can bcu kho na bsags pa zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba nyid kyis gzhan brgyad bsags pa ma yin @101a * //
translated: The ten with form are composites.

original: pa zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: pa zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Since it is specified that only the ten with form are composites, the other eight are understood to be noncomposites.

original: yang ji ltar na de dag bsags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de dag bsags pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they composites?

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it is a composite of subtle particles.‚Äù

original: gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
analyzed: gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
translated: The instrument of cutting and that which is to be cut

original: phyi rol mi mkhas pa bzhi yin //
analyzed: phyi rol mi mkhas pa bzhi yin //
translated: are external, and are the four non-learners.

original: zhes bya ba la phyi rol smos ba ni nang gi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la phyi rol smos ba ni nang gi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúexternal‚Äù is mentioned in order to exclude the internal elements.

original: bzhi smos pa ni sgra dang chos kyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi smos pa ni sgra dang chos kyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúfour‚Äù is mentioned in order to exclude sound and the element of mental objects.

original: dgra sta dang shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dgra sta dang shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: An axe, a tree, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is to be construed with each of the terms.

original: dgra sta dang ral gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgra sta dang ral gri zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: An axe, a sword, etc. are the instrument of cutting.

original: shing dang rtsva dang 'us zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: shing dang rtsva dang 'us zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcad par bya'o //
translated: A tree, grass, a person, etc. are that which is to be cut.

original: 'dir dang gi sgra ni gnyis char la gnyis ka bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir dang gi sgra ni gnyis char la gnyis ka bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù in the verse is for the purpose of showing both.

original: 'dir ni grags pa'i dbang gis tha dad phyir dper brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni grags pa'i dbang gis tha dad phyir dper brjod do //
translated: Here, the example is stated because of the difference in the well-known terms.

original: so so ba gnyis su med par mngon par sbyar ba la skyon med do //
analyzed: so so ba gnyis su med par mngon par sbyar ba la skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault in applying the two terms to the same thing.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is for the purpose of restriction.

original: phyi rol gyi kho na'o snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi kho na'o snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that the object of the act of cutting is external form only.

original: bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jigs pa'i 'du shes thams cad la bya ba med pas gcod ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jigs pa'i 'du shes thams cad la bya ba med pas gcod ba zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the dharma called ‚Äúcutting‚Äù that is absent in all notions of fear immediately after the self is born?

original: yang na skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa med na gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos ci zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa med na gcod pa zhes bya ba'i chos ci zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Or, what is the dharma called ‚Äúcutting‚Äù when there is no object of cutting and no agent of cutting because of momentariness?

original: 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba can rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa'o zhes bya ba la 'brel pa skyed pa ni gcad par bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba can rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa'o zhes bya ba la 'brel pa skyed pa ni gcad par bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the differentiation of the continuum of the collection is called ‚Äúcutting.‚Äù The arising of the connection is called ‚Äúthe object of cutting.‚Äù

original: gcod pa zhes bya ba gcad par bya ba'i rgyun las don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcod pa zhes bya ba gcad par bya ba'i rgyun las don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Cutting is not a different object from the continuum of the object of cutting.

original: rdul phra rab gcig la rnam par 'byed pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa dang rnam par 'byed pa'i dus gnyis kyang rdzas kyi skad cig gcig la mi srid pas 'dus pa'i rgyun la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig la rnam par 'byed pa skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'brel pa dang rnam par 'byed pa'i dus gnyis kyang rdzas kyi skad cig gcig la mi srid pas 'dus pa'i rgyun la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because the arising of the non-production of differentiation in one atom is not possible, and because the two times of connection and differentiation are not possible in one substantial moment.

original: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa ni gcad par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faculties of body, etc. are not to be cut.

original: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa dag la ni rnam ba de lta bu'i gcod pa de mi rigs te /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa dag la ni rnam ba de lta bu'i gcod pa de mi rigs te /
translated: Such a cutting is not possible in the faculties of body, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yan lag ma lus par bcad na de dag la gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag ma lus par bcad na de dag la gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when all the limbs are cut, they cannot be made two.

original: ma lus pa smos pa ni yan lag 'phro dang bcas pa bcad na dbang po la rnam par dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma lus pa smos pa ni yan lag 'phro dang bcas pa bcad na dbang po la rnam par dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúall‚Äù is used because when a limb is cut with a remainder, a differentiation in the faculty is seen.

original: 'di la yang tshig tsam gyis dad par @101b mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la yang tshig tsam gyis dad par @101b mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one does not have faith in this through mere words,

original: de'i phyir dbang po rnams la ni gnyis su 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po rnams la ni gnyis su 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúthe faculties cannot be made two.‚Äù

original: ni'i sgra ni dbang po rnams ni gcod par byed pa'i rkyen gyis rnam pa gnyis su byar mi nus pa nyid do zhes nges bar gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni dbang po rnams ni gcod par byed pa'i rkyen gyis rnam pa gnyis su byar mi nus pa nyid do zhes nges bar gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means that the faculties cannot be divided into two parts by the condition of cutting.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa /
translated: The reason for this is stated:

original: bcas pa'i yan lag la dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcas pa'i yan lag la dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the parts that are cut off do not have faculties.

original: de yang yan lag des yul 'dzin pa la shes te /
analyzed: de yang yan lag des yul 'dzin pa la shes te /
translated: And this is understood from the fact that the object is not perceived by that part.

original: 'di ni rab tu grags pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu grags pas ma bshad do //
translated: This is well known, so it is not explained.

original: de lta na gal te sna'i rtse mo bcad pa slar sbyar ba lus kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar bskyed ce na /
analyzed: de lta na gal te sna'i rtse mo bcad pa slar sbyar ba lus kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar bskyed ce na /
translated: If the tip of the nose is cut off and then reattached, how can a body consciousness arise from it?

original: rgyas pa las byung ba'i dbang po skye ba'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba'i dbang po skye ba'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault, because a faculty that arises from enhancement arises from it.

original: 'dis ni dud 'gro'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gi mjug ma bcad pa slar skye ba yang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dud 'gro'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gi mjug ma bcad pa slar skye ba yang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the regrowth of the tail of some particular animals when it has been cut off.

original: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not a cutter,

original: dang ba'i mtshan nyid can rnams ni nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ba'i mtshan nyid can rnams ni nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those that have the characteristic of clarity are clear like the light of a gem.

original: nor bu'i 'od ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The light of the gem is not something to be cut off.

original: nor bu ma lus par bcad na de gnyis su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nor bu ma lus par bcad na de gnyis su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the gem is completely cut off, it is not twofold.

original: 'di ni nges par gzung ba las rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni nges par gzung ba las rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is to be understood from the sutra passage that states:

original: sgra yang ma yin te chad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra yang ma yin te chad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Sound is not a characteristic of form because it is cut off.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang lhan cig rgyun mi 'jug pas de'i phyir 'di la drug mtshan 'di dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang lhan cig rgyun mi 'jug pas de'i phyir 'di la drug mtshan 'di dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since sound does not occur in a continuum along with form, etc., it does not have these six characteristics.

original: bsreg pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: bsreg pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this dharma called burning?

original: rgyu'i rgyun las me la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi rgyu can 'bras bu mi 'dra ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyun las me la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi rgyu can 'bras bu mi 'dra ba skye ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of dissimilar effects from a cause, such as fire, etc., which has a causal continuum.

original: dbang po rnams ni ma yin te dang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /üîΩdang ba'i phyir de sh'a ma gnidha re ba by'a nna bi k'a ro bi k'a rashtsa d'a ha /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni ma yin te dang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la / dang ba'i phyir de sh'a ma gnidha re ba by'a nna bi k'a ro bi k'a rashtsa d'a ha /
translated: The sense faculties are not burning because they are clear.üîΩBecause they are clear, they are not burning, like a crystal.

original: bsreg dang gzhal la mi mthun sm'a //
analyzed: bsreg dang gzhal la mi mthun sm'a //
translated: Burning and weighing are not similar.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is this sutra passage?

original: aa kshe pa pa dam gcod pa la sogs pa rnams la yang 'byung ba gtso bo la rnam par dpyad par bya bas na khams bzhi po kho na gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: aa kshe pa pa dam gcod pa la sogs pa rnams la yang 'byung ba gtso bo la rnam par dpyad par bya bas na khams bzhi po kho na gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: The four elements are the agents of cutting, etc., because the primary elements are the objects of the analysis.

original: na gva tsi te ka bya tsi ta nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde la sra ba la sogs pa rnams na re zhig dgra sta dang rlung gi rgyu dang ma dang rlung gi phung po rnam par shes ba la tsha bar 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: na gva tsi te ka bya tsi ta nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro // de la sra ba la sogs pa rnams na re zhig dgra sta dang rlung gi rgyu dang ma dang rlung gi phung po rnam par shes ba la tsha bar 'dug pa ste /
translated: Because the capacity of cutting, etc., is seen.üîΩThe hard, etc., are the agents of cutting, etc., because the capacity of cutting, etc., is seen in the two kinds of things, namely, the hard, such as a sword, a wind, a cause of cooking, and a mass of wind, and the soft, such as the body, a cloth, a cause of rubbing, and a mass of cotton.

original: shing dang ri bo dang bud shing dang yal ga la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyi dngos por nus pa mthong bas so //üîΩro la sogs pa rnams la yang ste /
analyzed: shing dang ri bo dang bud shing dang yal ga la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis kyi dngos por nus pa mthong bas so // ro la sogs pa rnams la yang ste /
translated: The capacity of cutting, etc., is seen in the two kinds of things, namely, the hard, such as wood, a mountain, fuel, and branches, and the soft, such as the body, a cloth, a cause of rubbing, and a mass of cotton.

original: phye dang rgya sran ku lattha la sogs pa mnyam par bsags pa las rgyam tsha dang rdo ba la sogs @102a * //üîΩpa gcod pas so //
analyzed: phye dang rgya sran ku lattha la sogs pa mnyam par bsags pa las rgyam tsha dang rdo ba la sogs @102a * // pa gcod pas so //
translated: The capacity of cutting, etc., is seen in the two kinds of things, namely, the hard, such as wheat, beans, kulattha beans, etc., and the soft, such as flour, lentil flour, etc.üîΩThe capacity of cutting, etc., is seen in the two kinds of things, namely, the hard, such as a stone, a lump of clay, etc., and the soft, such as a piece of sugar, a lump of salt, etc.

original: de la sra ba la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa kho na gcad pa zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sra ba la sogs pa rnams kyis byas pa kho na gcad pa zhes bya ba rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The hard, etc., are not the agents of cutting, etc., because the capacity of cutting, etc., is seen in the two kinds of things, namely, the hard, such as a sword, a wind, a cause of cooking, and a mass of wind, and the soft, such as the body, a cloth, a cause of rubbing, and a mass of cotton.

original: de nyid las gzhan pa sra ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid las gzhan pa sra ba la sogs pa rnams kyis ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not cut by anything other than that, such as solidity, etc.

original: sra ba la sogs pa rnams ni rang bzhin dang khyad par 'ga' yang med do //üîΩro la sogs pa rnams ji lta ba de nyid kyang sreg par byed de /
analyzed: sra ba la sogs pa rnams ni rang bzhin dang khyad par 'ga' yang med do // ro la sogs pa rnams ji lta ba de nyid kyang sreg par byed de /
translated: There is no difference in nature or in any way between solidity, etc.üîΩIt is burned just as taste, etc. are,

original: me dang phrad pa las du ba la sogs pa'i rnam 'gyur rnams kyis so //
analyzed: me dang phrad pa las du ba la sogs pa'i rnam 'gyur rnams kyis so //
translated: because of the transformation of smoke, etc. that occurs when it comes in contact with fire.

original: de yang lag pas 'jal ba sogs byed pas na gzhal ba'o //
analyzed: de yang lag pas 'jal ba sogs byed pas na gzhal ba'o //
translated: It is weighed because it is weighed by the hand, etc.

original: bsreg pa dang gzhal ba dag la mi mthun par smra ba ni rigs te /
analyzed: bsreg pa dang gzhal ba dag la mi mthun par smra ba ni rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to dispute the burning and weighing of fire,

original: phyogs gnyis ka rig par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka rig par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen to be known by both sides.

original: kha cig na re me'i khams shas che bar 'jug pa kho na sreg par byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re me'i khams shas che bar 'jug pa kho na sreg par byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Some say: It is only the state of predominance of the fire element that is burning.

original: me'i khams nyid smin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa'i byed pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis sreg pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis mnan nas me'i khams kyi bya ba thob pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: me'i khams nyid smin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa'i byed pa gzhan dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams kyis sreg pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang 'byung ba gzhan zil gyis mnan nas me'i khams kyi bya ba thob pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The fire element is the agent that burns because it is impossible for the mass of earth, etc., to burn, and because the fire element obtains its function by overpowering the other elements.

original: gzhan dag na re phyi rol gyi khams bzhi po 'byung ba me shas che ba kho na sreg par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyi rol gyi khams bzhi po 'byung ba me shas che ba kho na sreg par byed de /
translated: Other masters say: The four external elements, when they are in a state of predominance of the fire element, burn.

original: gal te me'i khams kho na sreg par byed na ni lhan cig tu gyur pa'i 'byung ba rnams dang / de dag la brten ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang sreg par byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te me'i khams kho na sreg par byed na ni lhan cig tu gyur pa'i 'byung ba rnams dang / de dag la brten ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang sreg par byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If the fire element alone burned, then the simultaneous elements and the derived matter supported by them would also burn.

original: khams bzhi po thams cad nyid sreg pa zhes bya ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: khams bzhi po thams cad nyid sreg pa zhes bya ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: All four elements are the cause of what is called burning, which is a transformation.

original: me'i khams kho na ni sreg par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: me'i khams kho na ni sreg par byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The fire element alone is not the agent that burns.

original: phyi rol gyi khams bzhi po nyid gzhal ba la ni mtha' dag srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lci ba nyid kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khams bzhi po nyid gzhal ba la ni mtha' dag srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lci ba nyid kho na gzhal bar bya ba yin te /
translated: In the case of weighing the four external elements, heaviness alone is what is weighed, because the totality of light elements is the cause of the depression of the scale‚Äôs head.

original: yang ba rnams la srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ba rnams la srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for the light elements to be the cause of the depression of the scale‚Äôs head.

original: lci ba nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas rnams srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu nyid du smra'i yang ba nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lci ba nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas rnams srang mgo dma' ba'i rgyu nyid du smra'i yang ba nyid kyi lhan cig byed pa dang ldan pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The substances that possess the co-operating cause of heaviness are the cause of the depression of the scale‚Äôs head, but not those that possess the co-operating cause of lightness.

original: de lta na yang der lci ba nyid nus pa dang ldan par 'dod do zhes de ltar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang der lci ba nyid nus pa dang ldan par 'dod do zhes de ltar bsam par bya'o //
translated: Even so, heaviness is accepted as the effective cause in that case.

original: rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyas las byung ba nang gi lnga //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyas las byung ba nang gi lnga // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five internal ones arise from the cause of ripening and from the cause of accumulation.

original: lnga zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The five are mentioned in order to exclude the consciousness element.

original: nang gi @102b zhes bya ba ni yul gyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi @102b zhes bya ba ni yul gyi khams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Internal is mentioned in order to exclude the object elements.

original: 'dir yang nang gi lnga ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang nang gi lnga ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Also, here the five internal elements are definitely ascertained to be generated from karmic maturation and enhancement.

original: 'di gang las she na gang gi phyir rgyu mthun pa ni med do zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'di gang las she na gang gi phyir rgyu mthun pa ni med do zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Why is this? Because it is said that there is no natural outflow.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa lngar skyes pa rnams ni mig la sogs pa phyis skyes pa rnams dang ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa lngar skyes pa rnams ni mig la sogs pa phyis skyes pa rnams dang ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: If the five eyes and so on that arise in the desire realm are not the homogeneous cause of the eyes and so on that arise later and those that do not arise,

original: rgyu mthun pa yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
translated: then natural outflow is also the result of the homogeneous cause.

original: ji ltar rgyu mthun du yod pa ma yin pa de las tha dad pa'i rgyu mthun med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhes bshad kyis med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu mthun du yod pa ma yin pa de las tha dad pa'i rgyu mthun med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin zhes bshad kyis med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Since it is said that natural outflow does not exist because it does not exist as natural outflow, it is not that it does not exist because it is different from that, since natural outflow does not exist.

original: ji ltar rnam par smin pa las tha dad pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba yod pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba las tha dad pa'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par smin pa las tha dad pa'i rgyas pa las byung ba yod pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba las tha dad pa'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: Just as there is that arisen from enhancement that is distinct from that arisen from karmic maturation and that arisen from karmic maturation that is distinct from that arisen from enhancement,

original: ji ltar shi ba la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i gzugs pa sogs pa dmigs pa de bzhin du de dag la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyu mthun pa ni de las tha dad par dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: ji ltar shi ba la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i gzugs pa sogs pa dmigs pa de bzhin du de dag la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyu mthun pa ni de las tha dad par dmigs pa med de /
translated: so too, just as form that is derived from enhancement is observed in the dead, so too, that arisen from karmic maturation and that derived from enhancement are not observed as distinct from that arisen from karmic maturation.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba med par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang rgyas pa las byung ba ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba med par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since there is no form derived from enhancement that is distinct from that arisen from karmic maturation and that arisen from enhancement, it is explained that the eyes and so on do not possess form derived from enhancement.

original: las kyi rnam pa zhes bshad pa de'i 'bras bu mi 'dra bar smin pas na rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam pa zhes bshad pa de'i 'bras bu mi 'dra bar smin pas na rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The result of that action is called karmic maturation because it ripens as a dissimilar result.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa ni rnam par smin pa gzhan dang 'brel ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa ni rnam par smin pa gzhan dang 'brel ba ma yin na /
translated: If karmic maturation is not related to another karmic maturation,

original: ji ltar de dag rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How are they called ‚Äúarisen from the ripening cause‚Äù?

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not the ripening itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'o //
translated: They are arisen from the ripening cause, because the intermediate state is omitted.

original: 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i ngag gi las ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i ngag gi las ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe verbal action that has reached the time of the fruit‚Äù means

original: dus gang gi tshe bar med par las las 'bras bu skye ba ni 'bras bu'i dus te /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe bar med par las las 'bras bu skye ba ni 'bras bu'i dus te /
translated: the time when the fruit arises from the action without any interval.

original: de tshe las de rnam par smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tshe las de rnam par smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, the action is called ‚Äúripening‚Äù because it is ripening.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te bar med par 'bras bu bskyed par rung ba'i las las skyes pas na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //üîΩgal te 'bras bu la mngon du phyogs pa'i las rnam par smin par 'gyur bas rnam @103a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te bar med par 'bras bu bskyed par rung ba'i las las skyes pas na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o // gal te 'bras bu la mngon du phyogs pa'i las rnam par smin par 'gyur bas rnam @103a * //
translated: This is explained as follows: The action that is capable of producing the fruit without any interval is called ‚Äúarisen from the ripening cause,‚Äù because it is arisen from the ripening cause.üîΩIf the action that is directed toward the fruit is the ripening,

original: par smin pa yin na /
analyzed: par smin pa yin na /
translated: then the action that has already produced the fruit would be ripening again.

original: 'o na 'bras bu ji ltar rnam par smin pa yin zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin pas rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu ji ltar rnam par smin pa yin zhe na / de'i phyir 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa kho na yin pas rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The effect is a ripened result because it is a ripened result alone.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i rgyu la smin pas rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i rgyu la smin pas rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The cause of a ripened result is a ripened result because it is a cause that is separated from a ripened result.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par smin pa las skyes pas rnam par smin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par smin pa las skyes pas rnam par smin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is a ripened result because it is born from a ripened result.

original: rgyas pa la yod pa ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste sde tshan bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa la yod pa ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste sde tshan bzhin no //
translated: The cause of increase is an increased result because it is a result that increases.üîΩOr, increase itself is an increased result because it is a result that increases its own object.üîΩThe cause of conscious effort is a conscious effort result because it is a result that is conscious effort.üîΩThe cause of separation is a separated result because it is a result that is separated.

original: yang na rgyas pa nyid rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste rang gi don la 'phel ba byas pa'i sgra 'dul ba pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyas pa nyid rgyas pa las byung ba dag ste rang gi don la 'phel ba byas pa'i sgra 'dul ba pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of natural outflow is a natural outflow result because it is a result that is a natural outflow.üîΩThe cause of karmic maturation is a ripened result because it is a result that is a ripened result.üîΩThe cause of the same status is a homogeneous result because it is a result that is homogeneous.üîΩThe cause of the result of separation is a separated result because it is a result that is separated.üîΩThe cause of conscious effort is a conscious effort result because it is a result that is conscious effort.üîΩThe cause of natural outflow is a natural outflow result because it is a result that is a natural outflow.üîΩThe cause of karmic maturation is a ripened result because it is a result that is a ripened result.üîΩThe cause of the same status is a homogeneous result because it is a result that is homogeneous.üîΩThe cause of the result of separation is a separated result because it is a result that is separated.üîΩThe cause of conscious effort is a conscious effort result because it is a result that is conscious effort.üîΩThe cause of natural outflow is a natural outflow result because it is a result that is a natural outflow.

original: legs par bya ba ni khrus dang bsku mnye dang 'bad rtsol dang bsku byug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bya ba ni khrus dang bsku mnye dang 'bad rtsol dang bsku byug la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is a ripened result because it is a result that is a ripened result.

original: khyad par gyi sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The cause of the same status is a homogeneous result because it is a result that is homogeneous.üîΩThe cause of the result of separation is a separated result because it is a result that is separated.üîΩThe cause of conscious effort is a conscious effort result because it is a result that is conscious effort.üîΩThe cause of natural outflow is a natural outflow result because it is a result that is a natural outflow.üîΩThe cause of karmic maturation is a ripened result because it is a result

original: zas la sogs pa yod kyang mi tshangs par spyod ngas rgyas pa las byung ba la gnod bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas la sogs pa yod kyang mi tshangs par spyod ngas rgyas pa las byung ba la gnod bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, even though food, etc. exist, one sees that the life of one who is not celibate is harmed by sexual activity.

original: tshangs par spyod pas ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pas ni mi gnod pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Celibacy merely does not harm,

original: rgyas pa ni zas la sogs pa dag kho nas yin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni zas la sogs pa dag kho nas yin no //
translated: but growth is due to food, etc.

original: zas la sogs pa dag ni rnam par smin pa la phan 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: zas la sogs pa dag ni rnam par smin pa la phan 'dogs par byed de /
translated: Food, etc. benefit the life that is born from evolution.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyas pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin ba'i rgyud la phyir bzhin du kun tu bsrung bo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyas pa'i rgyud ni rnam par smin ba'i rgyud la phyir bzhin du kun tu bsrung bo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the life that is born from growth protects the life that is born from evolution as a wall does.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyud ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir stobs chung ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyud ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba la nus pa med pa'i phyir stobs chung ba yin la /
translated: The life that is born from evolution is weak, because it is incapable of the activities of going, etc.

original: rgyas pa'i rgyud ni stobs chung ba ri bo dang 'dra ba de gnas par bya ba'i phyir phyi'i ri bo dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i rgyud ni stobs chung ba ri bo dang 'dra ba de gnas par bya ba'i phyir phyi'i ri bo dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The life that is born from growth is like a mountain, because it supports the weak life that is born from evolution.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba med par ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa med kyi /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba med par ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa med kyi /
translated: The life that is born from evolution does not exist without the life that is born from growth.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa med par rgyas pa las byung ba ni yod par 'gyur te dper na lha'i mig bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa med par rgyas pa las byung ba ni yod par 'gyur te dper na lha'i mig bzhin no //
translated: But it is not impossible that sound is arisen from enhancement and not arisen from ripening, like the divine eye.

original: rnam bar smin ba las byung ba kho na bkag pas /
analyzed: rnam bar smin ba las byung ba kho na bkag pas /
translated: Since it is said that sound is not arisen from ripening,

original: sgra ni rgyas ba las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yod do zhes bya bar khong du chud par 'gyur te /üîΩmgrin pa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa las byung ba dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra ni rgyas ba las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yod do zhes bya bar khong du chud par 'gyur te / mgrin pa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa las byung ba dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa'i sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba'o //
translated: it is understood that sound is also arisen from enhancement and arisen from natural outflow.üîΩSound that is not distinct from the great elements of enhancement of the throat and so on is arisen from enhancement.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i byung ba dang tha mi dad bar 'dug pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i byung ba dang tha mi dad bar 'dug pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Sound that is not distinct from the great elements of natural outflow is arisen from natural outflow.

original: sgra ni rnam smin las skyed min //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam smin las skyed min //
translated: Sound is not arisen from ripening.

original: zhes bya ba la tshig tsam gyis 'dod pa mi 'grub pas de'i rgyu dris pa dang / 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i @103b phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la tshig tsam gyis 'dod pa mi 'grub pas de'i rgyu dris pa dang / 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i @103b phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since one cannot establish the assertion that sound is not arisen from ripening by mere words, the reason for that assertion is asked and it is said that it is because it arises as one wishes.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa can ni 'dod kyang mi 'byung la mi 'dod kyang 'byung gi sgra ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa can ni 'dod kyang mi 'byung la mi 'dod kyang 'byung gi sgra ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Though one desires to have eyes and so on that are the results of karmic maturation, they do not arise, and though one does not desire them, they arise. But sound is not like that.

original: brjod par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though one desires to see, etc., the eye, etc., do not arise, and even though one does not desire to hear, etc., sound, etc., do arise. But this is not so for sound, because it arises only when one desires to speak.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes ba'i gzugs ni rnam par chad nas yang skye ba yang ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes ba'i gzugs ni rnam par chad nas yang skye ba yang ma yin na /
translated: Also, form that arises from karmic maturation does not arise again after being interrupted,

original: sgra ni skye ba yang yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni skye ba yang yin te /
translated: but sound does arise.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is beyond the phenomenon of karmic maturation, sound is not born from karmic maturation.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: To respond to the objection that this contradicts the treatise,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúWell then, what about the treatise that states...‚Äù

original: 'o na gang bstan bcos btags pa las zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na gang bstan bcos btags pa las zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'grub pa bden mod kyi 'di ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pas bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'grub pa bden mod kyi 'di ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pas bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: It is true that this is established, but because this is not karmic maturation, there is no contradiction with the treatise.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: kha cig na re brgyud pa 'di ni gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re brgyud pa 'di ni gsum pa yin te /
translated: Some say: This is the third transmission.

original: de lta na tshig rtsub bo spong ba sgra'i rgyu'i rgyu yin gyi dngos su ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta na tshig rtsub bo spong ba sgra'i rgyu'i rgyu yin gyi dngos su ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the avoidance of harsh speech is the indirect cause of sound, but not its direct cause.

original: sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa de ltar yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa de ltar yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Sound is not born from the ripening cause.

original: kha cig na re gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes ba las rnam par smin pa las skyes ba skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: kha cig na re gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes ba las rnam par smin pa las skyes ba skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: Some say: It is not logical that what is born from the ripening cause would produce another factor born from the ripening cause.

original: de'i phyir brgyud pa 'di ni bzhi pa'am lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyud pa 'di ni bzhi pa'am lnga pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this continuum is either fourfold or fivefold.üîΩEven though sound is generated by the special nutriment and karma, it is born in dependence on the primary elements born from the ripening cause.

original: zas dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par dag gis bskyed kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'byung ba rnams la brten nas skye ba de dag las rgyas pa las byung ba rnams te zhes brjod do //üîΩde dag la ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: zas dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par dag gis bskyed kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i 'byung ba rnams la brten nas skye ba de dag las rgyas pa las byung ba rnams te zhes brjod do // de dag la ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams te /
translated: Those are called derived from enhancement.

original: de rnams ni de dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni de dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those are the homogeneous cause of those.

original: de dag la ni sgra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag la ni sgra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Sound is born from those.üîΩSome say: Sound is born from the primary elements that are derived from enhancement.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba rnams la rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / gang gi phyir 'byung ba la ltos par sgra'i gnas skabs ji lta ba las lung du ma bstan pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba rnams la rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams la rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / gang gi phyir 'byung ba la ltos par sgra'i gnas skabs ji lta ba las lung du ma bstan pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
translated: Those derived from enhancement are derived from enhancement. Those derived from natural outflow are derived from natural outflow.üîΩThose that depend on the elements are neutral, but those that do not depend on the elements are virtuous or nonvirtuous.üîΩThose that are conjoined are not conjoined. Those that are objects of the body faculty are objects of the ear faculty.

original: zin pa rnams la ma zin pa dang / lus kyi dbang po'i yul rnams la rna ba'i dbang po'i yul dang / de bzhin du rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zin pa rnams la ma zin pa dang / lus kyi dbang po'i yul rnams la rna ba'i dbang po'i yul dang / de bzhin du rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, those that arise from karmic maturation are not those that arise from karmic maturation.

original: de lta na 'o na lus kyi tshor ba yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na lus kyi tshor ba yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then also bodily feeling would not be karmic maturation.

original: de la gang zhig dngos kyi las kyi 'bras bu yin pa de ni rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi /üîΩlas las skyes pa'i 'byung ba las skyes @104a * //
analyzed: de la gang zhig dngos kyi las kyi 'bras bu yin pa de ni rnam par smin par 'gyur gyi / las las skyes pa'i 'byung ba las skyes @104a * //
translated: That which is the result of the actual basis of karma is karmic maturation.

original: da ni ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that which arises from the elements generated by karma.

original: sgra bzhin no snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: sgra bzhin no snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it is as the words state.

original: gal te sgra bzhin du rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te sgra bzhin du rigs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were as the words state, it would contradict reasoning.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It would not be karmic maturation.

original: las las skyes pa'i 'byung ba las byung ba nyid rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: las las skyes pa'i 'byung ba las byung ba nyid rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which arises from the primary elements derived from karma is not the characteristic of karmic maturation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: ji skad bshad pa 'dod kyang mi 'byung la mi 'dod kyang 'byung ba 'di rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa 'dod kyang mi 'byung la mi 'dod kyang 'byung ba 'di rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: That which does not arise when desired but arises when not desired is the characteristic of karmic maturation.

original: las kyi 'byung ba las byung ba'i tshor ba la ni mi 'gal te mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: las kyi 'byung ba las byung ba'i tshor ba la ni mi 'gal te mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: That feeling arising from the primary elements derived from karma is not contradictory, like the eyes and so on.

original: sgra la ni mi srid de 'di de dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra la ni mi srid de 'di de dgur 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is impossible for sound because it arises from those.

original: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nye bar 'dus pa med kyang 'byung zhing bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen log kyang mi ldog pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal de ni rnam par smin ba las skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen nye bar 'dus pa med kyang 'byung zhing bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen log kyang mi ldog pa'i tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal de ni rnam par smin ba las skyes pa yin la /
translated: Feeling that is pleasure or pain does not arise even though conditions for pleasure or pain are assembled, and it does not cease even though those conditions cease.üîΩThat feeling is born from karmic maturation.

original: gang zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul nye bar tshogs pa las byung zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul nye bar tshogs pa las byung zhing /
translated: That which arises from the assembly of objects that are experienced as pleasure or pain

original: de med na mi 'byung ba de ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba de ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
translated: and does not occur if those are absent arises from natural outflow.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: lus kyi tshor ba thams cad las las skyes pa dang 'byung ba rgyu mthun pa ma yin zhing rnam bar smin pa las skyes ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba thams cad las las skyes pa dang 'byung ba rgyu mthun pa ma yin zhing rnam bar smin pa las skyes ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Not all physical feelings arise from natural outflow or from karmic maturation.

original: 'byung ba las tha dad pa rnams kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba las tha dad pa rnams kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: Those that are different from the elements do not arise from karmic maturation.

original: de bskyed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi phyir ro //
translated: They are born from the causal process that generates them.

original: lus dang reg bya la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i lus kyi tshor ba de ni rnam par smin pa las skyes ba 'byung ba'i rgyu rkyen kho na'o //
analyzed: lus dang reg bya la brten nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i lus kyi tshor ba de ni rnam par smin pa las skyes ba 'byung ba'i rgyu rkyen kho na'o //
translated: The body sensation that arises in dependence on the body and tactile objects is only the cause and condition that generates the body consciousness.

original: de gal te rnam par smin pa yongs su rtog na rnam par smin pa'i chos las 'das par 'gal lo //
analyzed: de gal te rnam par smin pa yongs su rtog na rnam par smin pa'i chos las 'das par 'gal lo //
translated: If you imagine that it is karmic maturation, then it would contradict that it is a phenomenon that has passed beyond karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa la ni 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro //üîΩde la gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid sbyar gyi lhag ma ni ma sbyar ba'i phyir gzhung kha bskang ba'i ched kho nar gsungs pa mtshon bar bya ste gzhan rnam gsumüîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa la ni 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro // de la gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid sbyar gyi lhag ma ni ma sbyar ba'i phyir gzhung kha bskang ba'i ched kho nar gsungs pa mtshon bar bya ste gzhan rnam gsum zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is not karmic maturation, then there is no contradiction.üîΩIn this context, the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is a phenomenon that has passed beyond karmic maturation‚Äù is applied to the phrase ‚Äúit is not karmic maturation,‚Äù but the remainder is not applied.üîΩTherefore it is said that the remainder is stated only to complete the text and should be illustrated as follows:

original: rgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: rgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
translated: The other three are of three types.

original: thogs pa med brgyad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: thogs pa med brgyad ces bya ba la /
translated: Eight are not impeded.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The first two are only derived from natural outflow ni·π£yandaphala and the last two are only derived from retributive cause.

original: gang dag skal ba @104b mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed cing rnam par smin pa las tha dad ba rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: gang dag skal ba @104b mnyam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed cing rnam par smin pa las tha dad ba rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: Those that are generated by the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause and are different from the cause of retribution are derived from natural outflow.

original: gang dag rnam par smin ba rgyus bskyed pa de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
analyzed: gang dag rnam par smin ba rgyus bskyed pa de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
translated: Those that are generated by the cause of retribution are derived from the cause of retribution.

original: de la chos kun nas nyon mongs pa can gang dag kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed ba de dag ni skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyus bskyed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de la chos kun nas nyon mongs pa can gang dag kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed ba de dag ni skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyus bskyed pa yang yin no //
translated: Among them, those that are generated by the pervasive cause are also generated by the homogeneous cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: There are those that are generated by the homogeneous cause alone.üîΩThose that are generated by the homogeneous cause alone are the wholesome and unobscured indeterminate dharmas.üîΩThose that are generated by the pervasive cause alone are the afflicted dharmas.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: Those that are generated by the pervasive cause are also generated by the homogeneous cause.

original: dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are generated by the homogeneous cause alone are the wholesome and unobscured indeterminate dharmas.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni med de /
translated: Those that are generated by the pervasive cause alone are the afflicted dharmas.üîΩThose that are generated by the pervasive cause are also generated by the homogeneous cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thogs pa med pa rnams la rgyas ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnams la rgyas ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no increase for those that are unimpeded.

original: gzugs can rnams phan tshun thogs pas bar mtshams med par gnas ba la sogs pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams phan tshun thogs pas bar mtshams med par gnas ba la sogs pa zhes brjod de /
translated: It is said that form is impeded because it exists in a place that is not occupied by another form.

original: 'di ni thogs pa med pa dag la mi srid pas de dag la rgyas ba las byung ba med do //
