analyzed: 'di ni thogs pa med pa dag la mi srid pas de dag la rgyas ba las byung ba med do //
translated: Since that is not possible for those that are unimpeded, there is no increase for them.

original: kha cig na re rgyas pa las byung ba yod pa la yang sngon gyi rgyu'i nus pa'i mthu lhag pa las ches rgyas par skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rgyas pa las byung ba yod pa la yang sngon gyi rgyu'i nus pa'i mthu lhag pa las ches rgyas par skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that even though increase does not exist, there is a further increase from the power of the cause.

original: gzugs can rnams la yang 'phel ba dang khyad bar du 'phags pa dang yang ba zhes bshad pa de ni rgyu mthun pa bzhin du ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams la yang 'phel ba dang khyad bar du 'phags pa dang yang ba zhes bshad pa de ni rgyu mthun pa bzhin du ldan pa'o //
translated: The increase, excellence, and lightness of form are like the natural outflow of form.

original: gang zhig sngon gyi rgyu'i nus pa'i mthu ltag pa las byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa nyid la yang de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: gang zhig sngon gyi rgyu'i nus pa'i mthu ltag pa las byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa nyid la yang de ltar bshad do //
translated: That which arises from the power of the cause is explained as natural outflow.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i sgo nas skyes ba rnams ni rgyas ba las byung ba dang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir rgyas ba las byung ba yod kyang rdul phra rab bsags pa med pa'i phyir rgyasüîΩpa las byung ba zhes bya ba la brjod do //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i sgo nas skyes ba rnams ni rgyas ba las byung ba dang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir rgyas ba las byung ba yod kyang rdul phra rab bsags pa med pa'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba la brjod do //
translated: They are called enhanced because they are enhanced causes, but they are not composites of subtle particles.üîΩThe others are of three types.

original: gzhan rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis dang rnam pa gcig ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis dang rnam pa gcig ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ngo //
translated: This passage definitely indicates that they are not of two types or one type.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
translated: Those faculties that are not distinct from the maturational cause are born from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba'i dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba'i dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: Those that are not distinct from the enhanced cause are enhanced.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: The remaining faculties are born from the cause of natural outflow.

original: gzugs la sogs pa thun mong gi longs spyod rnams rnam par smin pa nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa thun mong gi longs spyod rnams rnam par smin pa nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable that form, etc., which are shared resources, are the karmic maturation of an action.üîΩThe S≈´tra master says:

original: a'akshe pa ba da ba bya t'a ni ta sya rnam par smin pa dang bdag bo'i 'bras bu yang ste /üîΩ'di @105a * //
analyzed: a'akshe pa ba da ba bya t'a ni ta sya rnam par smin pa dang bdag bo'i 'bras bu yang ste / 'di @105a * //
translated: The karmic maturation of an action is the result of the dominant result.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the dominant result.

original: rnam par smin pa la yang de ltar thun mong du longs spyad pa nyid mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la yang de ltar thun mong du longs spyad pa nyid mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: It is not contradictory that karmic maturation is also shared resources.

original: de lta na mig la sogs pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na mig la sogs pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that eyes, etc., would also be shared resources.

original: 'dod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: That is asserted.

original: sha za la sogs pa zhugs pa'i mig la sogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa 'di yang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis grub bas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: sha za la sogs pa zhugs pa'i mig la sogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa 'di yang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis grub bas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
translated: If that is so, then it would follow that the eyes, etc., of a preta that is possessed by a pi≈õƒÅca, etc., would see, etc., because they are established by the conditions of another.

original: ci ltar gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan la mthong ba byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan la mthong ba byed par 'gyur /
translated: How could the eyes of one person see the form of another?

original: gang bshad pa gang zhig dbang po'i rten de dang tha mi dad pa'i tshor ba ni longs spyod ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang bshad pa gang zhig dbang po'i rten de dang tha mi dad pa'i tshor ba ni longs spyod ces bya ste /
translated: It was explained that the feeling that is not different from the basis of the sense faculty is called shared resources.

original: 'di la thun mong ba med do //
analyzed: 'di la thun mong ba med do //
translated: There is no commonality here.

original: thun mong ba'i longs spyod nyid ni zin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams so snyam pa 'di la yang ci 'di la mthong ba la sogs pa la longs spyod du 'dod dam /
analyzed: thun mong ba'i longs spyod nyid ni zin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams so snyam pa 'di la yang ci 'di la mthong ba la sogs pa la longs spyod du 'dod dam /
translated: The common enjoyment is the appropriated form, etc. But is it claimed that the enjoyment of form, etc. is seeing, etc.?

original: 'on te tshor ba yin zhes pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te tshor ba yin zhes pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or is it feeling?

original: 'dus ma byas ni dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The unconditioned is the essence because it is virtuous and permanent.

original: 'dus byas thams cad yongs su bor bas don du gnyer ba'i phyir snying po ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad yongs su bor bas don du gnyer ba'i phyir snying po ste /
translated: Or, because it is sought as the abandonment of all conditioned phenomena.

original: gzhan dag na re rtag pa'i phyir snying po nyid rdzas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rtag pa'i phyir snying po nyid rdzas zhes bya'o //
translated: Others say that it is called the substance because it is the essence, since it is permanent.

original: gser la sogs pa bzhin gyis yod pa nyid tsam ni ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa bzhin gyis yod pa nyid tsam ni ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not mere existence, like gold, etc., because it is like form, etc.

original: 'di dag gi skad cig ma la ni rgyu mthun pa yod ba ma yin pas skad cig ma ste gang gi phyir lam gyi skad cig ma dang po ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med par skye bas rgyu mthun las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi skad cig ma la ni rgyu mthun pa yod ba ma yin pas skad cig ma ste gang gi phyir lam gyi skad cig ma dang po ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med par skye bas rgyu mthun las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the first moment of the path arises without a homogeneous cause, it does not arise from natural outcome.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos gzhan ni rgyu mthun pa las ma byung ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos gzhan ni rgyu mthun pa las ma byung ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no other conditioned phenomenon that does not arise from natural outcome.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la bltos ba med par skye ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la bltos ba med par skye ste /
translated: The moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises without regard for a homogeneous cause,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ches stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ches stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the condition as equivalent immediately preceding state is very powerful.

original: de stobs dang ldan pa nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam dang rnam pa mtshungs pa'i chos du mas gsos btab cing de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba ni don de la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de stobs dang ldan pa nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam dang rnam pa mtshungs pa'i chos du mas gsos btab cing de'i bdag nyid du gyur ba ni don de la rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its power is due to being nourished by many phenomena that are similar in aspect to the ƒÅrya‚Äôs path and becoming its nature, because it is applied to that object.

original: rgyud gcig la mig la sogs pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyud gcig la mig la sogs pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: It follows that two eyes and so on would exist in one continuum.

original: gnyi ga'i bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of both is seen.

original: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa kho na ste rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa kho na ste rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The eyes, etc. are born as the result of karma, not as the result of development.

original: slob dpon dpal len ni sgra yang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: slob dpon dpal len ni sgra yang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: The master ≈örƒ´lƒÅta says that sound is also born as the result of karma.

original: @105b gang gi phyir rgyu gzhan gyi rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin rnams so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @105b gang gi phyir rgyu gzhan gyi rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin rnams so zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they are the nature of the result of karma that has another cause.

original: rdzas spyi'i dbye ba las mig la sogs pa rnams rten dang rgyud gcig la rnam pa gnyis te de'i rgyu'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: rdzas spyi'i dbye ba las mig la sogs pa rnams rten dang rgyud gcig la rnam pa gnyis te de'i rgyu'i dbye ba las so //
translated: The eyes, etc. are twofold in terms of substance and class, because they are the result of the cause of one class.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig la rgyu mthun pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig la rgyu mthun pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eyes do not have natural outflow.

original: de'i tha dad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas 'di la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tha dad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas 'di la gnod pa med do //
translated: Because there is no cause of its distinction, there is no fault in this.

original: ci ste spyi'i rgyud mngon par brjod pa'o zhes bya ba ni skyon med do //
analyzed: ci ste spyi'i rgyud mngon par brjod pa'o zhes bya ba ni skyon med do //
translated: If it is said that the class of natural outflow is stated in general, there is no fault.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa skyed pa de'i bya ba la rnam par smin pa las skyes ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mtshungs par ldan pa skyed pa de'i bya ba la rnam par smin pa las skyes ba med pa nyid de /
translated: The eye consciousness that is generated by the eye faculty is not arisen from karmic maturation, because the eye faculty is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.üîΩThe eye faculty that is the cause that generates the eye consciousness is arisen from enhancement.üîΩThe eye faculty that is the cause that generates the eye consciousness is not arisen from karmic maturation, because it is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.üîΩThe eye faculty that is arisen from karmic maturation is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation, because it is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement.

original: mig de'i rnam par shes bskyed pa'i rgyu rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin pas rigs pa mngon bar brjod par 'dod pa ni lha'i mig go //üîΩde'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu med par thal ba las /üîΩnus pa med pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i mig ste /
analyzed: mig de'i rnam par shes bskyed pa'i rgyu rgyas pa las byung ba ma yin pas rigs pa mngon bar brjod par 'dod pa ni lha'i mig go // de'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu med par thal ba las / nus pa med pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i mig ste /
translated: The eye faculty that is arisen from karmic maturation is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement, because it is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.üîΩThe eye faculty that is arisen from enhancement is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement, because it is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.üîΩThe eye faculty that is arisen from enhancement is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation, because it is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba med par de'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod ces ba gnyi ga der pa skyed pa las nus pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba med par de'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod ces ba gnyi ga der pa skyed pa las nus pa dang ldan no //
translated: The eye faculty that is arisen from enhancement is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement, because it is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.

original: dbang po rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The eye faculty that is arisen from karmic maturation is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement, because it is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.

original: gnyis khas blangs ba la kha cig chos nyid kyis yod do //
analyzed: gnyis khas blangs ba la kha cig chos nyid kyis yod do //
translated: The eye faculty that is arisen from enhancement is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement, because it is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.üîΩThe eye faculty that is arisen from karmic maturation is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement, because it is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.üîΩThe eye faculty that is arisen from enhancement is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement, because it is a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from karmic maturation.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: The eye faculty that is arisen from karmic maturation is not a cause that generates the eye consciousness that is arisen from enhancement, because it is not

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i rgyu'i phyir sgra rnam par smin pa las skyes ba zhes bya ba sngar nyid du de la so sor byas te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i rgyu'i phyir sgra rnam par smin pa las skyes ba zhes bya ba sngar nyid du de la so sor byas te /
translated: Sound is called arisen from karmic maturation because it is the result of karmic maturation.

original: 'dod ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir lus kyi rnam par rig byed bzhin du sgra yang rnam par smin pa ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir lus kyi rnam par rig byed bzhin du sgra yang rnam par smin pa ma yin zhes bya ste /
translated: But it is not karmic maturation because it is not homogeneous since it is not conjoined to the mind and it does not conform to desire realm beings, like the body‚Äôs informative form.

original: rgyu'i chos thams cad 'bras bu la 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos thams cad 'bras bu la 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The cause of all phenomena does not transform into the result.

original: gzhan du na sgra'i rgyu nyid rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid kyis der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sgra'i rgyu nyid rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid kyis der 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the cause of sound would be arisen from karmic maturation.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyang rnam par smin ba ma yin pa las skye ba'i rgyu la 'gal lo //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams na zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyang rnam par smin ba ma yin pa las skye ba'i rgyu la 'gal lo // 'dod pa'i khams na zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is contradictory that that which is arisen from karmic maturation is the cause of that which is not arisen from karmic maturation.

original: chos 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang ldan la /
analyzed: chos 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang ldan la /
translated: In the desire realm, one possesses past and future virtuous and afflicted states,

original: da ltar byung ba ni lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
translated: but one possesses present neutral states alone.

original: lung bstan min thob lhan cig ste //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung bstan min thob lhan cig ste // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the non-learner‚Äôs faculties when obtaining the state of non-learner.

original: 'dod pa'i khams smos pa ni gzugs kyi khams rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams smos pa ni gzugs kyi khams rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúin the desire realm‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the form realm.

original: rim pa smos ba ni rdzus te skye ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa smos ba ni rdzus te skye ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúin order‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding miraculous birth.üîΩBecause the state of kalala and so on is from the state of conception

original: gang gi phyir nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni nying mtshams sbyor pa'i gnas skabs nas bzung nas @106a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ni nying mtshams sbyor pa'i gnas skabs nas bzung nas @106a * //
translated: up to the state of death.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa kho na yin gyi mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa kho na yin gyi mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: The eye consciousness is definitely virtuous or afflicted, but the eye element is not.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe mig gi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe mig gi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob kyi /
translated: Therefore, when one who does not possess the eye element obtains it,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: one does not obtain the eye consciousness element,

original: sngar kho na nas ldan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar kho na nas ldan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one already possesses it.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas zhes bshad do //
translated: Those born in the formless realm do not possess either, so it is said they die and transmigrate from the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa smos pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa smos pa ni /
translated: The second absorption and so on are mentionedüîΩbecause the eye consciousness and so on do not exist there.

original: de na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir skye ba na zhes bya ba srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs su de dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba lta bar byed do //
analyzed: de na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir skye ba na zhes bya ba srid pa bar ma'i gnas skabs su de dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba lta bar byed do //
translated: When one is born in the second absorption and so on, one sees the intermediate existence state in the second absorption and so forth because one is not incomplete in faculties.

original: de dag mig gi khams dang ni mi ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag mig gi khams dang ni mi ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not exist without the eye element

original: de dag dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not incomplete in faculties.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni de'i sa med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni de'i sa med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed de /
translated: They manifest the neutral eye consciousness of the first absorption level because that level does not exist there.

original: de'i phyir lta ba'i tshe kho na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa 'thob kyi mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lta ba'i tshe kho na mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa 'thob kyi mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: one obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.

original: de dag nas shi 'phos nas sa 'og mar skye ba na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag nas shi 'phos nas sa 'og mar skye ba na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas shi 'phos nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nam 'dod ba'i khams su skye ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas shi 'phos nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nam 'dod ba'i khams su skye ba ste /
translated: When one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,

original: de ni mig gi khams dang ldan zin pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de ni mig gi khams dang ldan zin pa kho na yin la /
translated: one obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams khon dang mi ldan pa las /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams khon dang mi ldan pa las /
translated: one obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.

original: srid pa bar ma do'i gnas skabs su ldan pa 'thob po //üîΩgzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma do'i gnas skabs su ldan pa 'thob po // gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: When one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.üîΩWhen one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,üîΩone obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.

original: de ni sngar nas gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa las tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nam 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba na cig car ldan pa 'thob po //
analyzed: de ni sngar nas gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa las tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nam 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba na cig car ldan pa 'thob po //
translated: When one dies in the second absorption and is born in the Brahma world or the desire realm,

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: one obtains the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas de nyid du skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas de nyid du skye ba na'o //
translated: When one dies in the formless realm and is reborn there, and when one dies in the Brahma world and is reborn there.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su yang mig thob pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su yang mig thob pa nyams pa'o //
translated: In the desire realm, one obtains the eye sense faculty when it was not previously obtained.

original: mu dang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mu dang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The first possibility is when one is born in the second absorption and so on.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa ni mig gi khams kho na dang @106b ldan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa ni mig gi khams kho na dang @106b ldan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mngon du mi byed do //
translated: One born in the second absorption and so on possesses the eye element alone but does not manifest eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin te rang gi sa pa med pa'i phyir dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yang mngon du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin te rang gi sa pa med pa'i phyir dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yang mngon du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not possess eye consciousness because it does not exist in its level and because eye consciousness of the first absorption level is not manifest.

original: mu gnyis pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The second possibility is when one is born in the desire realm.

original: de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa kho na dang ldan gyi mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mig gi rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa kho na dang ldan gyi mig gi khams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: One possesses future eye consciousness alone but not the eye element.

original: ma thob pa ni dmus long ngo //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni dmus long ngo //
translated: Non-acquisition is like a person born blind.

original: nyams pa ni mig la gnod pa byas pas long ba'o //
analyzed: nyams pa ni mig la gnod pa byas pas long ba'o //
translated: Diminution is like a person whose eyes are damaged.

original: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa ni de na dbang po mched pa med pa'i phyir mig ma thob pa dang nyams pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa ni de na dbang po mched pa med pa'i phyir mig ma thob pa dang nyams pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: One born in the first absorption is not said to be non-obtainer or diminisher of eyes because the sense faculties do not increase there.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par skyes pa ste de ni gnyi ga dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par skyes pa ste de ni gnyi ga dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The fourth is the opposite of those, that is, one born in the formless realm, who does not possess both.

original: de bzhin du mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dag dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dag dang zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: Similarly, it is extensively stated:

original: gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin nam zhe na 'di la ni mu bzhi med do //
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin nam zhe na 'di la ni mu bzhi med do //
translated: If one obtains the eye element, does one also obtain the form element? There are no four possibilities here.

original: 'o na ci zhe na tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na tshig phyi ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: What then? It is connected to the following words.

original: gang gzugs kyi khams dang mi ldan pa thob pa de mig gi khams dang yin te /
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi khams dang mi ldan pa thob pa de mig gi khams dang yin te /
translated: One who obtains the form element also obtains the eye element.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na'o //üîΩmig gi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa yin gyi sngan sa ldan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams dang ma yin pa yod de rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su skye ba na'o // mig gi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa yin gyi sngan sa ldan pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams dang ma yin pa yod de rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa'o //
translated: When one dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm or form realm.üîΩOne obtains the eye element but not the form element because one previously possessed it.üîΩOne who possesses the eye element also possesses the form element.

original: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin nam zhe na 'dir yang mu bzhi mi rigs te /üîΩ'on ci zhe na tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yin nam zhe na 'dir yang mu bzhi mi rigs te / 'on ci zhe na tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: But one may possess the form element alone, not the eye element, when one obtains the eye faculty gradually.

original: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin no //
analyzed: gang mig gi khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin no //
translated: One who possesses the eye element also possesses the form element.

original: gzugs kyi khams kho na dang yin gyi mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de mig ma thob pa dang nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kho na dang yin gyi mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de mig ma thob pa dang nyams pa'o //
translated: But one may possess the form element alone, not the eye element, when one does not obtain the eye faculty or it degenerates.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin na /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin na /
translated: One who obtains eye consciousness but not the eye element also obtains the form element.

original: der mu bzhi ste mu dang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pan sa shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
analyzed: der mu bzhi ste mu dang po ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pan sa shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
translated: There are four possibilities: The first possibility is when one is born in the second absorption and so on and manifest eye consciousness, or when one is born in the desire realm or the world of Brahma after death in the second absorption and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag tu skye ba na ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag tu skye ba na ste /
translated: The second possibility is when one is born in the second absorption and so on after death in the formless realm.

original: de ni gzugs kyi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob kyi /üîΩ@107a * // mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi khams kho na dang mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob kyi / @107a * // mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ni ma yin te /
translated: One obtains the form realm but not the eye consciousness element.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa sa pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not obtain the eye consciousness element because eye consciousness of the second absorption and so on does not exist.

original: mu gsum pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan dang po dag tu skye ba na ste /
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan dang po dag tu skye ba na ste /
translated: The third possibility is when one is born in the first absorption after death in the formless realm.

original: de ni gzugs kyi khams dang mi ldan pa 'thob la /
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi khams dang mi ldan pa 'thob la /
translated: One obtains the form realm but not the eye consciousness element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yang yin no //
translated: and also the eye consciousness element.

original: mu bzhi pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa de nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa de dag de nas shi 'phos nas de dag nyid du skye pa'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa de nas shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa de dag de nas shi 'phos nas de dag nyid du skye pa'o //
translated: The fourth alternative is when one is born in the formless realm, dies from there and is born there itself, and when one is born in the desire realm or the first absorption and dies from there and is born there itself.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is one who possesses the eye consciousness element also one who possesses the form element?

original: 'dir yang tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: Here, the former term is applied.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin te /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi khams dang yang yin te /
translated: One who possesses the eye consciousness element is also one who possesses the form element.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na'o //
translated: This is because one born in the desire realm or the first absorption and one born in the second absorption and so on who manifest eye consciousness possess the eye consciousness element and the form element.

original: gzugs kyi khams kho na dang yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kho na dang yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a person who has the element of form but not the element of consciousness.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa na'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du mi byed pa na'o //
translated: This is when one manifests eye consciousness in the second absorption and so on.

original: dmus long 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba na /
analyzed: dmus long 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba na /
translated: A person born blind in the desire realm

original: de'i sa pa las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams 'thob bo //üîΩde ltar srid pa 'chol ba yongs su spang ba'am /
analyzed: de'i sa pa las gzhan pa'i srid pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams 'thob bo // de ltar srid pa 'chol ba yongs su spang ba'am /
translated: obtains the element of eye consciousness of a different level.üîΩThus the order of existence should be posited through the power of karmic maturation and so on,

original: rnam par smin pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis srid pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis srid pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes so //
translated: in order to completely abandon the confused order of existence.

original: a'a kshe pa ba da 'di la yang dgongs pa mi shes te /
analyzed: a'a kshe pa ba da 'di la yang dgongs pa mi shes te /
translated: ƒÄk·π£epavada also does not understand the intention here.

original: gal te dmus long skye ba las sngar gzhan du med de khyad par las byung ba'i don med do //
analyzed: gal te dmus long skye ba las sngar gzhan du med de khyad par las byung ba'i don med do //
translated: If a person born blind did not exist previously in another life, then the meaning of arising would be meaningless.

original: skye ba na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'thob pa ma yin te sngon nyid du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba na mig gi rnam par shes pa 'thob pa ma yin te sngon nyid du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When born, eye consciousness is not obtained because it is already possessed.

original: sred pa'i dbang gis srid pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis skye ba rnam par gzhag pa 'di la mi 'thad pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: sred pa'i dbang gis srid pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis skye ba rnam par gzhag pa 'di la mi 'thad pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is unreasonable about positing the realms of existence due to craving and positing birth due to the power of evolution?

original: nang gi bcu gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nang gi bcu gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The twelve internal are stated.

original: 'di ci zhig tu gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig tu gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: What is this?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang nges par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang nges par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in both ways.

original: 'dis gzhan dag phyi'i zhes bya ba bshad @107b par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis gzhan dag phyi'i zhes bya ba bshad @107b par 'gyur ro //
translated: The other are external.

original: grangs tsam zhig bstan pas khyad par rtogs par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir bcu gnyis gang dag ce na zhes dris so //
analyzed: grangs tsam zhig bstan pas khyad par rtogs par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir bcu gnyis gang dag ce na zhes dris so //
translated: Since the mere number is stated, the distinction is not understood, so he asks, ‚ÄúWhich twelve?‚Äù

original: de dmigs kyi sa dgar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dmigs kyi sa dgar ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to distinguish the internal,

original: gzugs la sogs ma gtogs zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs ma gtogs zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúexcluding form, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag gi dbang du byas pas na nang gi ste /
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas pas na nang gi ste /
translated: The internal is so called because it is taken as the self.

original: nang gi nyid ni nang gi'o //
analyzed: nang gi nyid ni nang gi'o //
translated: The internal is internal.

original: bdag med na ji ltar nang gi'am phyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag med na ji ltar nang gi'am phyir 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no self, how can there be internal or external?

original: tshul khrims med par ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi lhag par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims med par ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi lhag par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, without morality, the higher morality would not be higher.

original: sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The mind is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù as it is extensively stated.

original: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi ngar 'dzin pa'i rten la bdag ces brjod de /üîΩ'di ltar bdag gi yon tan nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi ngar 'dzin pa'i rten la bdag ces brjod de / 'di ltar bdag gi yon tan nyid dam /
translated: The basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù of those who advocate a self is called ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: bdag gi yul can nyid du rtog pas kyang 'dzin pa 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag gi yul can nyid du rtog pas kyang 'dzin pa 'jug go //
translated: Thus, the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù occurs through the conception of the self‚Äôs qualities or the self‚Äôs object.

original: ngar 'dzin pa yang sems la brten te de las ma gtogs pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa yang sems la brten te de las ma gtogs pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is based on the mind, because there is no self apart from that.

original: 'di la bdag tu nga rgyal bzhag pas na sems kho na bdag yin la /
analyzed: 'di la bdag tu nga rgyal bzhag pas na sems kho na bdag yin la /
translated: The mind itself is the self, because the pride of self is posited on it.

original: sems las byung ba rnams dang sems la brten pa'i phyir sems kho na la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams dang sems la brten pa'i phyir sems kho na la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: The mind alone is designated as the self, because the mental factors and the body are based on the mind.

original: 'dir sems la bdag tu 'dogs so zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar rtogs she na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir sems la bdag tu 'dogs so zhes bya ba 'di yang ji ltar rtogs she na de'i phyir /
translated: How is it understood that the self is designated on the mind?

original: mkhas pas bdag nyid dul bas ni //
analyzed: mkhas pas bdag nyid dul bas ni //
translated: The wise one is disciplined by the self.

original: zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: 'di yang lung gzhan la bltos te don de nyid kyi shes byed yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang lung gzhan la bltos te don de nyid kyi shes byed yin gyi /
translated: This is also a proof of that meaning in dependence on another scripture.

original: yan gar ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan las zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: yan gar ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan las zhes rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not independent, the BhagavƒÅn extensively declares, ‚ÄúIn another scripture it is said.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'di las ni /
analyzed: 'di las ni /
translated: Here,

original: sems dul bas ni bde ba 'dren //
analyzed: sems dul bas ni bde ba 'dren //
translated: a tamed mind leads to happiness.

original: zhes sems dul ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes sems dul ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is stated that a tamed mind is the self.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bdag gi sgra sems kho na la mngon par bzhed do zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bdag gi sgra sems kho na la mngon par bzhed do zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the word ‚Äúself‚Äù here is intended to refer to the mind alone.

original: bdag nyid legs par dul ba yi //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par dul ba yi //
translated: The wise who tame themselves

original: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
translated: attain the higher realms.

original: zhes so // rten gyi dngos por nye bar gyur ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes so // rten gyi dngos por nye bar gyur ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn declares that the self is the mind because the mind is the basis of the self.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams la gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa ngag yo de pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams la gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa ngag yo de pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since the eyes and so on are not the self, what is the basis of the self?

original: sems yul na mi gnas pa'i rten gyi dngos po gang zhig yong ce na /
analyzed: sems yul na mi gnas pa'i rten gyi dngos po gang zhig yong ce na /
translated: Since the mind does not abide in objects, what is the basis of the mind?

original: khyad par gang zhig yod na sems de dag 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed par 'gyur la /üîΩde dag 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa las kyang rnam par shes pa de yul na mi gnas kyang mig la @108a * //
analyzed: khyad par gang zhig yod na sems de dag 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed par 'gyur la / de dag 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa las kyang rnam par shes pa de yul na mi gnas kyang mig la @108a * //
translated: What is the difference? Those minds are subsequent to the change.

original: sogs pa dag kho na la mngon gyi /
analyzed: sogs pa dag kho na la mngon gyi /
translated: And from the subsequent change, consciousness does not exist in the object, but it is manifest in the eye faculty, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not manifest in form, etc.

original: 'di ltar tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni lus gyi yul la yongs su gcod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni lus gyi yul la yongs su gcod kyi /
translated: Thus, that feeling associated with pleasure and pain is determined in relation to the object of the body,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi phyogs la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi phyogs la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in relation to the object of form, etc.

original: de'i phyir khyad par 'di las mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyur khyad par med kyang rten nyid dang yul nyid du 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par 'di las mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyur khyad par med kyang rten nyid dang yul nyid du 'grub pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, although there is no difference between the eye faculty, etc. and form, etc. in terms of being causes that generate consciousness, they are established as the basis and object, respectively.

original: de'i phyir nang gi dang phyi'i nyid kyang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi dang phyi'i nyid kyang yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are internal and external, respectively.

original: 'di la skyed pa dang gnas pa gcig dang 'gog pa 'bras bu gcig la sogs pa rnams la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la skyed pa dang gnas pa gcig dang 'gog pa 'bras bu gcig la sogs pa rnams la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the mind and mental factors that are generated, endure, and cease in the same result?

original: gnas brtan 'dus bzang ni /
analyzed: gnas brtan 'dus bzang ni /
translated: The elder Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: sems la nang dang sems las byung ba rnams la phyi zhes zer ro //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa yul gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ring ba nyid phyi'i rgyu dang / mig la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir nye ba nyid dang nang nyid du bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sems la nang dang sems las byung ba rnams la phyi zhes zer ro // gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ring ba nyid phyi'i rgyu dang / mig la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i rten gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir nye ba nyid dang nang nyid du bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: The mind is internal and mental factors are external.üîΩIsn‚Äôt it explained that form and so on are distant because they are the nature of objects and the eye and so on are near and internal because they are the basis of the mind and mental factors?

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rgyud du yongs su dri ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rgyud du yongs su dri ba ni /
translated: The question is asked in the context of the explanation that the mind and mental factors are internal and external.

original: gzhung kha bskang ba 'ba' zhig tu mngon te /
analyzed: gzhung kha bskang ba 'ba' zhig tu mngon te /
translated: It appears to be a mere addition to the text.

original: gang bshad pa sems las byung ba rnams kho na su ta re /
analyzed: gang bshad pa sems las byung ba rnams kho na su ta re /
translated: The mental factors alone are stated to be external.

original: nang nyid dang sems kyi rten nyid du nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yang ma 'brel ba lta bur mngon no //
analyzed: nang nyid dang sems kyi rten nyid du nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yang ma 'brel ba lta bur mngon no //
translated: and it is also the support of the mind.

original: gang gi phyir phan 'dogs pa nye ba dang ring ba nyid kyis nang dang phyi rol du 'dod na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phan 'dogs pa nye ba dang ring ba nyid kyis nang dang phyi rol du 'dod na /
translated: But this is not a proper explanation, because if internal and external are accepted as being due to proximity and distance of benefit,

original: mig la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i rten gyi dngos pos phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis nye ba dang nang zhes brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i rten gyi dngos pos phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis nye ba dang nang zhes brjod par bya zhing /
translated: then the eyes, etc., are the proximate and internal supports because they are the uncommon supports,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni yul gyi ngo bos phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi ring pa dang phyi rol te de ltar rgya cher rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni yul gyi ngo bos phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi ring pa dang phyi rol te de ltar rgya cher rnam par bshad do //
translated: and form, etc., are the distant and external objects because they are the objects.

original: gang yang sems gang ci yang rung ba ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir thams cad nang yin no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang sems gang ci yang rung ba ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir thams cad nang yin no zhes pa ni /
translated: And the statement that all minds are internal because they are the support of the view of the transitory aggregates is not a proper explanation.

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir sems su gdags par mi rung ste /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir sems su gdags par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not proper to designate the mind as the support of the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: bdag gi yul ni ngar 'dzin pa'o zhes bdag tu smra ba rnams la rab tu grags pas de nyid kyi phyir de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: bdag gi yul ni ngar 'dzin pa'o zhes bdag tu smra ba rnams la rab tu grags pas de nyid kyi phyir de ltar bshad do //
translated: Since the object of the view of self is well known to the proponents of self as the self, it is explained in that way.

original: bdag gi dngos po yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir sems la bdag tu nye bar btags te /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir sems la bdag tu nye bar btags te /
translated: Also, the entity of the self is imputed to the mind as the self because it is the basis of the conception of the self.

original: de'i phyir nang dang phyi rol @108b tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang dang phyi rol @108b tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore it is posited as internal and external.

original: gang yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir thams cad nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu med pas ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir sems la bdag ces btags pas bdag tu ni mi 'gyur te de'i ngang bzhin gzhan yinüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir thams cad nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu med pas ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir sems la bdag ces btags pas bdag tu ni mi 'gyur te de'i ngang bzhin gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, it is not the self because it is imputed to the mind as the self because it is the basis of the conception of the self, since there is no cause for the distinction that all are concomitant with affliction such as attachment.

original: gzhan la yang bdag tu 'dzin pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan la yang bdag tu 'dzin pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in conceiving the other as the self.

original: padma can bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir de'i sems nyon mongs pa can kho nar 'gyur ba no pa tsar++ya te /
analyzed: padma can bzhin 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir de'i sems nyon mongs pa can kho nar 'gyur ba no pa tsar++ya te /
translated: Because the mind is the basis of attachment, etc., like the lotus, it is defiled by them.

original: de ltar yul la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar yul la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the mind is established as the object.

original: sa ae p'a ha sa ta ta ma bdag de yang ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir sems ni rtag tu yul la na ta ti 'di 'ga' zhig gi tshe yul med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu ni ma yin te sems las byung ba
analyzed: sa ae p'a ha sa ta ta ma bdag de yang ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir sems ni rtag tu yul la na ta ti 'di 'ga' zhig gi tshe yul med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu ni ma yin te sems las byung ba
translated: And that self is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù so the mind is always the object. It is not like this: ‚ÄúAt some time, the mind is without an object.‚Äù

original: rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that this consequence applies to mental factors as well,

original: (nye bar mi srid do//) yid sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / gcig (de nyid /
analyzed: (nye bar mi srid do//) yid sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / gcig (de nyid /
translated: we reply: No, because the mind precedes them, and because it is said that the mind alone is the basis of conduct.

original: smras / rtag tu/) pur spyod par gsungs pa'i phyir thal ba med do //
analyzed: smras / rtag tu/) pur spyod par gsungs pa'i phyir thal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no consequence.

original: de la brten pa kho na yul du 'gyur ba'i phyir sems las byung ba rnams kyang sems dul bas dul bar bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa kho na yul du 'gyur ba'i phyir sems las byung ba rnams kyang sems dul bas dul bar bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because the mental factors are based on the mind, they are taught to be disciplined when the mind is disciplined.

original: nges par bstan pa 'di rnams ni sems gtso bo ste pra ti r'u pa k'a ni sems las byung pa rnams yul rnams la pa ta ta ma pra ti she dha k'a ni bstan du bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par bstan pa 'di rnams ni sems gtso bo ste pra ti r'u pa k'a ni sems las byung pa rnams yul rnams la pa ta ta ma pra ti she dha k'a ni bstan du bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: These teachings are definitely about the mind being primary. The pratƒ´rupaka are mental factors, and the pratƒ´≈õe·π£a are not the primary reasons for the teachings.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: sa ta ta ma ta na ts'aryam ba lang gi sgra bzhin chags te /
analyzed: sa ta ta ma ta na ts'aryam ba lang gi sgra bzhin chags te /
translated: It is like the sound of a cow, continuously engaging in conduct.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan la sgra'i rgyu mtshan yod kyang mi 'jug pa de'i phyir sems sems (rgya dpe na ti med/) las byung ba rnams la thal ba 'dir yang (rtag tu /üîΩgnas pa / rnam shes/) ni b'ar++ya:gang yang sems las byung ba rnams kyang bdag dang (rtag tu /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan la sgra'i rgyu mtshan yod kyang mi 'jug pa de'i phyir sems sems (rgya dpe na ti med/) las byung ba rnams la thal ba 'dir yang (rtag tu / gnas pa / rnam shes/) ni b'ar++ya:gang yang sems las byung ba rnams kyang bdag dang (rtag tu /
translated: Because even when there are other reasons for sound, it does not engage, therefore for mental factors, this consequence does not apply.

original: 'dod pa'am bzhed pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'am bzhed pa /
translated: Also, mental factors are not the self, nor are they the desire or wish.

original: spyod ba min/) 'jig tshogs la lta ba ci yis she na /
analyzed: spyod ba min/) 'jig tshogs la lta ba ci yis she na /
translated: By what is the view of the transitory collection?

original: de ltar yang nye bar len pa'i phung po'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang nye bar len pa'i phung po'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the appropriated aggregates as its object.

original: 'dir rten dang dmigs pa'i ngo bos ngar 'dzin pa'i rten nyid sems la 'dod kyi dmigs pa'i ngo bo kho nas ma yin pa sems las byung ba rnams la ngar 'dzin pa'i rten nyid med do //
analyzed: 'dir rten dang dmigs pa'i ngo bos ngar 'dzin pa'i rten nyid sems la 'dod kyi dmigs pa'i ngo bo kho nas ma yin pa sems las byung ba rnams la ngar 'dzin pa'i rten nyid med do //
translated: Here, the mind is accepted as the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù by the nature of its support and object, but not by the nature of its object alone. Mental factors do not have the nature of being the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: gal te nang gi mig la sogs pa dag rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos po yin na /
analyzed: gal te nang gi mig la sogs pa dag rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos po yin na /
translated: If the internal eye, etc. are the basis of consciousness,
