analyzed: de lta 'o na rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: then the six elements of consciousness would not exist.

original: de dag yid kyi @109a * //
analyzed: de dag yid kyi @109a * //
translated: They are not the mind element.

original: khams nyid du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba ni drug po 'das ma thag pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: khams nyid du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba ni drug po 'das ma thag pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa'o //
translated: They are not the mind element because they are not the mind that is not the six sense organs.

original: da ltar byung ba'am ma 'ongs pa ni sems kyi rten ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'am ma 'ongs pa ni sems kyi rten ma yin te /
translated: The present and future are not the basis of the mind because

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa 'das pa'i gnas skabs ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa 'das pa'i gnas skabs ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: the state of the immediately preceding condition that has just ceased is not established as the element of eye consciousness, etc.

original: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: The immediately preceding condition that has just ceased is the mind element.

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: That consciousness is the mental faculty.

original: zhes de'i tshe yid kyi khams nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes de'i tshe yid kyi khams nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it is established as the mental faculty.

original: gang gi tshe yin pa de'i tshe na yang zhes bya ba la 'das pa'am da ltar byung ba yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yin pa de'i tshe na yang zhes bya ba la 'das pa'am da ltar byung ba yin yang rung ste /
translated: When it is that, it is also past or present.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa de dag ste yid kyi khams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la sogs pa de dag ste yid kyi khams ni ma yin no //
translated: Those are the eye consciousness element, etc., but not the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa 'das pa la ni sngar ma byung ba'i yid kyi khams nyid du 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'das pa la ni sngar ma byung ba'i yid kyi khams nyid du 'gyur pa'am /
translated: For the past consciousness, the mental faculty would not have existed previously,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams nyid sngar yod pa'am ldog pa med de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams nyid sngar yod pa'am ldog pa med de /
translated: or the eye consciousness element, etc., would not have existed previously or would not cease.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos pos yid kyi khams su 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos pos yid kyi khams su 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness itself is posited as the mental faculty by the state of being the basis of another consciousness.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi khams kyi mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: Therefore, it does not go beyond the definition of the mental faculty.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: If it were not so, it would be said.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa yid kyi khams su mi 'gyur na ni 'das pa yang yid kyi khams dang mig la sogs pa'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa yid kyi khams su mi 'gyur na ni 'das pa yang yid kyi khams dang mig la sogs pa'i shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the present and future consciousnesses were not the mental element, then the past consciousnesses would not be the mental element or the eye consciousnesses, etc.

original: de lta yin na yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin na yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If that were so, the past mental element alone would exist.

original: gal te yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi khams 'das pa kho na yin par gyur na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the past mental element alone existed, what would be the problem?

original: de'i phyir khams bco brgyad po dag ni zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir khams bco brgyad po dag ni zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said: The eighteen elements are stated.

original: yang ci'i phyir de ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it asserted in that way?

original: de'i phyir gal te yang rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te yang rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said: If the future consciousnesses were not the mental element, etc.

original: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni mtshan nyid ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni mtshan nyid ni dus rnams su 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of that is explained: The characteristic is that it is not confused about the times.

original: 'khrul pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa gzhan dag yin pa da ltar byung ba gzhan dag yin la 'das pa gzhan yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa gzhan dag yin pa da ltar byung ba gzhan dag yin la 'das pa gzhan yin pa ste /
translated: Delusion is not the same in the future, not the same in the present, and not the same in the past.

original: thams cad 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: All effort would be pointless.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la yang so dh'a khya ni ru p'a khya dve n'a n'a (de dus bshad pa nye bar bshad pa med pa nyid kyi/) mtshan nyid @109b mi mthun pa'i phyir phan tshun 'jug pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la yang so dh'a khya ni ru p'a khya dve n'a n'a (de dus bshad pa nye bar bshad pa med pa nyid kyi/) mtshan nyid @109b mi mthun pa'i phyir phan tshun 'jug pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not logical for things and nonthings to be mutually related, because they are incompatible, like light and darkness.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa rnams rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos po rang bzhin du dus thams cad du yod pas de ni 'das pa rnams la 'khrul pa med do zhes bshad do //üîΩdrug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa rnams rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten gyi dngos po rang bzhin du dus thams cad du yod pas de ni 'das pa rnams la 'khrul pa med do zhes bshad do // drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: Since the consciousnesses of that person would always exist as the intrinsic nature of the basis of another consciousness, it is said that there is no delusion regarding the past.üîΩThe immediately preceding six consciousnesses

original: rnam shes dang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes dang yin de yid do //
translated: are the mental faculty.

original: zhes so // chos zhes bya ba ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes so // chos zhes bya ba ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The so-called phenomena are those that are associated.

original: rten dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba ste lhag ma ni /
analyzed: rten dang bcas pa kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba ste lhag ma ni /
translated: The term ‚Äúonly‚Äù is for the sake of emphasis.

original: de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa dag kyang yin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rest are similar to that.

original: 'di ni rten dang bcas pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni rten dang bcas pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: This is the definition of an object that is possessed.

original: yul gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi yul du nges la /
analyzed: yul gang zhig rnam par shes pa gang gi yul du nges la /
translated: An object is possessed when it is ascertained as the object of a consciousness.

original: de lta yin dang ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni chos kyi khams thun mong ma yin pa'i yul du nges pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni chos kyi khams thun mong ma yin pa'i yul du nges pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: If that were not so, then how could the mental consciousness be ascertained as the object of the element of mental objects alone?

original: gal te de la rnam par shes pa de skyes pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de la rnam par shes pa de skyes pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: If consciousness arises in regard to that, then it is said to be possessed.

original: skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i chos can las khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i chos can las khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúthat which has the nature of arising‚Äù is used to distinguish it from that which does not have the nature of arising.

original: de ltar na de ni yul gzung ba 'dzin par 'gyur bas rten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni yul gzung ba 'dzin par 'gyur bas rten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called ‚Äúpossessed‚Äù because it is the object of a consciousness that grasps an object.

original: gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The term ‚Äúmental consciousness‚Äù is used in the verse because it is the mental consciousness that grasps the object.

original: yid ni shes bya ma lus pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid ni shes bya ma lus pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The mental faculty is the subject of all objects of knowledge.

original: gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa ma skyes pa'am skye bar mi 'gyur pa'i chos kyi khams dus gsum ba'am dus med pa gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa ma skyes pa'am skye bar mi 'gyur pa'i chos kyi khams dus gsum ba'am dus med pa gang yin pa de ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no element of mental objects that is not the object of the infinite mental consciousness, whether it is past, future, or not subject to time.

original: mtha' yas ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su bgrang du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su bgrang du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Infinite means that it is not fully enumerated.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / shin tu nye ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / shin tu nye ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not focus on its own nature or on its coexistent states, because it is contradictory for something to act on itself, because it is the same object, and because it is too close.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba smos pas mtshungs par ldan pa yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba smos pas mtshungs par ldan pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: The term coexistent also includes the associated states.

original: 'o na khams bcos rgyad pa thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na khams bcos rgyad pa thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If all the elements are the object of the consciousness that knows selflessness,

original: chos kyi khams bzhin du rten pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi khams bzhin du rten pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur te /
translated: then like the element of mental objects, they would be supported.

original: de dag ni rang gi byed pa la bltos nas rten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang gi yul gyi byed pas zhes yul smos pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i rten la sogs @110a * //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi byed pa la bltos nas rten pa dang bcas pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro // rang gi yul gyi byed pas zhes yul smos pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i rten la sogs @110a * //
translated: They are said to be ‚Äúdependent‚Äù in relation to their own activity, and they are established as being ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù to that.

original: pa'i dngos po'i byed pa gzhan bzlog pa'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i dngos po'i byed pa gzhan bzlog pa'i don to //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúobject‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúby the activity of their own object‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding other activities of the support, etc., of a homogeneous cause.

original: gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gag pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gag pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú Forms that have not been seen cease‚Äù means that

original: mig da ltar ba ni 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir 'gag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mig da ltar ba ni 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir 'gag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the present eye is said to ‚Äúcease‚Äù because it is about to cease.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi byed pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi byed pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The activity of impermanence is present.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'gag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'gag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The future is said to ‚Äúcease‚Äù because it has the quality of arising.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar ji ltar skye ba de bzhin du 'gag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar ji ltar skye ba de bzhin du 'gag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Without a doubt, it will cease in the same way that it arises.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Associated with consciousness‚Äù means

original: ji ltar mig da ltar ba 'ga' zhig ni rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar mig da ltar ba 'ga' zhig ni rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Just as some eyes that exist in the present are associated with consciousness,

original: 'ga' zhig ni mi ldan pa yin pa de bzhin du mi skye ba'i chos can yang yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni mi ldan pa yin pa de bzhin du mi skye ba'i chos can yang yin no //
translated: and some are not associated with consciousness, so it is with those that are not subject to arising.

original: yid ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho na de dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: yid ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho na de dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The mind is just like that, for it is not subject to arising.

original: skyes pa gdon mi za bar dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa gdon mi za bar dmigs pa 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is certain that what has arisen apprehends an object.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa skye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa skye ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For there is no arising of consciousness without an object.

original: rang gi dbang po'i byed pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi dbang po'i byed pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the operation of its own organ‚Äù means

original: dbang po'i byed pa smos pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa'i byed pa bsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa smos pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa'i byed pa bsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the operation of the organ is mentioned in order to exclude the operation of homogeneous immediate conditions, etc.

original: dri la sogs pa ni gang dag gcig gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa ni gang dag gcig gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nose, etc., are not like that‚Äù means

original: res 'ga' zhig rkyen nye na de dag nyid gzhan gyi sna la sogs pa'i yul du skyes nas de dag gi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig rkyen nye na de dag nyid gzhan gyi sna la sogs pa'i yul du skyes nas de dag gi rnam par shes pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: that sometimes, when the conditions are present, those very odors, etc., arise as objects of another‚Äôs nose, etc., and generate consciousness of them.

original: gal te chos kyi khams kyang thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rgyud du ma'i dbang gis rten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa nyid du ci'i phyir rnam par mi 'jog ce na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi khams kyang thun mong yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rgyud du ma'i dbang gis rten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa nyid du ci'i phyir rnam par mi 'jog ce na /
translated: If the element of dharmas is also shared, why is it not determined to be possessed of support and similar to form, etc. due to the power of many mindstreams?

original: gzugs ni da ltar byung ba kho na mthong gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang mi skye ba'i chos can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni da ltar byung ba kho na mthong gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang mi skye ba'i chos can ni ma yin te /
translated: Form is seen only in the present, not in the past or future or as a phenomenon that will not arise.

original: reg bya'i bar du yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: reg bya'i bar du yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Up to tactility is also like that.

original: da ltar byung ba'i reg bya kho na la reg gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ni skye ba'i chos can la ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i reg bya kho na la reg gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ni skye ba'i chos can la ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: Tactility is only contacted in the present, not in the past or future or as a phenomenon that will arise.

original: de'i phyir gzugs rnams kyi rten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo rgyud kyi dbang gi bya ba byed pa las rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs rnams kyi rten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa'i ngo bo rgyud kyi dbang gi bya ba byed pa las rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the possession of support and the nature of form that is similar to that is determined from the performance of function due to the power of the mindstream.

original: chos zhes bya ba rnams la ni rnam par rtog pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba rnams la ni rnam par rtog pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Such conceptualization does not exist for phenomena.

original: de ni dus gsum dang dus su ma gtogs pa la yang yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dus gsum dang dus su ma gtogs pa la yang yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the three times and of that which is not time.

original: rgyud kyi dbang gis ma yin par ci'i phyir rnam @110b par 'jog par mi nus she na /
analyzed: rgyud kyi dbang gis ma yin par ci'i phyir rnam @110b par 'jog par mi nus she na /
translated: Why is it not possible to posit the sense faculties as the basis of the term ‚Äúendowed with support‚Äù?

original: kartum ko bh'a ga 'di dag ji ltar brten pa dang bcas pa zhes shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kartum ko bh'a ga 'di dag ji ltar brten pa dang bcas pa zhes shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How could it be known that these eyes, etc. are ‚Äúendowed with support‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of ‚Äòendowed with support‚Äô?‚Äù

original: rten par byed pas na brten pa'o //
analyzed: rten par byed pas na brten pa'o //
translated: It is a support because it supports.

original: de 'di la yod pas brten pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas brten pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with support because it exists in that.

original: de yang dbang po dang yul dang rnam par (rgya dpe gcig na baktum zer/) shes pa rnams phan tshun rten par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dbang po dang yul dang rnam par (rgya dpe gcig na baktum zer/) shes pa rnams phan tshun rten par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is that which mutually supports the sense faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.

original: rten dang brten pa dang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por phan tshun rjes su mthun pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa dang yul dang yul can gyi dngos por phan tshun rjes su mthun pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the mutual compatibility of the object and the subject in the relationship of supported and support.

original: yang byed pa la rten par byed pas brten pa ste /
analyzed: yang byed pa la rten par byed pas brten pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is a support because it supports the agent.

original: gang zhig gang gi byed pa yin pa de de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis rten pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi byed pa yin pa de de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyis rten pa'o //
translated: That which is the activity of something is the support of that, because it is in conformity with it.üîΩFor example, the activity of the eye faculty is seeing, the activity of consciousness is cognition, and the activity of form is the state of being the object of those two.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po'i byed pa lta ba yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs kyi de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gnas par byed pa lta bu ste de bzhin du gzhan yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po'i byed pa lta ba yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs kyi de dag gi yul gyi dngos por gnas par byed pa lta bu ste de bzhin du gzhan yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is the support of the activity of the eye faculty, and so on.

original: 'di ni sngar rang gi las byed pa brten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni sngar rang gi las byed pa brten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: This is what was previously explained as ‚Äúalong with its support.‚Äù

original: yang na 'bras bu reg pa mtshungs pa'i phyir te brten pha mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu reg pa mtshungs pa'i phyir te brten pha mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Or, because the result is contact, they are similar supports.

original: 'di ltar reg pa'i ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rten par byed pas brten pa ste /üîΩde la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa'i ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rten par byed pas brten pa ste / de la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the support of contact is the object, faculty, and consciousness, because it is dependent on them.

original: de'i phyir brten pa mtshungs pas rten mtshungs te reg pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir brten pa mtshungs pas rten mtshungs te reg pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, they are similar supports because they are similar supports. This is the same as saying they are similar contacts.

original: de dag gi reg pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos 'bras bu mtshungs pa des na rgyu'i dngos por mtshungs pa'i phyir te 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi reg pa ni sems las byung ba'i chos 'bras bu mtshungs pa des na rgyu'i dngos por mtshungs pa'i phyir te 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Their contact is similar to the mental factor that is its effect, because it is similar to the cause.

original: yang phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir rigs 'dra ba ste phan tshun 'brel ba'i phyir dang / phan tshun 'dren par bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir rigs 'dra ba ste phan tshun 'brel ba'i phyir dang / phan tshun 'dren par bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: They are similar to those that are supported because

original: de la gang dag mthong ba'i lam gyis spong par 'gyur ba de dag ni mthong bas spong @111a * //üîΩbar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la gang dag mthong ba'i lam gyis spong par 'gyur ba de dag ni mthong bas spong @111a * // bar bya ba ste /
translated: Those that are abandoned by the path of seeing are objects to be abandoned by seeing.

original: rnam pa dgu car yang lam rnam pa gcig gis spong ba gang yin pa de dag ni mthong bas spong bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu car yang lam rnam pa gcig gis spong ba gang yin pa de dag ni mthong bas spong bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: Those that are abandoned by a single path, even though they are of nine types, are objects to be abandoned by seeing.

original: rnam pa dgu lam rnam pa dgu nyid kyis spong ba gang yin pa de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu lam rnam pa dgu nyid kyis spong ba gang yin pa de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: Those that are abandoned by nine types of paths, even though they are of nine types, are objects to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: gzugs can smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can smos pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúform‚Äù is mentioned in order to exclude the formless realm.

original: bcu zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khams gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúten‚Äù is mentioned in order to clarify the element of mental objects.

original: lnga yang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams dag go //
analyzed: lnga yang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams dag go //
translated: The term ‚Äúfive‚Äù is mentioned in order to clarify the five elements of consciousness, excluding the element of mental consciousness.üîΩThe last is of three types.

original: tha ma ni rnam gsum zhes bya ba de nyid kyi phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: tha ma ni rnam gsum zhes bya ba de nyid kyi phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúlast‚Äù refers to the element of mental consciousness.

original: bden pa dag la log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dag la log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no false knowledge of the truths.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / kha phyi rol tu bltas pa'i phyir gzhan rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / kha phyi rol tu bltas pa'i phyir gzhan rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The other defilements are also to be abandoned by insight into the truths, because they are associated with the defilements that are to be abandoned by insight, because they are not independent, because they are turned outward.

original: yang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúinclusive.‚Äù

original: 'don pa'i go rims mtha' na yod pa'i phyir tha ma'o //
analyzed: 'don pa'i go rims mtha' na yod pa'i phyir tha ma'o //
translated: The order of the words is that which is found in the S≈´tra.

original: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni khams gsum gyi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni khams gsum gyi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: The eighty-eight proclivities are to be abandoned by insight into the truths of the three realms.

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'byung pa smos pa ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / de dag gi mtshan nyid dang / phra rgyas rnams kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'byung pa smos pa ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / de dag gi mtshan nyid dang / phra rgyas rnams kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äútogether‚Äù includes the thought and thoughtconcomitants associated with them, their characteristics and the secondary defilements that are associated with them.

original: de'i thob pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i thob pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: But their possessions are not to be abandoned by insight.

original: de'i phyir thob pa rnams ni sngar skyes pa dang phyis skye ba yang yod pas de dag so so smos pas de'i thob pa rnams kyang 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir thob pa rnams ni sngar skyes pa dang phyis skye ba yang yod pas de dag so so smos pas de'i thob pa rnams kyang 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, since obtainment of those previously arisen and later arisen states exists, their obtainment is also accompanied by a retinue.

original: rjes su 'brang ba rjes kyi thob pa dang thob pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba rjes kyi thob pa dang thob pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: The subsequent obtainment and characteristics of obtainment are the subsequent retinue.

original: de la phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: The consciousness concomitant with the eighty eight negative tendencies is the mind element and the mind consciousness element.

original: lhag ma mtshungs par ldan pa phra rgyas dag dang lhan cig pa rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: lhag ma mtshungs par ldan pa phra rgyas dag dang lhan cig pa rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni chos kyi khams so //
translated: The remaining concomitant and nonconcomitant states that are not negative tendencies are the phenomena element.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba yod pas zag pa med pa rnams las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir zag pa smos so //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba yod pas zag pa med pa rnams las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir zag pa smos so //
translated: Since this would be illogical, the term contaminated is stated to distinguish them from uncontaminated states.

original: kha cig na re gang gi phying so so'i skye bo nyid dang ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal @111b ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re gang gi phying so so'i skye bo nyid dang ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal @111b ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Some say: Because it is the opposite of the arya path, it is abandoned by the path of seeing like the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and so on, because it is the state of an ordinary being and it is the physical and verbal karma of beings of lower rebirths.

original: 'di ltar lam gyi skad cig dang po skyes pa na so so'i skye bo nyid dang mi ldan pa 'thob pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa log par mi ltung ba chos can no zhes kyang bshad na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lam gyi skad cig dang po skyes pa na so so'i skye bo nyid dang mi ldan pa 'thob pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa log par mi ltung ba chos can no zhes kyang bshad na /
translated: Thus when the first moment of the path arises, one obtains the state of an ordinary being and it is explained that one is a being who enters the stream and does not fall away.

original: ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las ma spangs par ni ngan song zad par yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las ma spangs par ni ngan song zad par yang mi rigs so //
translated: But it is illogical that the exhaustion of lower rebirths occurs without abandoning the physical and verbal karma of lower rebirths.

original: bdag gi dmyal bzad do zhes rgya cher gsungs shing zad pa dang spangs pa las bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes dgra bcom pa nyid brda sprod pas de'i phyir phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu nyung bar brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag gi dmyal bzad do zhes rgya cher gsungs shing zad pa dang spangs pa las bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes dgra bcom pa nyid brda sprod pas de'i phyir phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shin tu nyung bar brjod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúeighty-eight‚Äù and so on is a very brief statement.

original: 'di la lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here is the response to that.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The nature of an ordinary being and the physical and verbal karma of those who are in the lower realms are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir / mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin no ;üîΩ/ zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin no ; / zhes gsungs te /
translated: The brief explanation is this:

original: nyan mongs can min mthong spang min //
analyzed: nyan mongs can min mthong spang min //
translated: That which is not afflicted is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis so so'i skye bo nyid spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis so so'i skye bo nyid spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the nature of an ordinary being is not to be abandoned.

original: gzugs min zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston to ;
analyzed: gzugs min zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang ngan song ba'i lus dang ngag gi las mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston to ;
translated: This shows that even though it is afflicted, it is not physical form that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: / drug pa min skyes min zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //üîΩgal te bcu ni bsgom pas spang bya yin /
analyzed: / drug pa min skyes min zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can yin yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes ston par byed do // gal te bcu ni bsgom pas spang bya yin /
translated: This shows that even though it is afflicted, it is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lnga yang zhes bshad na yang ci'i phyir /üîΩgzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
analyzed: lnga yang zhes bshad na yang ci'i phyir / gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
translated: If it is explained that ten are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation and five are not, why is it said:

original: zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes brjod ce na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe six are not physical form and not arisen from the sixth?‚Äù

original: nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated for the sake of certainty.

original: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //üîΩzhes bshad pa der nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni ma thong bas sdang bar bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo // zhes bshad pa der nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni ma thong bas sdang bar bya ba ma yin la /
translated: The last three are of three types.üîΩThis explains that nonindicative form is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: nyon mongs pa can yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Afflicted nonindicative form is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: nyon mongs pa can yin yang tshor ba la sogs pa drug pa las skyes pa ma yin pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes nges par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yin yang tshor ba la sogs pa drug pa las skyes pa ma yin pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes nges par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is afflicted, it is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing, because it is not generated by the six beginning with feeling.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med la gzugs kyang ma yin te mig la sogs pa bzhin zhes @112a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med la gzugs kyang ma yin te mig la sogs pa bzhin zhes @112a * //
translated: This is not a definitive proof, because there is not even the slightest non-afflicted state that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing, and because it is not form, like the eye, etc.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ston par byed do //
translated: He shows the pervasion.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang lung ma bstan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang lung ma bstan pa yang ngo //
translated: It is non-afflicted and neutral.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term ordinary person is an obscured neutral state.

original: 'dis phyogs chos dang gtan tshigs ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis phyogs chos dang gtan tshigs ston par byed do //
translated: This shows the property of the position and the reason.

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa de nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa de nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that it is non-afflicted, because it is the basis of all non-virtuous phenomena.

original: de ltar log par rtog pa la de rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar log par rtog pa la de rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that for those who have such wrong conceptions, he says:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dang zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dang zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: and those who have severed their wholesome roots.

original: gal te de dge ba yin par gyur na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa rnams so so'i skye bo ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de dge ba yin par gyur na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa rnams so so'i skye bo ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were wholesome, then those who have severed their wholesome roots would not be ordinary beings.

original: dge ba yin pa'i phyir dang de yang chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba yin pa'i phyir dang de yang chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be wholesome and because it would be severed.

original: de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir dge ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te de'i phyir dge ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable, therefore it is not wholesome.

original: mi dge ba yang ma yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba yang ma yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not unwholesome, because those who are free from attachment possess it.

original: gzhan du so so skye bo ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bral ba'i so so skye bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du so so skye bo ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bral ba'i so so skye bor 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, ordinary beings would be ordinary beings free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: skye pa dang rten dang 'brel ba'i phyir de dang ldan par 'gyur zhing gzhan du skye ba ni khams dang sa gzhan dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye pa dang rten dang 'brel ba'i phyir de dang ldan par 'gyur zhing gzhan du skye ba ni khams dang sa gzhan dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: It is connected to birth and the basis, therefore it is possessed. Otherwise, one born in another realm or level would possess it.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is also unacceptable that it is afflicted.

original: lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin na /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin na /
translated: If the karma of body and speech is form,üîΩthen how can it be wholesome or unwholesome?

original: gzugs ni nyon mongs pa can nam nyon mongs pa can ma yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni nyon mongs pa can nam nyon mongs pa can ma yin yang rung ste /
translated: Form is either afflicted or unafflicted.üîΩ

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad med do //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad med do //
translated: Form is not abandoned by the path of seeing, whether it is afflicted or unafflicted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the cause is not distinguished, since the view of the self and extreme views are the cause of the others, and because the view of the self is not abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩThe others are not abandoned by the path of seeing because they are not the root afflictions.

original: bden pa rnams la log par rtog pa'i phyir dang / rtsa ba'i chos nyid du yod pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir rgyu khyad par med pa'o //üîΩmthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyis mtha' du mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la log par rtog pa'i phyir dang / rtsa ba'i chos nyid du yod pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir rgyu khyad par med pa'o // mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyis mtha' du mar 'gyur ro //
translated: The view of the self and extreme view are the root afflictions because they are the root afflictions that are the cause of the others.üîΩThe view of the self is not abandoned by the path of seeing because it is not a view that is abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩThe view of the self is not a view that is abandoned by the path of seeing because it is not a view that wrongly engages the four truths.üîΩThe view of the self is not a view that wrongly engages the four truths because it is a view that does not focus on the reality of the root afflictions.üîΩThe view of the self is a view that does not focus on the reality of the root afflictions because it is a view that focuses on the self.üîΩThe view of the self is a view that focuses on the self because it is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self.üîΩThe view of the self is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self because it is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self.üîΩThe view of the self is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self because it is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self.üîΩThe view of the self is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self because it is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni so so skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni so so skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The view of the self is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self because it is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self.üîΩThe view of the self is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self because it is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self.

original: gal te sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas de spong na ni bzod pa skye ba na yang de la spang bar bya ba rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa yang so so skye bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas de spong na ni bzod pa skye ba na yang de la spang bar bya ba rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa yang so so skye bor 'gyur ro //
translated: The view of the self is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self because it is a view that focuses on the five aggregates that are appropriated by the self.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The view of the self is

original: de lta na so so skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na so so skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is an ordinary being?

original: 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos dang 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos dang 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
translated: It is one who has not obtained the ƒÅrya dharmas.

original: de la dmigs pa'i @112b nyon mongs pa spong ba las de spong gi gzugs ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i @112b nyon mongs pa spong ba las de spong gi gzugs ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That is abandoned by abandoning the affliction that focuses on it, but form is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa ni 'ching ba'i gtso bo ma yin yang 'jug par gang brjod pa ni rang bzhin gyis spong ba'i yul dang 'brel bar yang gang bshad pa dmigs pas spang ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rnam pa ni 'ching ba'i gtso bo ma yin yang 'jug par gang brjod pa ni rang bzhin gyis spong ba'i yul dang 'brel bar yang gang bshad pa dmigs pas spang ba'o //
translated: Although the aspect of a nonafflicted entity is not the principal bond, it is said to be engaged and it is said to be related to the object abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: chos mngon pa pa rnams kyis de la gang zhig gnyen po skyes pa dang spang ba thob pa de'i rang bzhin spangs pa ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa rnams kyis de la gang zhig gnyen po skyes pa dang spang ba thob pa de'i rang bzhin spangs pa ste /
translated: Abhidharma masters say: That which is abandoned when its antidote arises is abandoned by its nature.

original: dper na kun tu sbyor ba 'bras bu gcig pa rnams kyi spang ba gang yin pa gzhi gang dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dper na kun tu sbyor ba 'bras bu gcig pa rnams kyi spang ba gang yin pa gzhi gang dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: For example, when the result of a single fetter is abandoned, the basis is not possessed.

original: thob pa las thams cad du de la dmigs pa'i zag pa thams cad spangs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: thob pa las thams cad du de la dmigs pa'i zag pa thams cad spangs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it the case that all the contaminants that focus on it are abandoned through obtaining the fruit of nonreturn?

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams rim gyis spong bar byed pa na bral ba'i thob pa rnams so so bdag skye bas de dag spong bar byed ces
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams rim gyis spong bar byed pa na bral ba'i thob pa rnams so so bdag skye bas de dag spong bar byed ces
translated: When one abandons the fetters and the afflictions concomitant with them that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of meditation, the obtainment of freedom arises separately for each.

original: bya'o // gzugs la ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang rigs rnams dang gzhan yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams la de ltar bral ba'i thob pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bya'o // gzugs la ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang rigs rnams dang gzhan yang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams la de ltar bral ba'i thob pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: But in the form realm, the obtainment of freedom does not arise in this way for those that are concomitant with the path of meditation and those that are not concomitant with the path of meditation.

original: de'i phyir de dag la ji lta bar bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la ji lta bar bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba nyid du rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is logical that those to be abandoned by the uninterrupted path are just that.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni sa 'ga' zhig dang chags pa dang bral bar byed pa ma yin pas ci ltar na gzugs de spang bya yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni sa 'ga' zhig dang chags pa dang bral bar byed pa ma yin pas ci ltar na gzugs de spang bya yin par 'gyur /
translated: Since the path of seeing does not cause one to be free from attachment to any stage, how could form be an object to be abandoned?

original: ngan song ba'i chos rnams ni bden pa mthong ba rnams la rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ste /
analyzed: ngan song ba'i chos rnams ni bden pa mthong ba rnams la rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ste /
translated: The phenomena of lower rebirths do not arise in those who see the four truths because the conditions for them are incomplete.

original: de'i yul nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa las te /
analyzed: de'i yul nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa las te /
translated: They arise from the objects of those afflictions that are abandoned.

original: de dag spang ba zhes bya ba spong ba gzhan du skyed par byed pa 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams yin no //üîΩci'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa rnams bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du mi brjod ce na de ltar nges par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spang ba zhes bya ba spong ba gzhan du skyed par byed pa 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams yin no // ci'i phyir lta ba la sogs pa rnams bzhin du mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du mi brjod ce na de ltar nges par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The objects to be abandoned are the desire realm and so on that are generated by the abandonment of the afflictions.üîΩWhy are they not called objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing like the afflicted view of the self and so on?üîΩThey should be so described because they are not wrongly conceived in relation to the four truths.

original: bden pa rnams la log par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes pa 'di nyid rgyu la dmigs pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la log par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes pa 'di nyid rgyu la dmigs pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: This is because they are objects of the cause of the afflicted view of the self and so on.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa spong ba'i gnas skabs su gal te de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir so so'i skye bo nyid spong bar byed de 'phags pa'i gang zag lnga po rnams ji ltar so so skye bo nyid du thal bar
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa spong ba'i gnas skabs su gal te de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir so so'i skye bo nyid spong bar byed de 'phags pa'i gang zag lnga po rnams ji ltar so so skye bo nyid du thal bar
translated: Because when one is in the state of abandoning attachment and so on, if one abandons the state of an ordinary being in order to abandon the affliction that focuses on it, then how could it not follow that the five types of ƒÅrya being would become ordinary beings?

original: mi 'gyur / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod @113a * //
analyzed: mi 'gyur / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod @113a * //
translated: Because the obtainment of that state of an ordinary being would degenerate at the time of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: pa'i dus su de'i thob pa rnam par nyams pa'i phyir dang mthong ba'i lam las dus phyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de la ma skyes pas 'phags pa'i lam so so skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i dus su de'i thob pa rnam par nyams pa'i phyir dang mthong ba'i lam las dus phyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de la ma skyes pas 'phags pa'i lam so so skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because that which is to be abandoned by the path of meditation would not arise later than the path of seeing, it would follow that the ƒÅrya path would be the state of an ordinary being.

original: gang gi phyir sngar des byas pa'i spangs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba phyis spong bar byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar des byas pa'i spangs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba phyis spong bar byed do //
translated: Because it is said that previously it was not abandoned by that path, but later it is abandoned.

original: yang rnam par nyams pa dang spangs pa dag la khyad par ci zhe na yod de /
analyzed: yang rnam par nyams pa dang spangs pa dag la khyad par ci zhe na yod de /
translated: What is the difference between degeneration and abandonment?

original: gang gi phyir rnam par nyams pa ni dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa skye ba srid kyi spang ba ni dmigs pa las ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par nyams pa ni dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa skye ba srid kyi spang ba ni dmigs pa las ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because it is possible for the mental affliction to arise from the object when it is impaired, but not when it is abandoned.

original: gal te de lta na 'o na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'o na /
translated: If that is so, then why is it said:

original: dad pa'i rnam pa spangs kyang de'i //
analyzed: dad pa'i rnam pa spangs kyang de'i //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the aspect of faith is abandoned,

original: yul can dri ma rnams kyi ldan //üîΩzhes ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: yul can dri ma rnams kyi ldan // zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: the object is possessed by the taints.‚Äù

original: tshul de ni nyon mongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: tshul de ni nyon mongs pa can yin la /
translated: That mode is afflicted,

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: but the state of being an ordinary being is unafflicted, indeterminate, and thus there is no contradiction.

original: lta ba ni spang bya nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dod par grags pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa de'i phyir rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba ni spang bya nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dod par grags pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa de'i phyir rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The view is not an object to be abandoned, etc. This is explained from the perspective of what is renowned in the world. Therefore it should be analyzed.

original: ji ltar so so skye bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'phangs pa bde na pa rnams la log par mi bsgrub pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar so so skye bo nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'phangs pa bde na pa rnams la log par mi bsgrub pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because it is the state of an ordinary being, it is not afflicted, since it is not wrongly established in those who are elevated by the term ‚Äúto be abandoned by the path of seeing.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason is stated: ‚Äúbecause the affliction that focuses on it is abandoned.‚Äù

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yang spang ba'i phyir zhes rgyu gsungs pa 'di la rnam par dpyad pa ni /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yang spang ba'i phyir zhes rgyu gsungs pa 'di la rnam par dpyad pa ni /
translated: This is analyzed as follows:

original: zag pa med pa'i skad cig dang po la so so skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lugs ngan pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i skad cig dang po la so so skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lugs ngan pa ste /
translated: It would follow that in the first moment of the uncontaminated state, one would be an ordinary being.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i tshig gis 'phangs pa'i dgongs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i tshig gis 'phangs pa'i dgongs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the intention of the statement that is the basis for this analysis?

original: skye bar byed pa na de ma spangs pa'i phyir zag pa med pa sgad cig dang po na so so skye bo nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skye bar byed pa na de ma spangs pa'i phyir zag pa med pa sgad cig dang po na so so skye bo nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: When it is generated, it is not wrongly established as an ordinary being because it has not abandoned the state of an ordinary being.

original: 'di yang lugs ngan pa ste rang gi lugs dang gzhan gyi lugs dag ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su lam la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbye brag tu smra ba rnams ni spang bya'i dbye ba las 'dod de spangs pa'i thob pa phra rgyas kyi thob pa dang 'gal ba kun tu 'dzin pa dang lam gyi spangs pa'i bral ba thob pa 'dren bar byed cing 'gag bzhin pa'i lam gyis de'i sgrib pa
analyzed: 'di yang lugs ngan pa ste rang gi lugs dang gzhan gyi lugs dag ni skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa'i gnas skabs rnams su lam la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni spang bya'i dbye ba las 'dod de spangs pa'i thob pa phra rgyas kyi thob pa dang 'gal ba kun tu 'dzin pa dang lam gyi spangs pa'i bral ba thob pa 'dren bar byed cing 'gag bzhin pa'i lam gyis de'i sgrib pa
translated: This is also a bad system, because there is no difference in the path in the states of birth, abiding, and cessation in one‚Äôs own system and in the system of others.üîΩVaibhasikas assert that the path is distinguished by the classification of objects to be abandoned. The obtainment of abandonment is the obtainment of the antidote that is the opposite of the obtainment of negative tendencies. The obtainment of separation that is the abandonment of the path induces the obtainment of separation that is the abandonment of the path. The path that is in the process of cessation abandons the obscurations

original: spong bar byed do //
analyzed: spong bar byed do //
translated: of the obtainment of separation that is the abandonment of the path.üîΩThis is also analyzed elsewhere.

original: 'di la ni gzhan du yang rnam par dpyad pa nyid do //üîΩgtam @113b rnam par 'phros pa zhar las byung bas chog go //
analyzed: 'di la ni gzhan du yang rnam par dpyad pa nyid do // gtam @113b rnam par 'phros pa zhar las byung bas chog go //
translated: Enough with this digression.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: mig gi skye mched la sogs pa la yang tshor ba la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched la sogs pa la yang tshor ba la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ste /
translated: Also feeling and so on are seen to be objects abandoned by the path of seeing in the eyes and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin kha phyi rol tu bltas pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bzhin kha phyi rol tu bltas pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because it engages its object by turning outward, like visual consciousness, etc., toward form, etc.

original: 'di las yang kha phyi rol tu bltas pas 'jug ba rgyu cis mthong bas sdang bar bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'di las yang kha phyi rol tu bltas pas 'jug ba rgyu cis mthong bas sdang bar bya ba ma yin /
translated: Why is it not to be seen that it engages its object by turning outward?

original: de nyid la gtan tshigs brjod par bya dgos te bden pa rnams la log par mi rtog pa'i phyir de las kha phyi rol tu bltas pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la gtan tshigs brjod par bya dgos te bden pa rnams la log par mi rtog pa'i phyir de las kha phyi rol tu bltas pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The reason must be stated: because it does not falsely imagine the truths, it is the cause of turning outward.

original: mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni lta ba yin zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni lta ba yin zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The eye and the element of mental objects are the view.

original: de la chos thams cad kyi nang nas lta ba'i rang bzhin ni chos gnyis yin te gzugs can rnams las ni mig gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad kyi nang nas lta ba'i rang bzhin ni chos gnyis yin te gzugs can rnams las ni mig gi dbang po'o //
translated: Among all things, two have the nature of view: among those with form, the eye faculty;

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni shes bya la rtog pa rgyu ba gsal ba can gyi shes rab kha nang du bltas par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams ni shes bya la rtog pa rgyu ba gsal ba can gyi shes rab kha nang du bltas par zhugs pa'o //
translated: among those without form, the wisdom that is clear and engages in the movement of thought directed toward the knowable.

original: de la re zhig mig gi mtshan nyid ni de la lta ba yang dag par sgrub par byed cing kun tu lta ba'i phyir dang / long ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang gsal bar lta ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du phra rgyas kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phra rgyas bstan pa'i skabs su bab par 'gyur bas 'dir ma brjod cing /
analyzed: de la re zhig mig gi mtshan nyid ni de la lta ba yang dag par sgrub par byed cing kun tu lta ba'i phyir dang / long ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang gsal bar lta ba'i phyir ro // de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du phra rgyas kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir phra rgyas bstan pa'i skabs su bab par 'gyur bas 'dir ma brjod cing /
translated: The eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.

original: lhag ma lta ba bzhi po dag gis rang gi ngo po ni gzhan du ston pa'i skabs med pas 'di nyid du de dag gi ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma lta ba bzhi po dag gis rang gi ngo po ni gzhan du ston pa'i skabs med pas 'di nyid du de dag gi ngo bo bstan to //
translated: The eye is the support of the eye consciousness because it is the cause of the eye consciousness and because it is the support of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang zag pa med pa yod pas de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dge ba zag pa dang
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang zag pa med pa yod pas de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dge ba zag pa dang
translated: Since nonvirtuous, indeterminate, and uncontaminated wisdom that is concomitant with eye consciousness and so on exists, the Abhidharmako≈õa states, ‚ÄúIt is contaminated virtuous wisdom concomitant with mental consciousness.‚Äù

original: bcas pa'o zhes khyad par rnam pa gsum brjod do //
analyzed: bcas pa'o zhes khyad par rnam pa gsum brjod do //
translated: Thus three aspects are specified.

original: slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni slob pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni slob pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The uncontaminated wisdom of a learner is the view of a learner.

original: slob pa smos pa ni mi slob pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa smos pa ni mi slob pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term learner is stated to distinguish it from that of a nonlearner.

original: zag pa med pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa smos pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Uncontaminated is stated to distinguish it from that of a learner.

original: mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni mi slob pa'i lta ba'o //üîΩyang dag pa'i lta ba bstan pa nyid kyis 'di dag gsum char yang @114a * //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni mi slob pa'i lta ba'o // yang dag pa'i lta ba bstan pa nyid kyis 'di dag gsum char yang @114a * //
translated: The uncontaminated wisdom of a nonlearner is the view of a nonlearner.

original: bstan par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bstan par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Aren‚Äôt these three also taught by the teaching of right view?

original: de lta yin mod kyi so so skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / skye ba'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum du dbye bar bya'o //üîΩsprin dang bcas pa dang sprin med pa'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i gzugs la lta ba bzhin du zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi so so skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / skye ba'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum du dbye bar bya'o // sprin dang bcas pa dang sprin med pa'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i gzugs la lta ba bzhin du zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: Although this is so, they are divided into three in order to show the stages of ordinary beings, learners, and nonlearners, and in order to show the stages of their arising.üîΩLike seeing forms at night, sometimes with clouds, sometimes without clouds.

original: de la snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang mun pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir mtshan mo sgang gshong spel ma dag la phyin ci log tu lta ba de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams kyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir dang mun pas zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir mtshan mo sgang gshong spel ma dag la phyin ci log tu lta ba de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnams kyi lta ba'o //
translated: Here, the view of the world is like seeing forms at night, sometimes with clouds, sometimes without clouds, with the view of the transitory collection and so on, because it is devoid of light and is overwhelmed by darkness.

original: de nas 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ches yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ches yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, worldly correct view becomes very pure,

original: sprin dang bral ba'i zla ba'i 'od kyis mun pa bcom pa'i mtshan mo gzugs dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprin dang bral ba'i zla ba'i 'od kyis mun pa bcom pa'i mtshan mo gzugs dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because forms are observed at night when the light of the moon is free from clouds and darkness is destroyed.

original: de nas slob pa'i lta ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis g-yogs pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas slob pa'i lta ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis g-yogs pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Then the view of the trainee is like seeing forms on a day covered by the orb of the sun.

original: mi slob pa'i lta ba ni de bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lta ba ni de bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: The view of the non-trainee is even more distinguished than that.

original: sprin med pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mun pa bsal ba'i nyin mo gzugs dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sprin med pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mun pa bsal ba'i nyin mo gzugs dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like observing forms on a day when the sun‚Äôs rays dispel darkness on a day free of clouds.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams ji lta ji ltar shes rab goms pa'i sgo nas snying gi mun pa spong ba de lta de ltar dmigs pa rnam par dag ba khyad par du 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar dmigs pa la rnam par dag pa dang ma dag pa ni cung zad kyang med kyi rnam par dag pas rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams ji lta ji ltar shes rab goms pa'i sgo nas snying gi mun pa spong ba de lta de ltar dmigs pa rnam par dag ba khyad par du 'gyur te / 'di ltar dmigs pa la rnam par dag pa dang ma dag pa ni cung zad kyang med kyi rnam par dag pas rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As yogis and yoginis eliminate the darkness of the heart through familiarization with wisdom, their objects of observation become increasingly pure.üîΩIn this way, there is not the slightest bit of purity or impurity in the object of observation.

original: blo dri ma can nyid dag par byas pa la nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: blo dri ma can nyid dag par byas pa la nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúpurity is purified by purity‚Äù should be understood as referring to the purification of a mind that is itself impure.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this is as follows.

original: lta ba rnams ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: lta ba rnams ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of views.

original: lung du ma bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i sems zag pa dang bcas pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dbye bas so //üîΩde la lung du ma bstan pa'i rigs las ni /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i sems zag pa dang bcas pa dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dbye bas so // de la lung du ma bstan pa'i rigs las ni /
translated: The eye sense faculty is view when it is of the class of indeterminate, afflicted, or wholesome consciousness associated with the contaminants, or when it is of the class of learner or nonlearner consciousness.

original: mig gi dbang po lta ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po lta ba yin gyi /
translated: The eye sense faculty is view when it is of the class of indeterminate consciousness.üîΩIt is not view when it is of the class of ear consciousness, etc.,

original: rna ba la sogs pa dang / shes rab ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa dang / shes rab ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: or when it is of the class of unobscured indeterminate consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi rigs las ni lta ba lnga po de dag las gzhan pa'i shes rab lta ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi rigs las ni lta ba lnga po de dag las gzhan pa'i shes rab lta ba ma yin te /
translated: The eye sense faculty is not view when it is of the class of afflicted consciousness, except for the five views.

original: de yang 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang lhan cig skyes @114b pa'o ;üîΩ/ slob pa'i rigs las ni lta ba ma yin pa'i shes rab 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / the tshom dang lhan cig skyes @114b pa'o ; / slob pa'i rigs las ni lta ba ma yin pa'i shes rab 'ga' yang med do //
translated: It is also not view when it is of the class of consciousness associated with attachment, anger, pride, unafflicted ignorance, or doubt.üîΩThe eye sense faculty is not view when it is of the class of learner consciousness.

original: mi slob pa'i rigs la ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes ba lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rigs la ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes ba lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The eye sense faculty is not view when it is of the class of nonlearner consciousness, except for the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rigs las ni /
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i rigs las ni /
translated: From the class of contaminated virtue,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: it is concomitant only with the mental consciousness.

original: re zhig dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa btags pa 'ga' zhig lta ba ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa btags pa 'ga' zhig lta ba ma yin te /
translated: Some contaminated virtue is not view.üîΩSome contaminated virtue is established by the five collections of consciousness, but is not concomitant with view.

original: 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ldas mngon par bsgrubs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i kun slong du gyur pa 'chi ba'i mthar gyur pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs ldas mngon par bsgrubs pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i kun slong du gyur pa 'chi ba'i mthar gyur pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: For example, some contaminated virtue is concomitant with the mental consciousness alone, such as contaminated virtue that is the motivation for nonindicative interim virtue that is established by the five collections of consciousness and that occurs at the end of death.

original: 'on te ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lta ba dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du khyad par med kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la bya'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin zhe
analyzed: 'on te ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lta ba dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du khyad par med kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la bya'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin zhe
translated: Or, why is it that though contaminated virtue is not differentiated as mundane view, it is concomitant with the mental consciousness alone and not concomitant with the five consciousnesses?

original: na / rnam shes lnga dang mtshungs skyes blo //
analyzed: na / rnam shes lnga dang mtshungs skyes blo //
translated: Because the mind that arises simultaneously with the five consciousnesses

original: nges rtog med phyir lta ma yin //
analyzed: nges rtog med phyir lta ma yin //
translated: is not a view because it does not definitely conceive its object.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharmakosa:

original: rtog par byed pa na lta ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog par byed pa na lta ba yin te /
translated: When it is conceptualizing, it is view,

original: nges par sems pa la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par sems pa la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is engaged in determining.

original: nges par rtog pa ni yul nges par sems pa sngon du 'gro ba can nges par 'dren par byed pa can yin na rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nges par rtog pa ni yul nges par sems pa sngon du 'gro ba can nges par 'dren par byed pa can yin na rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: Conceptualizing is that which precedes the determination of an object and induces determination, but wisdom that arises simultaneously with the five consciousnesses is not like that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni /üîΩji ltar nges par sems pa la 'jug pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab rtog par byed pa ma yin zhing lta ba ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni / ji ltar nges par sems pa la 'jug pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab rtog par byed pa ma yin zhing lta ba ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma
translated: Therefore, wisdom that is afflicted is

original: yin pa'i shes rab gzhan la rtog pa la sems par ma zhugs pa'i phyir rtog par byed pa ma yin pas lta ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yin pa'i shes rab gzhan la rtog pa la sems par ma zhugs pa'i phyir rtog par byed pa ma yin pas lta ba ma yin te /
translated: just as it is not conceptualizing or view because it is not engaged in determining, so too it is not conceptualizing or view because it is not engaged in determining.

original: de yang sngar nyid du rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngar nyid du rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained in detail above.

original: gal te rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab lta ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab lta ba yin na ni /
translated: If seeing is wisdom because it is that which sees,

original: 'o na ni mig dang rtog par byed pa nyid med na ji ltar lta ba yin zhe na /üîΩgzugs la lta ba'i don gyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni mig dang rtog par byed pa nyid med na ji ltar lta ba yin zhe na / gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: then how can the eye see if it does not have the nature of seeing?üîΩIt is said that the eye sees because it is the basis of seeing form.

original: mig ni gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis lta ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: mig ni gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis lta ba zhes brjod de /
translated: The eye is called seeing because it is the basis of seeing form,

original: nges par rtog pa'i don gyis ni ma yin la /
analyzed: nges par rtog pa'i don gyis ni ma yin la /
translated: but not because it is the basis of determining.
