original: shes rab ni nges par byed pa'i don gyis yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab ni nges par byed pa'i don gyis yin gyi /
translated: Wisdom is the basis of determining,

original: lta ba'i don gyis ma yin @115a * //
analyzed: lta ba'i don gyis ma yin @115a * //
translated: but not the basis of seeing.

original: pas gnyi ga yang lta ba nyid yin par 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: pas gnyi ga yang lta ba nyid yin par 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction that both are seeing.

original: gang shes pa dang mthong ba la gang brjod pa de'i don la mngon sum du 'jug pa nyid kyis lta bar byed pa'i don gyis ma yin zhing rtog par byed pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang shes pa dang mthong ba la gang brjod pa de'i don la mngon sum du 'jug pa nyid kyis lta bar byed pa'i don gyis ma yin zhing rtog par byed pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: That which is called knowledge and seeing does not see by the meaning of direct perception or by the meaning of determining.

original: gang gi phyir mig gis gzugs rnams mthong zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gis gzugs rnams mthong zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that the eye sees forms,üîΩbut it does not see by the meaning of direct perception or by the meaning of determining.

original: gzugs mthong ba ni gzugs la blta ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba ni gzugs la blta ba yin te /
translated: Seeing form is seeing form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis mig la blta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis mig la blta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye is called seeing because of the meaning of seeing form.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even when associated with another consciousness means even when another consciousness is present.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan mngon du gyur bas kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan mngon du gyur bas kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even when another consciousness is manifest means even when another consciousness is present.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rang gi rnam par shes pa la bltos pa med pa rnams la yang nyan pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / yul thams cad cig car dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rang gi rnam par shes pa la bltos pa med pa rnams la yang nyan pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / yul thams cad cig car dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Similarly, even when the ear, etc., are not related to their own consciousnesses, listening, etc., are accepted, and it follows that all objects are simultaneously apprehended.

original: mig thams cad kyi mthong ba ni ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: mig thams cad kyi mthong ba ni ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Not all eyes see.

original: mig 'ga' zhig kho nas blta bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig 'ga' zhig kho nas blta bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is accepted that only some eyes see.

original: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa'o //
translated: Associated with consciousness means the abode of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams ni cig car dbang po rnams la gnas pa yang ma yin pas yul thams cad cig car dmigs par thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta na 'o na ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams ni cig car dbang po rnams la gnas pa yang ma yin pas yul thams cad cig car dmigs par thal bar yang mi 'gyur ro // de lta na 'o na ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Also, since consciousnesses do not simultaneously abide in the sense faculties, it is not the case that all objects are simultaneously observed.

original: rnam par shes pa kho na lta ba la nus pa dang ldan par snang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kho na lta ba la nus pa dang ldan par snang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since consciousness alone appears to have the ability to see, it is consciousness itself that sees.

original: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: rnam par shes pa'i rten rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen po nye bar bsags pa las mig gis blta bar nus kyi de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas mthong zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rten rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'byung ba chen po nye bar bsags pa las mig gis blta bar nus kyi de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas mthong zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The eye is able to see due to the primary elements that are conjoined with consciousness and that are the support of consciousness, but it is not that the eye sees due to the consciousness that is supported by it.

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i rgyu yod na dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rgyu nyid dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs par brjod pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i rgyu yod na dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir dmigs pa'i rgyu nyid dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rigs par brjod pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: If an object exists as a cause of perception, it is perceived. Therefore it is logical to say that the cause of perception is perception.

original: 'di yang ma grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rten bdag gi khyad par las gyur pa ni 'ga' yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'di yang ma grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rten bdag gi khyad par las gyur pa ni 'ga' yang ma bshad do //
translated: But since this is not the case, it is not explained that the eye sense faculty is a special support of consciousness.üîΩAlso, a sutra declares:

original: mdo las kyang mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar gsungs kyi /
analyzed: mdo las kyang mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye bar gsungs kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúEye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.‚ÄùüîΩBut it does not say that the eye arises in dependence on eye consciousness and form.

original: rnam par shes pa dang gzugs @115b la brten nas mig skye'o zhes 'ga' yang ma gsungs pas de'i phyir rnam par shes pa mig gi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang gzugs @115b la brten nas mig skye'o zhes 'ga' yang ma gsungs pas de'i phyir rnam par shes pa mig gi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: Therefore the statement that consciousness is the cause of the eye is mere speculation.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i rgyu rgyas pa las byung ba'i khyad par las rten pa dang bcas pa'i mig gis mthong bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i rgyu rgyas pa las byung ba'i khyad par las rten pa dang bcas pa'i mig gis mthong bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the eye sees in dependence on the eye sense faculty that arises from the cause of consciousness,

original: de lta na de dang mtshungs pa'i mig gis kyang mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de dang mtshungs pa'i mig gis kyang mthong bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the eye that is similar to it would also see.

original: rten pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu nye bar bsags pa'i phyir ches khyad par du 'phags par mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu nye bar bsags pa'i phyir ches khyad par du 'phags par mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: The difference is that the eye sense faculty is superior because it is the proximate cause of the visual consciousness that is supported by it.üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?

original: ci ste rten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa las rnam par shes pas byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbye bar 'dod na /üîΩde lta na yang khams dang skye mched rigs pa nyid du 'gal bas ci las nges par bya /üîΩmig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas mthong ba ma yin zhes bya ba bstan bcos la sogs ba rnam par shes pa'i khyad par las mig gi rnam par shes pa rigs gcig pa la mthong ba dang mthong ba ma yin pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ci ste rten pa dang bcas pa dang de dang mtshungs pa las rnam par shes pas byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbye bar 'dod na / de lta na yang khams dang skye mched rigs pa nyid du 'gal bas ci las nges par bya / mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pas mthong ba ma yin zhes bya ba bstan bcos la sogs ba rnam par shes pa'i khyad par las mig gi rnam par shes pa rigs gcig pa la mthong ba dang mthong ba ma yin pa mi rung ngo //
translated: If you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?

original: gal te rten gyi khyad par las 'di'i khyad par ro zhe na /üîΩrten gyi khyad par las chos gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: gal te rten gyi khyad par las 'di'i khyad par ro zhe na /üîΩrten gyi khyad par las chos gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med do //
translated: If you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness and that the eye element and eye sense source are the same as that support, then how could the eye sense faculty be the support of the visual consciousness?üîΩIf you assert that the eye sense faculty is the support of the visual consciousness

original: 'di de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa'i rigs su khyad par med kyang gang gi phyir sva ga ta khyad par 'di rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten dang dmigs pa rnams las tha dad pa'i dmigs pa dang rten no //
analyzed: 'di de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa'i rigs su khyad par med kyang gang gi phyir sva ga ta khyad par 'di rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rten dang dmigs pa rnams las tha dad pa'i dmigs pa dang rten no //
translated: If it were not so, then although there would be no difference in the type of consciousness, it would be the object and support of the consciousness of the ear, etc., because it is different from the objects and supports of the consciousness of the eye, etc.

original: de nas khyad par las gzhan pa nyid rnam par shes ba rnams la yang 'di nyid mthong ngo zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: de nas khyad par las gzhan pa nyid rnam par shes ba rnams la yang 'di nyid mthong ngo zhes ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Then why not accept that this is seen in the consciousnesses themselves, which are different from the differences?

original: ji ltar mig gi rigs su khyad par med pa la blta ba dang mi blta ba nyid yin pa de ltar rnam par shes pa la yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: ji ltar mig gi rigs su khyad par med pa la blta ba dang mi blta ba nyid yin pa de ltar rnam par shes pa la yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why not accept that just as there is no difference in the type of eye, but there is seeing and not seeing, so also there is no difference in the type of consciousness?

original: gang gi phyir mig la rgyas pa las byung ba'i khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la rgyas pa las byung ba'i khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because there is a difference in the eye due to its development,

original: rgyas pa las byung ba'i khyad par med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba'i khyad par med de /
translated: there is no difference in the development.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar mtshungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar mtshungs so //
translated: It is the same as the transformation of the nature.

original: 'di'i mthong ba yang ci mig nyid dam 'on te mig ma yin pa 'ga' zhig / gal te mig nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di'i mthong ba yang ci mig nyid dam 'on te mig ma yin pa 'ga' zhig / gal te mig nyid yin na /
translated: Is seeing by the eye itself, or by something else?

original: de lta na rten bcas dang de mtshungs kyi dbye ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: de lta na rten bcas dang de mtshungs kyi dbye ba mi rigs te /
translated: If it is by the eye itself, then the distinction between the supported and the similar is not tenable.

original: gnyi ga mig nyid yin pa'i phyir lta ba de ci zhig khyad bar du byed /
analyzed: gnyi ga mig nyid yin pa'i phyir lta ba de ci zhig khyad bar du byed /
translated: Because both are the eye itself, what is the distinction of that seeing?

original: mig ni lta bas khyad par du byed cing lta ba yang mig gis so zhe na /
analyzed: mig ni lta bas khyad par du byed cing lta ba yang mig gis so zhe na /
translated: If the eye is distinguished by seeing, and seeing is distinguished by the eye,

original: sngon byed pa'i rnam pa @116a * //
analyzed: sngon byed pa'i rnam pa @116a * //
translated: then the form of the prior agent is taught.

original: bstan pa'o // ci ste mig lta ba yang ci //
analyzed: bstan pa'o // ci ste mig lta ba yang ci //
translated: Or, if the eye is seeing,

original: de'i lta ba gzugs la lta ba yin na /
analyzed: de'i lta ba gzugs la lta ba yin na /
translated: if its seeing sees form,

original: 'di yang mig gi dbye ba mi shes so //
analyzed: 'di yang mig gi dbye ba mi shes so //
translated: then this is not known as a distinction of the eye.

original: mig gzhan rnam par shes pa bzhin gzhan ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid yod pa ma yin na yang cung zad rjes su lta ba dang / dngos po las gzhan ma yin pa de'i rang bzhin las gzhan pa gang yin pa nyid spang ba med do //
analyzed: mig gzhan rnam par shes pa bzhin gzhan ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid yod pa ma yin na yang cung zad rjes su lta ba dang / dngos po las gzhan ma yin pa de'i rang bzhin las gzhan pa gang yin pa nyid spang ba med do //
translated: If the eye does not exist as something other than consciousness, then the nature of the eye itself is not something other than consciousness. If it is not something other than a thing, then it is not something other than its nature.

original: gal te med na 'di tshig tsam gyis sgrub bar ci zhig zhus /
analyzed: gal te med na 'di tshig tsam gyis sgrub bar ci zhig zhus /
translated: If it does not, then why do you claim to establish this by mere words?

original: gsum nyid khas blangs par gyur pa'i dngos po'i byed pa de'i rang bzhin de la gal te rang bzhin tha dad na /
analyzed: gsum nyid khas blangs par gyur pa'i dngos po'i byed pa de'i rang bzhin de la gal te rang bzhin tha dad na /
translated: If the nature of the activity of an entity that is accepted as being threefold is different,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i byed pa kho na gzhan nyid nyams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i byed pa kho na gzhan nyid nyams so //
translated: then the activity that is essenceless would be different.üîΩBut if they are different, then the activity of an entity that is essenceless would be different from the entity that is essenceless.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i rang bzhin rnams gzhan nyid du mthong ba med do //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i rang bzhin rnams gzhan nyid du mthong ba med do //
translated: But we do not see that different natures that are mutually different are different.

original: ci ste dngos po'i byed pa rang bzhin med pa nyid kyang de med par thal ba las gzhan ma yin pa nyid rang bzhin med pa la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i
analyzed: ci ste dngos po'i byed pa rang bzhin med pa nyid kyang de med par thal ba las gzhan ma yin pa nyid rang bzhin med pa la yod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i
translated: But if the activity of an entity that is essenceless is not different from that which is essenceless, then there is not the slightest trace of the activity of that which is essenceless that exists.

original: mig dag gis mthong ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mig dag gis mthong ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the eye, which is different from consciousness, sees.

original: shes rab de yang rnam par shes pa lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab de yang rnam par shes pa lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And that wisdom would be consciousness.

original: gzhan dag gis shes rab la rtog bar byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par yod pas rnam par shes pas kyang da lta ba'i gzugs btags pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi khyad par ci zhig mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis shes rab la rtog bar byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par yod pas rnam par shes pas kyang da lta ba'i gzugs btags pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi khyad par ci zhig mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Since other consciousnesses have the special quality of apprehending wisdom, why doesn‚Äôt consciousness also apprehend the special quality of the form of the present that is designated?

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: It was explained above:

original: gal te mig gis mthong ba ma yin pa de med pa'i phyir yong ba zhes mi brjod do //
analyzed: gal te mig gis mthong ba ma yin pa de med pa'i phyir yong ba zhes mi brjod do //
translated: If the eye does not see, it is not called the eye because it does not exist.

original: de ni de lta bu ma yin te gang gi phyir mig gis mthong ba la thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu de med pa'i phyir 'dis yang mthong bar mi 'gyur bas long ba zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta bu ma yin te gang gi phyir mig gis mthong ba la thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu de med pa'i phyir 'dis yang mthong bar mi 'gyur bas long ba zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not so, because if the eye does not see, it is not called the eye because the eye does not exist as the uncommon cause of seeing.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong na long pa yang ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong na long pa yang ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If visual consciousness sees, it follows that even a blind person would see.

original: long ba la de skye ba med pa'i phyir ma yin yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mig gi rnam bar shes pa'i rdzas yod pa de thob ba'am /
analyzed: long ba la de skye ba med pa'i phyir ma yin yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mig gi rnam bar shes pa'i rdzas yod pa de thob ba'am /
translated: It is not because visual consciousness does not arise in a blind person, but because the substance of past and future visual consciousness exists and it obtains that name.

original: de las 'das pa pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir long ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di la skyon med do zhe na /üîΩgang bshad pa /
analyzed: de las 'das pa pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir long ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di la skyon med do zhe na / gang bshad pa /
translated: There is no fault in this.

original: mig nyid de dang der mthong ba'i sgra yis bshad pa zhes bya ba de gnod byed ma yin te /
analyzed: mig nyid de dang der mthong ba'i sgra yis bshad pa zhes bya ba de gnod byed ma yin te /
translated: The explanation that the eye itself sees, because of the expression ‚Äúthe eye sees that and that,‚Äù is not harmed.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect is designated to the cause.

original: gang bshad pa @116b 'jig rten dang 'gal zhes bya ba la 'di 'jig rten dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang bshad pa @116b 'jig rten dang 'gal zhes bya ba la 'di 'jig rten dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: The explanation that it contradicts the world is not a contradiction with the world.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'jig rten na mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'thad do //üîΩgang bshad pa /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'jig rten na mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'thad do // gang bshad pa /
translated: Because the eye is the cause of eye consciousness, it is tenable to say in the world, ‚ÄúThe eye sees.‚Äù

original: gal te rnam par shes pa kho na mthong ba yin na chos gcig dang gnyis kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur bas shes rab la yang 'di nyid thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa kho na mthong ba yin na chos gcig dang gnyis kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur bas shes rab la yang 'di nyid thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The explanation that if consciousness alone sees, it would follow that wisdom also sees, because it would be the nature of one or two phenomena, is not a fault.

original: mthong ba dang shes rab dag tha mi dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang shes rab dag tha mi dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because seeing and wisdom are accepted as not different.

original: 'o na 'dir ci'i don du dbye ba khas len bar byed /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir ci'i don du dbye ba khas len bar byed /
translated: Well then, for what purpose is the division accepted here?

original: de'i phyir gcig dang gnyis kyi bdag nyid thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te zhar las byung bas chog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig dang gnyis kyi bdag nyid thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te zhar las byung bas chog go //
translated: Therefore, the consequence of one and two natures would follow.

original: 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig yin gyi gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs bas rnam par dpyad pa rgyas par ni ma byas so //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig yin gyi gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs bas rnam par dpyad pa rgyas par ni ma byas so //
translated: This is just a partial position. I will not elaborate on the extensive analysis for fear of being too wordy.

original: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya ste /
translated: I will now begin the main text.

original: ci las zhe na /üîΩgang phyir bar du chod pa yi //
analyzed: ci las zhe na / gang phyir bar du chod pa yi //
translated: What is the point?üîΩBecause an obstructed form

original: gzugs ni mthong ba min phyir lo //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs ni mthong ba min phyir lo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is not seen, the eye is not the consciousness.

original: lo'i sgra ni rgyu 'dis ni rnam par shes pa mthong ba 'gog par nus pa ma yin no zhes mi 'dod bar bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni rgyu 'dis ni rnam par shes pa mthong ba 'gog par nus pa ma yin no zhes mi 'dod bar bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúeye‚Äù is used to show that this reason is not accepted as being able to refute the consciousness seeing.

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na rtsig pa la sogs pa dag la thogs pa med pa'i phyir mchod pa ltar rtsig pas chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na rtsig pa la sogs pa dag la thogs pa med pa'i phyir mchod pa ltar rtsig pas chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If consciousness sees, then like the eye, it would see visible form even when obstructed by walls, because it is not obstructed.

original: chod pa ni mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chod pa ni mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it does not see what is obstructed.

original: de'i phyir gang gis na chod pa mi mthong bar 'gyur bar lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pas rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis na chod pa mi mthong bar 'gyur bar lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pas rgyu gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not of the nature of seeing, there is no other cause for seeing.

original: de lta na gzugs chod pa mi mthong ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa blta ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin la blta ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir na chod pa yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta na gzugs chod pa mi mthong ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa blta ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin la blta ba'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa'i phyir na chod pa yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, because form that is obstructed is not seen, consciousness is not of the nature of seeing. And because it is not of the nature of seeing, it does not see what is obstructed.

original: mig ni blta ba'i bdag nyid yin yang bar du chod pa la thogs pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs mi mthong ba dang / thogs pa med pas bar du mchod par mthong ba 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mig ni blta ba'i bdag nyid yin yang bar du chod pa la thogs pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs mi mthong ba dang / thogs pa med pas bar du mchod par mthong ba 'gal ba med do //
translated: Although the eye is of the nature of seeing, it does not see form that is obstructed because it is obstructed by what is in between. And it is not contradictory that it sees what is not obstructed because it is not obstructed.

original: bsgrib pa la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba nyid de zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsgrib pa la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ba nyid de zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: It is not that visual consciousness does not arise in regard to what is obstructed.

original: lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrib pa mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrib pa mi mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one does not see what is obstructed because it is not of the nature of seeing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu ni mi mthong ba'i zhas ston par byed do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu ni mi mthong ba'i zhas ston par byed do //
translated: It shows that the cause of the nonseeing that is the nature of nonarising is nonseeing.

original: de'i lugs @117a * //
analyzed: de'i lugs @117a * //
translated: In his system,

original: la mig bzhin du thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang nye bar dmigs pa'i nus pa la sgrib bas mi dmigs pa bzhin du de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na 'di ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: la mig bzhin du thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang nye bar dmigs pa'i nus pa la sgrib bas mi dmigs pa bzhin du de ltar 'gyur ro zhe na 'di ni mtshungs so //
translated: just as the obstructed is not seen because the capacity to apprehend is obstructed, so too, it is the same for that which is obstructed.

original: ci ste mi skye zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci ste mi skye zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: If you ask why it does not arise,

original: rnam par shes pa kho na yul la byed pa yin gyi mig ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kho na yul la byed pa yin gyi mig ma yin te /
translated: consciousness alone engages objects, not the eye.

original: mig ni rnam par shes pa kho nar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: mig ni rnam par shes pa kho nar byed pa yin la /
translated: The eye alone is the cause of consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa yang thogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang thogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: and consciousness is unobstructed.

original: de'i phyir yul dang mig yod na rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir mi skye //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul dang mig yod na rnam par shes pa ci'i phyir mi skye //
translated: Therefore, if the object and eye exist, why doesn‚Äôt consciousness arise?

original: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong zhing rnam par shes pas shes pa de'i ltar na ni /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong zhing rnam par shes pas shes pa de'i ltar na ni /
translated: According to those who say that the eye sees and consciousness cognizes,

original: rnam par shes pa rten mig dang lhan cig tu yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir gzugs gang zhig mig gis mthong ba de nyid rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rten mig dang lhan cig tu yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir gzugs gang zhig mig gis mthong ba de nyid rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so //
translated: the eye and consciousness operate on the same object. Therefore, the form that the eye sees is the form that consciousness cognizes.

original: de'i phyir rten dang lhan cig yul la 'jug cing mig kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir chod pa'i gzugs la 'jug pa med cing mthong ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten dang lhan cig yul la 'jug cing mig kyang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir chod pa'i gzugs la 'jug pa med cing mthong ba med de /
translated: Therefore, since the eye operates on an object together with its support and since the eye is obstructed, it does not operate on or see an obstructed form.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa mi skye ba rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa mi skye ba rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that consciousness does not arise.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: But it was explained above:üîΩ‚ÄúIf the eye sees, then does seeing generate the eye or does the eye generate seeing?‚Äù

original: skye ba nyid de'i mthong ba dang mthong ba nyid kyis skye ba'o zhes bya ba de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: skye ba nyid de'i mthong ba dang mthong ba nyid kyis skye ba'o zhes bya ba de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ci ltar skye ba med par gyur pa dang / ci ltar mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ci ltar skye /
analyzed: ci ltar skye ba med par gyur pa dang / ci ltar mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ci ltar skye /
translated: How can that which does not arise see? How can that which sees arise?

original: ma mthong ba'am ci ltar mthong zhes bya ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba'i skye ba las gzhan ba'i mthong ba zhes bya ba yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'am ci ltar mthong zhes bya ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba'i skye ba las gzhan ba'i mthong ba zhes bya ba yang ci zhe na /
translated: What is the seeing that is different from the arising that is mentioned by the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas?

original: byed pa'i rigs yin pa'i phyir mthong bar sgrub pa rten pa dang bcas pa'i mig gzhan la gzhan skyed pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: byed pa'i rigs yin pa'i phyir mthong bar sgrub pa rten pa dang bcas pa'i mig gzhan la gzhan skyed pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is a type of action, it is not suitable for the eye that is established as seeing to generate another eye that is supported by it.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang der thal ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang der thal ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba med do //
translated: And since the unconditioned would also be that, there would be no relation of cause and effect.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba las kyang byed ba'am 'dus byas nyid gzhan bskyed do zhes bya bar thal ba'am /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba las kyang byed ba'am 'dus byas nyid gzhan bskyed do zhes bya bar thal ba'am /
translated: And it follows that it would generate another conditioned state, or it would generate another unconditioned state.

original: der yang de ltar zhes bya ba skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: der yang de ltar zhes bya ba skabs ma yin no //
translated: Or it would be stated that it is like that in that context.

original: ci ste nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if this fault does not occur,

original: de ltar skyed pa dang mi skyed pa gzhan nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar skyed pa dang mi skyed pa gzhan nyid do zhe na /
translated: then that which is generated and that which is not generated are different.

original: de lta na 'o na skye ba nyid mthong ba dang mthong ba nyid skye ba'o zhes bya ba bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs la yang de nyid skyon yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na skye ba nyid mthong ba dang mthong ba nyid skye ba'o zhes bya ba bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs la yang de nyid skyon yin no //
translated: If that is so, then in the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position, arising itself is seeing and seeing itself is arising. That is the fault.

original: yang skyed pa'i sgra yis bdag nyid du gyur ba tsam dang / @117b mthong ba'i sgra yis bdag nyid kyi khyad par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: yang skyed pa'i sgra yis bdag nyid du gyur ba tsam dang / @117b mthong ba'i sgra yis bdag nyid kyi khyad par brjod do zhe na /
translated: Again, if you say that the term ‚Äúarisen‚Äù indicates mere transformation into a self and the term ‚Äúseen‚Äù indicates the particularities of a self,

original: sgra dang don dag tha dad pa'i phyir mi skye ba nyid mthong ba dang mi mthong ba nyid skyed pa'o zhes ci'i phyir mi gzung /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag tha dad pa'i phyir mi skye ba nyid mthong ba dang mi mthong ba nyid skyed pa'o zhes ci'i phyir mi gzung /
translated: then why not maintain that nonarising is seen and nonseeing is arisen, since the terms and their meanings are different?

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: It was explained above:

original: mching bu dang lhang tsher la sogs pas chod pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid de la ma bsgribs pa la skye ba zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: mching bu dang lhang tsher la sogs pas chod pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid de la ma bsgribs pa la skye ba zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow could the arising of eye consciousness be called ‚Äòunobstructed‚Äô when it arises in relation to form that is not obstructed by such things as a wall or a curtain?‚Äù

original: de la yang gzhan gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan gyis bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, another says:

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong ba na bar du chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong ba na bar du chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong ste /
translated: If consciousness sees, then it sees form that is obstructed.

original: lta bar mi byed pa de'i phyir mthong ba'i bdag nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir 'di ltar bshad de /
analyzed: lta bar mi byed pa de'i phyir mthong ba'i bdag nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir 'di ltar bshad de /
translated: But since it does not see, the eye consciousness is the seer.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba ni mthong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ltar bshad do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba ni mthong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de ltar bshad do //
translated: Because it is not seen due to non-arising, it is not of the nature of seeing.

original: 'di ni lan du ma 'brel ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni lan du ma 'brel ba nyid de /
translated: This is not a proper response.

original: bar du chod pa la yang skye zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar du chod pa la yang skye zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that arising occurs even when there is obstruction.

original: mig kyang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mig kyang lus kyi dbang po bzhin du zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe eye is like the body faculty,‚Äù and so on.

original: lus kyi dbang po bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /üîΩthogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bar chod kyis bar du bcas pa'i yul dang ma phrad pa'i phyir mi rig go zhes bya bar mi rigs na /üîΩmig gi dbang po ni yid ltar ma phrad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po bzhin du zhes bya ba ni / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bar chod kyis bar du bcas pa'i yul dang ma phrad pa'i phyir mi rig go zhes bya bar mi rigs na / mig gi dbang po ni yid ltar ma phrad pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike the body faculty‚Äù meansüîΩthat it is not reasonable to say that the eye does not contact its object because it is obstructed by physical resistance, like the body faculty.üîΩThe eye faculty, like the mind faculty, is not obstructed by physical resistance.

original: bar du gcod pas cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs kyang ci ste mi mthong /üîΩslob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: bar du gcod pas cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs kyang ci ste mi mthong / slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Therefore, why does it not see forms that are obstructed?

original: de la gang bshad pa /
analyzed: de la gang bshad pa /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra explains this as follows.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir chod pa dang sgrib pa med pa zhes brjod par bya ba de mi rigs te /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir chod pa dang sgrib pa med pa zhes brjod par bya ba de mi rigs te /
translated: It is not correct to say that it is unobstructed and unimpeded because it is impeded.

original: yul la thogs pa de dang der thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la thogs pa de dang der thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impeded in that it is impeded in this and that place.

original: chod pa dang sgrib pa med par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: chod pa dang sgrib pa med par bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation that it is unobstructed and unimpeded

original: sgrib pa'i thogs pa med pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i thogs pa med pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: means that it is not impeded by obstruction.

original: de lta na yang chod pa smos pa ni bral ba'i don can te /
analyzed: de lta na yang chod pa smos pa ni bral ba'i don can te /
translated: Even so, the word ‚Äúobstructed‚Äù has the meaning of being separated.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang yul la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //üîΩmig ni thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa yang yul la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o // mig ni thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Visual consciousness is said to be impeded because it is impeded by the object.

original: chod pa dang sgrib pa zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chod pa dang sgrib pa zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The eye is not said to be obstructed and impeded because it is impeded.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: It was explained that

original: mig dang yul gang yin pa dang / de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de nyid dang cig car du yin /
analyzed: mig dang yul gang yin pa dang / de la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de nyid dang cig car du yin /
translated: the eye, the object, and the consciousness that depends on them are simultaneous.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar yul dang bcas pa mi snang bar byed pas yul @118a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar yul dang bcas pa mi snang bar byed pas yul @118a * //
translated: Therefore, just as the object is not made to disappear,

original: gzhan la mig 'jug pa 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la mig 'jug pa 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: It prevents the eye from engaging other objects.

original: de bzhin du de'i rnam par shes pa la yang zhes bya ba de'i don du 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rnam par shes pa la yang zhes bya ba de'i don du 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, it should be said that the eye consciousness also has that as its object.

original: rnam par shes pa de la yang 'jug pa'i rten yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang ma 'brel lo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de la yang 'jug pa'i rten yul gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang ma 'brel lo //
translated: But it is not related to say that the eye consciousness also has that as its object because it engages its object by way of a single sense faculty.

original: 'o na 'dir chod par byed pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir chod par byed pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the obstruction here?

original: gang gi tshe rten yul gcig pa'i phyir ma chod pa'i gzugs gzhan la rnam par shes pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rten yul gcig pa'i phyir ma chod pa'i gzugs gzhan la rnam par shes pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: When the eye consciousness engages one object, it does not engage other forms that are not obstructed.

original: de'i phyir sgrib pa ni thogs pa nyid la 'dir mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib pa ni thogs pa nyid la 'dir mngon par 'dod de /
translated: Therefore obstruction is asserted here to be resistance.

original: yul la thogs zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yul la thogs zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the object is obstructed by resistance.

original: mching bu dang / lhang tsher dang / shel dang chu dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mching bu dang / lhang tsher dang / shel dang chu dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Obstructed by glass, a crystal, a prism, and water

original: gal te mig thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po bzhin rang gi yul rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa la mi 'jug na /üîΩmching bu dang lhang tsher la sogs pas chod pa la yang de kho na ltar mi 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te mig thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lus kyi dbang po bzhin rang gi yul rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa la mi 'jug na / mching bu dang lhang tsher la sogs pas chod pa la yang de kho na ltar mi 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the eye sense faculty does not engage its object form when obstructed by walls, etc., like the body sense faculty, then it would not engage its object when obstructed by glass, mica, etc.üîΩBut form is seen even when obstructed by glass, mica, etc.,

original: mching bu la sogs pa dag gis bar du chod pa ni mthong ba yin gyi reg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mching bu la sogs pa dag gis bar du chod pa ni mthong ba yin gyi reg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: so it is not the case that form is not seen when obstructed by glass, mica, etc.

original: de'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore obstruction is not the cause of the eye sense faculty not engaging its object.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause?

original: gang la snang ba la gegs med na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang la snang ba la gegs med na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúWhen there is no obstruction to the appearance of form.‚Äù

original: mig ni snang ba'i lhan cig byed pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig ni snang ba'i lhan cig byed pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The eye sense faculty is a coemergent cause of the appearance of form.

original: lhang tsher la sogs pa gang la snang ba la gegs med na des gzugs bsgribs bzhin du yang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid yin pas des chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong la /
analyzed: lhang tsher la sogs pa gang la snang ba la gegs med na des gzugs bsgribs bzhin du yang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba nyid yin pas des chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong la /
translated: When there is no obstruction to the appearance of form to the eye sense faculty, then even though form is obscured, eye consciousness arises. Therefore form that is obscured is seen.

original: gang du rtsig pa la sogs pa'i gegs yod na ni /
analyzed: gang du rtsig pa la sogs pa'i gegs yod na ni /
translated: But when there is an obstruction such as a wall,

original: des chod pa'i gzugs la mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: des chod pa'i gzugs la mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
translated: the eye consciousness does not arise with respect to the form that is obstructed by it.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cooperative conditions are absent.

original: de bas na mi skye ba'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa dag gis bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na mi skye ba'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa dag gis bsgribs pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, because it does not arise, one does not see the form that is obstructed by a wall, etc.

original: gal te mig kho na snang ba bzhin du kha cig 'byung ba tshogs pa la thogs pa dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir dang 'ga' zhig thogs pa med pa'i phyir chod pa'i gzugs mthong ba dang mi mthong bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig kho na snang ba bzhin du kha cig 'byung ba tshogs pa la thogs pa dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir dang 'ga' zhig thogs pa med pa'i phyir chod pa'i gzugs mthong ba dang mi mthong bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the eye, like light, sometimes encounters and sometimes does not encounter an obstruction in the assembly of conditions, and that some light encounters an obstruction and some does not, so that one sees and does not see obstructed form?

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: mig ni thams cad du gegs med na ma phrad pa'i byed pa can yin pa'i phyir dang / @118b snang ba ni de lta ma yin te phrad pa'i byed pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig ni thams cad du gegs med na ma phrad pa'i byed pa can yin pa'i phyir dang / @118b snang ba ni de lta ma yin te phrad pa'i byed pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the eye, in all cases, is an instrument that does not contact its object, and light is not like that, because it is an instrument that contacts its object.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa ni snang ba med pa'i phyir mi 'dzin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa ni snang ba med pa'i phyir mi 'dzin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not apprehended when obstructed by a wall, etc., because it is not visible.

original: de ltar smra ba ni kha cig tu snang ba med kyang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar smra ba ni kha cig tu snang ba med kyang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because sometimes it is apprehended even though it is not visible.

original: 'o na ci ltar 'ga' zhig tu gzugs tshogs bsgrib pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar 'ga' zhig tu gzugs tshogs bsgrib pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Well then, how is it that sometimes form is not apprehended because it is obstructed by a collection of forms?

original: mun pa snang ba bzhin du mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: mun pa snang ba bzhin du mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: It is similar to the non-apprehension of light when it is obstructed by darkness.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs kyi skye mched mun pas bsgribs pa mi 'dzin pa yod kyang chod pa 'dzin par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs kyi skye mched mun pas bsgribs pa mi 'dzin pa yod kyang chod pa 'dzin par bshad pa ni /
translated: Even though form is not apprehended when it is obstructed by darkness, it is said that it is apprehended when it is obstructed by a wall, etc.

original: de dag bsgribs pas chod pa 'dzin gyi tshogs pa la sogs pas chod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag bsgribs pas chod pa 'dzin gyi tshogs pa la sogs pas chod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is apprehended when it is obstructed by that, but not when it is obstructed by a collection of forms, etc.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa mi 'dzin pa'i rgyu yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa mi 'dzin pa'i rgyu yang ci zhe na /
translated: What is the reason that it is not apprehended when it is obstructed by a wall, etc.?

original: shel la sogs pa rnams kyis chod pa 'dzin pas dris pa la /
analyzed: shel la sogs pa rnams kyis chod pa 'dzin pas dris pa la /
translated: It is apprehended when it is obstructed by crystal, etc.

original: de nyid brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: That is not a reason,

original: de la rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir snang ba'i gegs dang gegs ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir snang ba'i gegs dang gegs ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: because there is no other cause for that. It is said that light is obstructed or not obstructed by that.

original: 'dis ni mun pa dang snang ba dag rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mun pa dang snang ba dag rnam par bshad do //
translated: This explains darkness and light.

original: mun pa ni snang ba dang 'gal ba ste de med pa'i yul 'dzin pa nyid kyis de dang 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mun pa ni snang ba dang 'gal ba ste de med pa'i yul 'dzin pa nyid kyis de dang 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Darkness is the opposite of light; it is said to be like that because it is the apprehension of an object in the absence of light.

original: de nyid kyi phyir des bsgribs pa mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir des bsgribs pa mi 'dzin to //
translated: For that very reason, it does not apprehend what is obscured by it.

original: mtshan mo rgyu ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa nyid kyis de dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan mo rgyu ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa nyid kyis de dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: Those who move about at night are like that because of their karmic maturation.

original: gang zhig mun pas chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig mun pas chod pa'i gzugs kyang mthong bar byed do //
translated: They see forms that are obstructed by darkness.

original: gzhan dag la yang las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis de dang 'dra ba yod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis de dang 'dra ba yod de /
translated: Others are like that by the power of the maturation of karma,

original: gang gis de'i khong na gnas pa mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang gis de'i khong na gnas pa mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: by which they see what is inside it.

original: mig thams cad thams cad du lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: mig thams cad thams cad du lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu rkyen ma yin te /
translated: Not all eyes are co-existent causes for all eyes.

original: snang ba la 'dod pa ci /
analyzed: snang ba la 'dod pa ci /
translated: What is the point of light?

original: gang dag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa snang ba la ma bltos bar skye ba de dag gi ltar na rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa la ni snang ba'i gegs su gyur pa dang mi skye ba'i phyir mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gis mig gi rnam par shes pa snang ba la ma bltos bar skye ba de dag gi ltar na rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa la ni snang ba'i gegs su gyur pa dang mi skye ba'i phyir mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: According to those who maintain that eye consciousness arises without depending on light, it does not see what is obstructed by walls, etc. because light is obstructed and does not arise.

original: shel la sogs pas chod pa la ni snang ba'i gegs med pa'i phyir skye'o //
analyzed: shel la sogs pas chod pa la ni snang ba'i gegs med pa'i phyir skye'o //
translated: But it does arise when it is obstructed by glass, etc. because light is not obstructed.

original: de'i phyir mthong zhes brjod par bya'o //üîΩ'o na gang mdo las zhes bya bas ni lung dang 'gal ba ston par byed do //üîΩgal te rnam par shes pas mthong na ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong zhes brjod par bya'o // 'o na gang mdo las zhes bya bas ni lung dang 'gal ba ston par byed do // gal te rnam par shes pas mthong na ni 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it should be said that it sees.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba @119a * //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba @119a * //
translated: But if consciousness sees, then the sutra passage, ‚Äúhaving seen forms with eye consciousness,‚Äù

original: de lta bu zhig gsung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /üîΩmig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bu zhig gsung bar 'gyur ba zhig na / mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur /
translated: would not be stated in that way.üîΩIt would say, ‚Äúhaving seen forms with eye consciousness,‚Äù

original: mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba de skad du rgya cher gsungs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba de skad du rgya cher gsungs pa yang yin te /
translated: and it would say, ‚Äúhaving seen forms with the eye, one apprehends signs and brings to bear the mental factor of discrimination.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mig kho nas mthong gi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig kho nas mthong gi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the eye sees, not consciousness.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: mdo ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo ni dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sutra is interpretable in meaning.

original: yang 'dir dgongs pa ni de yin zhe na /üîΩ'dir dgongs pa ni de la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang 'dir dgongs pa ni de yin zhe na / 'dir dgongs pa ni de la brten te zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: What is the intention of the sutra?üîΩThe intention is that the eye sees form in dependence on light, on space, and on attention.

original: yid la brten nas rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid la brten nas rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that consciousness sees form in dependence on the eye.

original: ji ltar de la brten nas rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba yin gyi mig kho nas ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de la brten nas rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba yin gyi mig kho nas ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How do you know that the intention is that consciousness sees in dependence on the eye, and not that the eye sees?

original: de'i phyir dper na yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes par byas nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dper na yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes par byas nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The sutra says, ‚ÄúJust as it is said that the mind element cognizes dharmas, having taken on their marks, etc.‚Äù

original: mdo de nyid las yid kyis chos rnam par shes par byas nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur na don rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo de nyid las yid kyis chos rnam par shes par byas nas mtshan mar 'dzin par mi 'gyur na don rtags su 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: The same sutra says, ‚ÄúHaving cognized dharmas with the mind, one does not grasp them through signs, nor does one grasp the meaning in terms of signs.‚Äù

original: yid ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid ni 'das pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is past, because it has already ceased.

original: 'das pa ni byed pa zhig pa'i phyir ram brjod du med pa'i phyir yid kyis chos rnams rnam par mi shes so //
analyzed: 'das pa ni byed pa zhig pa'i phyir ram brjod du med pa'i phyir yid kyis chos rnams rnam par mi shes so //
translated: The past does not cognize mental objects, because it has already ceased or because it is inexpressible.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: It is the present mind, because it is the mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de la brten nas zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la brten nas zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the mental consciousness is based on the mind.

original: yang na brten pa'i las rten la nye bar btags pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na brten pa'i las rten la nye bar btags pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, the action of the dependent is figuratively designated as the support.

original: brten pa mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i las gzugs mthong ba de'i rten mig dag la nye bar btags pa yin no //üîΩmig gis gzugs mthong nas zhes bya ba de nyid la dpe ni /
analyzed: brten pa mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i las gzugs mthong ba de'i rten mig dag la nye bar btags pa yin no // mig gis gzugs mthong nas zhes bya ba de nyid la dpe ni /
translated: The action of the dependent eye consciousness, seeing visible form, is figuratively designated as the support, the eye.üîΩThe example for this is:

original: dper na khri'u dag 'bod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na khri'u dag 'bod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe benches cry out.‚Äù

original: brten pa'i las 'bod pa de'i rten la nye bar 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brten pa'i las 'bod pa de'i rten la nye bar 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The action of the dependent, crying out, is figuratively designated as the support, the benches.

original: ji ltar mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo las /
translated: As it says in the sutra:

original: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness cognizes visible forms.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa ni de'i brten pa rnam par shes pa'i las yin gyi mig gi ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de'i brten pa rnam par shes pa'i las yin gyi mig gi ma yin te /
translated: The function of consciousness is to be supported by the eye, not the function of the eye.

original: de'i phyir brten pa'i las rten la nye bar btags so zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brten pa'i las rten la nye bar btags so zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the function of the supported is figuratively designated as the function of the support.üîΩOr, the eye is the basis of the form-discerning consciousness and the proximate cause of that consciousness.

original: yang na gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa'i @119b rten gyi dngos po dang nye ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir mig la brten nas rnam par shes par bya bas na /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes par byas so //
analyzed: yang na gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa'i @119b rten gyi dngos po dang nye ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir mig la brten nas rnam par shes par bya bas na / mig gi rnam par shes par byas so //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness is said to see because it is supported by the eye.

original: mdo las bram ze zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩgal te mig gis mthong na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sgo nyid du nges par gsungs ;
analyzed: mdo las bram ze zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / gal te mig gis mthong na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sgo nyid du nges par gsungs ;
translated: The S≈´tra says: ‚ÄúBrahmin, the eye is the basis of the eye consciousness and the form is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩIf the eye sees, why did the Lord say that the eye is the door of seeing?

original: sgo nas ni gzhan gyis mthong ba yin gyi sgos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgo nas ni gzhan gyis mthong ba yin gyi sgos ni ma yin te /
translated: The eye is the door of seeing because seeing is done by the eye consciousness that is supported by the eye and that has form as its object.

original: de'i phyir mig gi sgo nas rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi sgo nas rnam par shes pas mthong ngo zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the eye sees because the eye consciousness sees by means of the eye as its basis.

original: der ni lta ba la sgo zhes bya bar zad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der ni lta ba la sgo zhes bya bar zad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that context, the eye is the door of seeing.

original: mdo der ni lta ba gang yin pa de mig gi las yin zhing lta ba de la sgo zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo der ni lta ba gang yin pa de mig gi las yin zhing lta ba de la sgo zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: In that sutra, seeing is the activity of the eye and that seeing is called a door.

original: de'i phyir mig nyid kyis mthong gi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig nyid kyis mthong gi rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye sees, but consciousness does not.

original: sgo dang lta ba'i sgras don tha mi dad pa nyid yin na ni brjod pa don med pa'i phyir 'dir ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgo dang lta ba'i sgras don tha mi dad pa nyid yin na ni brjod pa don med pa'i phyir 'dir ni mi rung ngo //
translated: If the terms door and seeing were not different in meaning, then this would be illogical because the statement would be meaningless.

original: ci zhe na mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la lta ba yin no zhes de skad smra bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhe na mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la lta ba yin no zhes de skad smra bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What would it be? It would be like saying the eye is seeing in order to see visible form.

original: gal te gzugs rnams mthong ba la gzugs mthong ba nyid sgor gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs rnams mthong ba la gzugs mthong ba nyid sgor gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the eye is the door for seeing visible form,

original: gzhan mthong ba la sgor gyur pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba la sgor gyur pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the door for seeing other objects?üîΩThe sutra states, ‚ÄúThe mind is the door for knowing objects.‚Äù

original: yid ni chos rnams shes par bya ba la sgo yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa der yang yid 'das pa kho na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por gyur pas sgo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yid ni chos rnams shes par bya ba la sgo yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa der yang yid 'das pa kho na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por gyur pas sgo zhes gsungs te /
translated: In that passage, the past mind is called the door because it is the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: yid 'das pas chos thams cad rnam par shes pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid 'das pas chos thams cad rnam par shes pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past mind does not have the power to perceive any object.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs mthong ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir mig la sgo zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs mthong ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir mig la sgo zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: In the same way, here the eye is called a door because it is the basis for seeing form.

original: de la mthong ba'i nus pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i nus pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not have the power to see,

original: bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bems po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is material.

original: gnas brtan 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: gnas brtan 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The elder Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: gang gi phyir yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes so zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir 'dir dgongs pa ni de la brten nas zhes bya ba 'di yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid kyi chos rnams rnam par shes so zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir 'dir dgongs pa ni de la brten nas zhes bya ba 'di yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The intention here is that the mind is the basis for the consciousness of objects, because it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind is conscious of objects.‚Äù

original: de la 'di ni shes byed du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de la 'di ni shes byed du mi 'thad do //
translated: But this is not a valid proof.

original: de dag rigs gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rigs gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are of the same type.

original: gang gi phyir de'i mtshan nyid las yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang yid nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i mtshan nyid las yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang yid nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind is the nature of mental consciousness.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa na /
translated: If mental consciousness is called mind,

original: der ni mtshan nyid du 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der ni mtshan nyid du 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is no contradiction in calling it a characteristic.

original: gang gi phyir yid rab tu spang bas smra ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid rab tu spang bas smra ba'am /
translated: Because the mind is the basis of speech and action,

original: @120a * // byed pa 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa las lus dang ngag gi las slong par byed pa'i nus pa med par brjod cing /
analyzed: @120a * // byed pa 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa las lus dang ngag gi las slong par byed pa'i nus pa med par brjod cing /
translated: it is said that the power to instigate bodily and vocal karma does not exist in past consciousness,

original: da lta ba'i rnam par shes pa la ma yin pas yid nyid rab tu grub po //
analyzed: da lta ba'i rnam par shes pa la ma yin pas yid nyid rab tu grub po //
translated: but in present consciousness. Thus the mind is established.

original: 'o na mdo de las rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa nyid mig la sogs par bzhed kyi thams cad ma yin pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo de las rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa nyid mig la sogs par bzhed kyi thams cad ma yin pa ci zhe na /
translated: But in that s≈´tra, the eye and so on are asserted to be the basis of consciousness, not all faculties.

original: rten bcas rnams la mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten bcas rnams la mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because seeing does not exist in those that possess a basis.

original: de'i phyir de la yid kyang rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa las mngon par 'dod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yid kyang rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa las mngon par 'dod kyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore it should be understood that the mind is asserted to be the basis of consciousness, but not all faculties.

original: de yang 'das pa kho na rten du 'gyur gyi ma skyes pa dang da ltar byung ba yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'das pa kho na rten du 'gyur gyi ma skyes pa dang da ltar byung ba yang ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: And it should be said that only past mind is the basis of consciousness, not future or present mind.

original: 'di ci ltar na de'i shes byed ma yin pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar na de'i shes byed ma yin pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that this is not a proof?

original: 'di na phyogs snga ma'i bsam pa ma gtogs pa'i phyir dgag pa'i phyir lan brjod pa thams cad 'brel med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di na phyogs snga ma'i bsam pa ma gtogs pa'i phyir dgag pa'i phyir lan brjod pa thams cad 'brel med par 'gyur ro //
translated: For, except for the intention of the opponent, all of the replies are irrelevant.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: It was explained above:

original: rnam par shes pa las mthong ba'i las rab tu ma grags pa la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las mthong ba'i las rab tu ma grags pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe activity of seeing is not well known to belong to consciousness.

original: rten la der btags pa mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: rten la der btags pa mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable to impute it to the basis.‚Äù

original: de yang mi rigs te rab tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te rab tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not reasonable, because it is well known.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten na mig gi sgo nas gzugs dmigs pa la mthong zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten na mig gi sgo nas gzugs dmigs pa la mthong zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Because in the world, when form is perceived through the eye, it is said, ‚ÄúI see.‚Äù

original: mig la yod kyang gang mthong ba med do //
analyzed: mig la yod kyang gang mthong ba med do //
translated: Even though it exists in the eye, it is not seeing.

original: rnam par shes pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not like that.

original: rnam par shes pa kho na mthong ba zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //üîΩbram ze mig ni sgo yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kho na mthong ba zhes bya bar shes par bya'o // bram ze mig ni sgo yin no //
translated: It should be understood that consciousness itself is seeing.

original: zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin pa rnams ni gnas brtan 'dus bzang gis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin pa rnams ni gnas brtan 'dus bzang gis bshad do //
translated: The elder Sa·πÉghabhadra explains the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe eye is the door.‚Äù

original: de dag ni shin tu dbye dka' ba dang gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas rnam par dpyad pa ma byas so //
analyzed: de dag ni shin tu dbye dka' ba dang gzhung mangs pa'i 'jigs pas rnam par dpyad pa ma byas so //
translated: We have not analyzed these questions further, fearing prolixity and because these questions are difficult to analyze.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa mthong na gang gis rnam par shes /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa mthong na gang gis rnam par shes /
translated: If consciousness sees, by what is consciousness itself seen?

original: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong ba de'i ltar na ni rnam par shes pas gzugs mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na mig gis mthong ba de'i ltar na ni rnam par shes pas gzugs mthong ngo //
translated: If you maintain that the eye sees, then it is the consciousness that sees visible form.

original: rnam par shes so zhes tha snyad rigs na /
analyzed: rnam par shes so zhes tha snyad rigs na /
translated: If you maintain that consciousness sees, then it is reasonable to say that consciousness perceives.

original: gang gi ltar na rnam par shes pas mthong ba de'i ltar na ni gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa med pas tha snyad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na rnam par shes pas mthong ba de'i ltar na ni gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa med pas tha snyad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that consciousness sees, then it is the consciousness of another that sees, and the conventional expressions would not be justified.

original: mthong ba dang rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod /üîΩgang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang rnam par shes pa 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod / gang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: What is the difference between seeing and perceiving?

original: gang gis gzugs mthong ba dmigs pa de nyid kyis 'di rnam par shes pa yin @120b no ;
analyzed: gang gis gzugs mthong ba dmigs pa de nyid kyis 'di rnam par shes pa yin @120b no ;
translated: If you say that the eye sees, then it is the consciousness that sees the visible form.

original: / gal te dmigs pa mthong ba yin na sgra la sogs pa dag tu yang dmigs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te dmigs pa mthong ba yin na sgra la sogs pa dag tu yang dmigs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object of consciousness is seeing, then sound and the other objects of the other consciousnesses would be seeing.

original: thog ma'i dmigs pa la mthong ba rnam par shes par 'dod kyi dmigs pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thog ma'i dmigs pa la mthong ba rnam par shes par 'dod kyi dmigs pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: The initial object is called seen, but not all objects are seen.

original: dper na shes rab 'ga' zhig la mthong ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na shes rab 'ga' zhig la mthong ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: For example, some wisdom is called seeing, as the text says in an extensive way.

original: lta ba'i rang bzhin brgyad mthong ba yang yin zhing /üîΩrab tu shes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: lta ba'i rang bzhin brgyad mthong ba yang yin zhing / rab tu shes pa yang yin la /
translated: The eight views are both seeing and wisdom.

original: de dag las gzhan rnams ni rab tu shes pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa ni mthong ba yang yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan rnams ni rab tu shes pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du / mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mthong ba yang yin zhing /
translated: The others are only wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa yang yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, eye consciousness is both seeing and consciousness.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: Ear consciousness and so on are only consciousness.

original: shes rab ni rtog par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang de la mthong ba med pa'i phyir mthong ba zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: shes rab ni rtog par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang de la mthong ba med pa'i phyir mthong ba zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Wisdom is not suitable to be called seeing because it is by nature investigation and it does not see.

original: dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par las rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig la khyad par yod pas 'ga' zhig bdag med par mngon par mthong bar mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par las rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig la khyad par yod pas 'ga' zhig bdag med par mngon par mthong bar mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not suitable to perceive some consciousnesses as selfless because they have differences in terms of the nature of their focal object,

original: rnam par shes pa yang bstan du yod pa'i yul nyid la khyad par yod pas 'di ni mtshungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang bstan du yod pa'i yul nyid la khyad par yod pas 'di ni mtshungs te /
translated: then that is similar to the case of consciousness, because it has differences in terms of the object that is visible.

original: sngar yang khyad par bstan zin to //
analyzed: sngar yang khyad par bstan zin to //
translated: Moreover, the difference has already been explained.

original: gzhan dag na re gal te mig gis mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gal te mig gis mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Others say: If it is said that the eye sees,

original: de la mig 'byed pa na mthong ba zhes brjod pa rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba gzhan 'dra ba zhig yod la /
analyzed: de la mig 'byed pa na mthong ba zhes brjod pa rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba gzhan 'dra ba zhig yod la /
translated: then it is said that the eye sees when it opens, and there is a function similar to consciousness that is not separate from consciousness.

original: bya ba med par yang byed pa po nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: bya ba med par yang byed pa po nyid mi rigs te /
translated: But it is illogical that an agent exists without action,

original: 'gro ba nyid bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba nyid bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: just like going.

original: de ni glan gar mi rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni glan gar mi rung ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: That is not a suitable response.

original: rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa zhes brjod na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa zhes brjod na /
translated: If consciousness is called consciousness,

original: de la ni byed pa po dang bya ba bye brag kyang med de /
analyzed: de la ni byed pa po dang bya ba bye brag kyang med de /
translated: And in that case, there is no distinction between the agent and the action,

original: rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no action of consciousness apart from consciousness.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang byed pa po las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba med pas mig gis mthong ngo zhes byed pa po bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang byed pa po las ma gtogs pa'i bya ba med pas mig gis mthong ngo zhes byed pa po bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, here also, since there is no action apart from the agent, the agent is indicated when it is said that the eye sees.

original: gal te 'dir yang de gnas so zhe na de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang de gnas so zhe na de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the same is true here, that is not so,

original: thams cad du dngos po tsam gyi byed pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du dngos po tsam gyi byed pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in all cases, the mere entity is indicated as the agent.

original: dper na grib ma 'gro'o mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rang gi rkyen dag las yul gang la skye ba de'i rnam par skyed pa las bya ba med kyang de nyid kyis yul rnam par shes pa zhes @121a * //
analyzed: dper na grib ma 'gro'o mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rang gi rkyen dag las yul gang la skye ba de'i rnam par skyed pa las bya ba med kyang de nyid kyis yul rnam par shes pa zhes @121a * //
translated: For example, it is said that a shadow moves or does not move. In the same way, consciousness is produced in the aspect of the object from its own conditions. Although it does not act, it is said that it perceives the object,üîΩbecause it is produced in the aspect of the object.

original: brjod do // gzhan dag na re mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brjod do // gzhan dag na re mthong ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin la zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say: Seeing is eye consciousness.

original: mthong ba ni blta ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni blta ba'o //
translated: Seeing is looking.

original: de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the basis of that.

original: mig ni mig gi rnam bar shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni las la byed pa po bzhin 'jug pas rab tu grags pa'i dpe yang mig la 'jug ste /
analyzed: mig ni mig gi rnam bar shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni las la byed pa po bzhin 'jug pas rab tu grags pa'i dpe yang mig la 'jug ste /
