translated: The eye is the basis of the eye consciousness. The example is well known in terms of the agent of action, but it is applied to the eye.

original: de'i phyir mig gis mthong zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gis mthong zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the eye sees.

original: dper na sgrogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyid la 'jig rten na grags pa'i dpe smras pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sgrogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyid la 'jig rten na grags pa'i dpe smras pa'o //
translated: For example, because it is the basis of proclamation, the example that is well known in the world is stated.

original: de lta na mig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na mig ces bya ba la /
translated: In that case, the eye.

original: gal te mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is said that the eye sees because it is the basis of seeing,

original: de lta na rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis rnam par shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis rnam par shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that the eye is conscious because it is the basis of consciousness.

original: byed ba po dang bya ba'i tha snyad 'di ni 'jig rten pa yin no //
analyzed: byed ba po dang bya ba'i tha snyad 'di ni 'jig rten pa yin no //
translated: But that is not so, because the conventions of agent and action are worldly.

original: 'jig rten na rnam par shes pa de ni mthong ba'o zhes grags te zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rnam par shes pa de ni mthong ba'o zhes grags te zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: In the world, consciousness is called seeing.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa las zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa las zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The great treatise on differentiation states:

original: 'jig rten na yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bstan bcos las kyang de mthong bar brjod do zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bstan bcos las kyang de mthong bar brjod do zhes ston to //
translated: Not only in the world, but also in treatises, seeing is expressed in terms of consciousness.üîΩIt is said that when the eye sense faculty contacts form,

original: mig dang phrad cing zhes bya ba ni mig gis bltas shing de la snang bar gyur pa ste /üîΩde yul gyi dngos por gyur cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig dang phrad cing zhes bya ba ni mig gis bltas shing de la snang bar gyur pa ste / de yul gyi dngos por gyur cing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is said that the eye sees form,üîΩbecause the eye is the basis of seeing.

original: gal te mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba na /
translated: If it is said that the eye sees because it is the basis of seeing,

original: 'o na ni gang gi rten du gyur pas rnam par shes pas gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang gi rten du gyur pas rnam par shes pas gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod do //
translated: then it should be said that consciousness cognizes form because it is the basis of cognition.

original: de las rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Apart from consciousness, there is no other action.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni yod tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni yod tsam gyis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúConsciousness exists merely as a nominal designation.‚Äù

original: mig ni nye ba tsam gyis mthong ngo zhes bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: mig ni nye ba tsam gyis mthong ngo zhes bstan par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that the eye sees merely because it is present,

original: de dang mtshungs pa'i mig kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa'i mig kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are eyes that are similar to it but do not see.

original: rnam par shes pa ni de lta ma yin pas de yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni de lta ma yin pas de yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod de /
translated: Consciousness, on the other hand, is not like that. Therefore, it is said that form is perceived merely because consciousness exists.

original: dper na nyi mas nyin mor byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi mas nyin mor byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is said that the sun makes the day.

original: 'di ltar gling rnams kyi snang ba'i gnas ni nyin mo yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gling rnams kyi snang ba'i gnas ni nyin mo yin la /
translated: In this case, the day is the time when the continents are illuminated by the sun.

original: de yang 'od dang bcas pa'i nyi ma las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'od dang bcas pa'i nyi ma las gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that is not something that exists apart from the sun with its rays.

original: @121b de'i phyir nyi ma yod pa las nyin mor byed pa'o //
analyzed: @121b de'i phyir nyi ma yod pa las nyin mor byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the sun makes the day because it exists.

original: yang na gal te mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ba rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang na gal te mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ba rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mthong ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Or, if it is claimed that the eye sees because it is the basis of seeing, then consciousness does not see because it is the basis of perception.

original: yid kho nas rnam par shes bar byed pas na /
analyzed: yid kho nas rnam par shes bar byed pas na /
translated: It is the mind alone that perceives.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but it does not follow that it is consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes gsungs mod kyi /üîΩmig la sogs pa rnam bar shes pa las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid du yod pas de lta na yang mtshungs ba de ma thag pa 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur bas da lta ba'i mig gi rnam par shes
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes gsungs mod kyi / mig la sogs pa rnam bar shes pa las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid du yod pas de lta na yang mtshungs ba de ma thag pa 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur bas da lta ba'i mig gi rnam par shes
translated: The Lord has said, ‚ÄúConsciousness cognizes.‚Äù

original: pa la sogs pas shes sogs bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa la sogs pas shes sogs bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though that is so, the immediately past consciousness that is a different nature from eye consciousness and so on would be the basis of another consciousness, and thus the present eye consciousness and so on would not cognize it.

original: 'das pa kho nas don dam pa las rnam par shes pa'i bya ba da ltar ba ma yin pa de las ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'das pa kho nas don dam pa las rnam par shes pa'i bya ba da ltar ba ma yin pa de las ma gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the past alone is the ultimate activity of consciousness, and consciousness does not exist apart from that present activity.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes so zhes bya ste nye bar btags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes so zhes bya ste nye bar btags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Consciousness is said to cognize form by the mere existence of consciousness. This is the meaning of the designation.

original: yang na mthong ba'i rten gyis mthong ngo zhes bya ba bshad pa la /
analyzed: yang na mthong ba'i rten gyis mthong ngo zhes bya ba bshad pa la /
translated: Or else, it is explained that seeing is seeing by means of the basis of seeing.üîΩIn that case, when the basis of ear-consciousness becomes the immediately preceding past of eye-consciousness, it would be said that it cognizes form.

original: rna ba'i rnam bar shes ba'i rten yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i 'das par gyur pa na des sgo rnam par shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam bar shes ba'i rten yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i 'das par gyur pa na des sgo rnam par shes so zhes bya bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Therefore, it is said that consciousness is not the cognizer, etc.

original: gsungs te / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dus su mig gi rnam bar shes pa nye ba ma yin pas de yang yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gsungs te / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dus su mig gi rnam bar shes pa nye ba ma yin pas de yang yod pa tsam gyis gzugs rnam par shes so zhes brjod de /
translated: At the time of ear-consciousness, eye-consciousness is not proximate, so it is said that form is cognized by the mere existence of that.

original: de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pas sgra rnam par shes so zhes thal bar 'gyur pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pas sgra rnam par shes so zhes thal bar 'gyur pa med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the consequence that eye-consciousness cognizes sound would follow.

original: 'di ni mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: This is the intention of the statement, ‚ÄúThe eye sees,

original: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes bya ba 'di'i dgongs ba gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas rnam par shes so zhes bya ba 'di'i dgongs ba gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: consciousness cognizes.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re de la mthong ba dang rnam par shes pa dag khyad par med par bshad pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de la mthong ba dang rnam par shes pa dag khyad par med par bshad pa la /
translated: Others say: In the explanation that seeing and consciousness are not different,

original: de'i khyad par 'chad par 'dod pas 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de'i khyad par 'chad par 'dod pas 'di bshad de /
translated: he explains this in order to explain their difference.

original: mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir mig gis mthong ngo //
translated: The eye sees because it is the basis of seeing.

original: yod pa tsam gyis rnam par shes pas rnam par shes kyi 'dis mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yod pa tsam gyis rnam par shes pas rnam par shes kyi 'dis mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Consciousness is consciousness by the mere fact of existing, but it is not seeing.
Here,

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re zhes bya ba la /
translated: the Sautrantikas say:

original: ci mig gis mthong ngam rnam par shes pas mthong zhes bya ba'i skabs gang yin pa der ro //
analyzed: ci mig gis mthong ngam rnam par shes pas mthong zhes bya ba'i skabs gang yin pa der ro //
translated: In the context of the question, ‚ÄúDoes the eye see or does consciousness see?‚Äù

original: de dag ji skad zer zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ji skad zer zhe na /
translated: What do they say?

original: nam mkha' ba ldad pa 'di ci dgos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ba ldad pa 'di ci dgos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is the point of this chewing of air?

original: rnam par dpyad pa 'di ni nam mkha' 'cha' ba dang 'dra bar dgos pa med de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa 'di ni nam mkha' 'cha' ba dang 'dra bar dgos pa med de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This analysis is like chewing air. It is pointless.

original: yang ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa 'di dgos pa med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rnam par dpyad pa 'di dgos pa med ce na /
translated: Again, why is this analysis pointless?

original: de'i phyir mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig dang gzugs la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIn dependence on the eye and form,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:üîΩThe existence of the effect is preceded by the existence of the cause.

original: 'bras bu'i yod pa ni rgyu'i yod pa sngon du 'gro ba yin na de la blta ba ni su zhig mthong bar byed pa su zhig yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yod pa ni rgyu'i yod pa sngon du 'gro ba yin na de la blta ba ni su zhig mthong bar byed pa su zhig yin /
translated: But in that case, who sees, and who is the one who sees?

original: 'di la tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la tshig tsam gyis dad par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you do not have faith in this through mere words,

original: de'i phyir 'di ni byed pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni byed pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs /
translated: then the following is stated: ‚ÄúIt is devoid of activity,‚Äù and so on.

original: byed pa med ba dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i yod pa las tha dad pa'i bya ba 'gal ba de /
analyzed: byed pa med ba dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i yod pa las tha dad pa'i bya ba 'gal ba de /
translated: ‚ÄúDevoid of activity‚Äù means that activity that is different from the existence of the cause is contradictory.

original: de las tha dad pa'i bya ba khas blangs na skad cig mar 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i bya ba khas blangs na skad cig mar 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur na /
translated: If you accept that activity is different from that, then you undermine the momentary disintegration of things.

original: dngos po rnams skad cig phan chad gnas pa ni tshad ma dag dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig phan chad gnas pa ni tshad ma dag dang 'gal lo //
translated: The endurance of things for more than an instant is contradicted by valid knowledge.

original: chos tsam zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos tsam zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMere phenomena‚Äù means that the internal agent, the person, is refuted.

original: rgyu'i byed pa dang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa dang nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, although there is no agent of the causal process or of the internal process, the relation of cause and effect is not contradictory in regard to cause and effect, he says: ‚ÄúIt is merely cause and effect. ‚Äù

original: tha snyad gdags pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha snyad gdags pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of conventional expression‚Äù means

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos su'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos su'o //
translated: in the world and in the treatises.

original: 'dun pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni don gyi mtshan gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni don gyi mtshan gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn terms of desire‚Äù means that it is not in terms of the characteristic of the object.

original: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not cling to this,

original: tha snyad pa'i don ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i don ni btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of conventional expression is a designation.

original: don dam par btsal na mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par btsal na mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is sought in the ultimate, it is not perceived.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya bas ni tha snyad pa'i don la mngon par zhen pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag pa mdzad do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya bas ni tha snyad pa'i don la mngon par zhen pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag pa mdzad do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Lord‚Äù shows that the Lord has refuted clinging to the object of conventional expression.

original: ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon bar zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩljongs kyi mi dang ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa ste /
analyzed: ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon bar zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la / ljongs kyi mi dang ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa ste /
translated: One should not cling to the etymologies of the words of the world.

original: gtan la phab pa'i nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gtan la phab pa'i nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words of the world and the etymologies of the words of the world are the established etymologies.

original: ci'i phyir @122b 'di 'dis nges par byas zhes de dag la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir @122b 'di 'dis nges par byas zhes de dag la mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: Why is this determined by this? One should not cling to them.

original: ci'i phyir 'di ni nges pa'i tshig yin gyi thams cad don dang ldan par rtog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ni nges pa'i tshig yin gyi thams cad don dang ldan par rtog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is this an etymology? One should not imagine that everything has meaning.

original: 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu brgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu brgyug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not run after the names of the world.

original: rtog pa dang rab tu brgyug par bya zhes bya ba 'di ni don gcig go //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rab tu brgyug par bya zhes bya ba 'di ni don gcig go //
translated: Running after and imagining have the same meaning.

original: gzhan dag na re lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bdag ni yod de zhes bya bar yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa'i sgo nas bdag dang srog ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad lhag par sgro btagsüîΩpar mi bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lus la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i bdag ni yod de zhes bya bar yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa'i sgo nas bdag dang srog ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad lhag par sgro btags par mi bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: The self and life force are merely imputed by the world due to the superimposition of what is unreal.

original: don med pa'i phyir ming yang med do zhes btags par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ming yang med do zhes btags par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúIt should be said that the name does not exist because it is meaningless‚Äù is that the name of the self does not exist because it is meaningless.

original: 'di ni kha che bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub ba'i mtha' yin na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni kha che bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub ba'i mtha' yin na zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the final position of the Vaibhasikas of Kasmir.

original: 'di ni kha che bye brag tu smra ba rnams la rab tu grags pa'i chos mngon pa bshad pa'i skabs su bab pas de'i phyir de dag nyid phyogs phyi mar gnas par byed do //üîΩgal te gang yang rung ba zhig btsums na /
analyzed: 'di ni kha che bye brag tu smra ba rnams la rab tu grags pa'i chos mngon pa bshad pa'i skabs su bab pas de'i phyir de dag nyid phyogs phyi mar gnas par byed do // gal te gang yang rung ba zhig btsums na /
translated: This is the final position of the Vaibhasikas of Kasmir because it is well known to them.üîΩIf one closes either the left or right eye,

original: gzugs gang yang rung ba zhig dmigs pa'i phyir gnyi gas mthong bar nus par grub bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs gang yang rung ba zhig dmigs pa'i phyir gnyi gas mthong bar nus par grub bzhin du /
translated: one can see any form.

original: yang ci'i phyir mig gcig gis zhes rgyas bar dpyod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mig gcig gis zhes rgyas bar dpyod ce na /
translated: Why does he analyze in detail, ‚ÄúWhy is it that one eye does not see‚Äù?

original: gnyi ga phye na mthong ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gnyi ga phye na mthong ba gang yin pa de /
translated: If both eyes are open, then whatever is seenüîΩis it seen gradually or all at once?

original: ci rim gyis sam 'on te cig car yin zhes bya ba 'di ma dpyad pas de'i phyir dmigs kyis nges par bya ba'i phyir rtsom mo //
analyzed: ci rim gyis sam 'on te cig car yin zhes bya ba 'di ma dpyad pas de'i phyir dmigs kyis nges par bya ba'i phyir rtsom mo //
translated: Since this has not been analyzed, he begins in order to determine this point.

original: 'di la nges pa med de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la nges pa med de zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no certainty in this matter.

original: de dag gang yang rung ba zhig btsums pa'am rnam par nyams na cig shos kyis mthong ba'i nus pa la gnod do zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de dag gang yang rung ba zhig btsums pa'am rnam par nyams na cig shos kyis mthong ba'i nus pa la gnod do zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: If either of the two eyes is closed or damaged, the ability to see is impaired by the other.

original: mig gis gzugs mthong yang btsums pa dang nyams pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong yang btsums pa dang nyams pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: Others say: The eye sees form, but not when it is closed or damaged.

original: cig car du mig gnyi ga dag gis mthong ste /
analyzed: cig car du mig gnyi ga dag gis mthong ste /
translated: Both eyes see simultaneously.

original: kyang gi sgras ni gcig gis kyang 'di gnyis kho na'am gcig kho nas zhes nges par ni mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni gcig gis kyang 'di gnyis kho na'am gcig kho nas zhes nges par ni mi gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is not ascertained that only these two or only one sees.

original: des pa 'di gang las she na gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des pa 'di gang las she na gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: From what is this certain? From the clear seeing.

original: chos mngon ba pa smos pa ni /
analyzed: chos mngon ba pa smos pa ni /
translated: The term ‚Äúin the Abhidharma‚Äù is statedüîΩbecause this is a treatise of the Abhidharma.

original: mdo sde pa rnams las kha cig gis kyang mthong ngo zhes 'dod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar gnyi ga phye na zhes rgyas par 'byung pa la /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams las kha cig gis kyang mthong ngo zhes 'dod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar gnyi ga phye na zhes rgyas par 'byung pa la /
translated: If one eye is open, the form is seen more clearly than when both eyes are closed, but less clearly than when both eyes are open.üîΩIf one eye is closed and the other is open, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are open, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.üîΩIf one eye is half closed and the other is open, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are open, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.üîΩIf one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.

original: mig gcig btsums na gzugs gang zhig rgyun @123a * //üîΩchags su 'jug pa mi gsal bar dmigs pa de gnyi ga phye bas ches gsal bar dmigs te /
analyzed: mig gcig btsums na gzugs gang zhig rgyun @123a * // chags su 'jug pa mi gsal bar dmigs pa de gnyi ga phye bas ches gsal bar dmigs te /
translated: If one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.üîΩIf one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.

original: gcig gis mthong na ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu mthong ba khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig gis mthong na ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag tu mthong ba khyad par du mi 'gyur ro // gang yang rung ba zhig gzhan du gyur na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.

original: gal te phye ba gang yin pa de phyed btsums pa'am phyed btsums pa de thams cad phye ba'am /üîΩthams cad btsums na des zla ba gnyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te phye ba gang yin pa de phyed btsums pa'am phyed btsums pa de thams cad phye ba'am / thams cad btsums na des zla ba gnyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.

original: de'i phyir mig gcig gis mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gcig gis mthong ba yin no //
translated: If one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.üîΩIf one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.üîΩIf one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.üîΩIf one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than when both eyes are half closed, but more clearly than when both eyes are closed.üîΩIf one eye is half closed and the other is half closed, the form is seen less clearly than

original: de lta ma yin na mig gcig phye ba dang / gnyis pa phyed btsums pa na zla ba gnyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mig gcig phye ba dang / gnyis pa phyed btsums pa na zla ba gnyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, when one eye is open and the other is half open and half closed, two moons would not be apprehended.

original: gcig phyed btsums pa'am phye ba dag gis zla ba gnyis 'dzin par mthong ba de'i phyir gnyis ka yang der nus so zhes bya bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: gcig phyed btsums pa'am phye ba dag gis zla ba gnyis 'dzin par mthong ba de'i phyir gnyis ka yang der nus so zhes bya bar nges pa'o //
translated: Since one sees the apprehension of two moons with one eye half closed and half open or open, it is certain that both are capable of that.

original: rnam grangs mthong ba dper brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs mthong ba dper brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The example of seeing a double moon is mentioned.

original: 'dra ba mthong ba la gnyis nyid du mngon par brjod pa'i phyir zhes pa'i tshig gis 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba mthong ba la gnyis nyid du mngon par brjod pa'i phyir zhes pa'i tshig gis 'phangs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù implies that the double moon is expressed as two due to seeing a resemblance.

original: phyed phye ba dang btsums pa dag gis zla ba gnyis 'dzin pa rten 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i rten nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: phyed phye ba dang btsums pa dag gis zla ba gnyis 'dzin pa rten 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i rten nyid du bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the two eyes are the basis of the double moon because the apprehension of the double moon conforms to the condition of the eyes being half open and half closed.

original: cig shos ma yin pa gzhan du 'gyur bas zla ba gnyis 'dzin pa'i rten rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos ma yin pa gzhan du 'gyur bas zla ba gnyis 'dzin pa'i rten rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other eye is not like that, so the basis of the double moon does not change.

original: gal te gnyi gas mthong na rten rnam par chad pas rnam par shes pa rnam par chad pas sems can gcig gi mig gi dbang po ltar skad cig ma gcig la rnam par shes pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi gas mthong na rten rnam par chad pas rnam par shes pa rnam par chad pas sems can gcig gi mig gi dbang po ltar skad cig ma gcig la rnam par shes pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If both eyes were to see, then consciousness would be divided because the basis is divided. Thus, it would follow that two consciousnesses would arise simultaneously in one sentient being, just as in the case of the eye faculty of one sentient being.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang rnam par ma chad pa lus kyi dbang po'i rten yin pas /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa yang rnam par ma chad pa lus kyi dbang po'i rten yin pas /
translated: Also, body consciousness would not be divided because the body faculty is the basis of body consciousness.

original: de'i phyir mig gcig nyid kyis mthong gi gnyis dag gis ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gcig nyid kyis mthong gi gnyis dag gis ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, one eye sees, not both eyes.

original: 'jug pa myur ba'i phyir der mngon par nga rgyal ba tsam la gnyis dag gis mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa myur ba'i phyir der mngon par nga rgyal ba tsam la gnyis dag gis mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the operation of consciousness is swift, it is merely a matter of pride to say that both eyes see.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir rten rnam bar chad bas zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten rnam bar chad bas zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the basis is divided, etc.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul ni mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ni mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object does not remain.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug bzhin rten dang brten pa'i ngo bos mig la gnas te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'khar gzhong dang rgya shug bzhin rten dang brten pa'i ngo bos mig la gnas te /
translated: Eye consciousness is located in the eye in the nature of a support and something supported, like a bowl and yogurt.

original: de dag gyur pas 'gyur ba'i phyir mig la de'i rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gyur pas 'gyur ba'i phyir mig la de'i rten zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye is called the basis of the visual consciousness because the latter is produced in dependence on the former.

original: de'i phyir rten gcig la rag las pa'i phyir dang / yul @123b na mi gnas pa'i phyir mig rgyas kyang rnam par shes pa gcig skyed par 'gal ba med na gnyis kyis yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten gcig la rag las pa'i phyir dang / yul @123b na mi gnas pa'i phyir mig rgyas kyang rnam par shes pa gcig skyed par 'gal ba med na gnyis kyis yin pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the fact that a single basis gives rise to a single visual consciousness, even though the object is not localized, because the object is not localized.

original: dper na lag pa gnyis kyi cig car dro ba'i 'dus te reg pa las lus kyi rnam par shes pa re re rnam par ma chad par skye ste /
analyzed: dper na lag pa gnyis kyi cig car dro ba'i 'dus te reg pa las lus kyi rnam par shes pa re re rnam par ma chad par skye ste /
translated: For example, a single body consciousness arises from the simultaneous contact of the two hands with heat, without the arising of two body consciousnesses.

original: sun 'byin pas chod pa na gcig gis kyang rnam par shes pa du ma skyed par thal ba med do //
analyzed: sun 'byin pas chod pa na gcig gis kyang rnam par shes pa du ma skyed par thal ba med do //
translated: And when the hands are removed, there is no arising of many body consciousnesses from a single hand.

original: thams cad kyi rkyen nyen cig car ram rim gyis skye bar smra ba rnams re shig mig g-yas pa'i rnam par shes pa skye'i cig shos kyi ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ci las she na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rkyen nyen cig car ram rim gyis skye bar smra ba rnams re shig mig g-yas pa'i rnam par shes pa skye'i cig shos kyi ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ci las she na /
translated: Those who maintain that all conditions arise either simultaneously or in sequence must explain why the visual consciousness of the right eye arises and not the other.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu dang yul dang 'bras bu smra ba'i bdag nyid mig gis mthong ba la yang yan lag du mas rnam par shes pa skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu dang yul dang 'bras bu smra ba'i bdag nyid mig gis mthong ba la yang yan lag du mas rnam par shes pa skyed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self is the cause, object, and result of seeing, then it follows that consciousness is produced by many parts.

original: thams cad khyad par med na rdul phra rab gcig la rten pa nyid kyang mi rung ste /
analyzed: thams cad khyad par med na rdul phra rab gcig la rten pa nyid kyang mi rung ste /
translated: If there is no difference between all of them, then it is not possible for the self to be the support of a single atom.

original: khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas pa de'i rten rnam par chad pas rnam par chad pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas pa de'i rten rnam par chad pas rnam par chad pa'o //
translated: Because there is no cause for a difference, and because the self does not abide in a place, the self is not the support of the consciousness that is limited by the place of the object.

original: gzugs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //üîΩgal te yul na mi gnas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji ltar mig gi dbang po'i rten gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gzugs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i dpe'o // gal te yul na mi gnas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji ltar mig gi dbang po'i rten gzugs so sor rnam par rig pa mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike form‚Äù is an example of something that is not the support of consciousness.üîΩIf the mind and mental factors do not abide in a place, how can the form that is the support of the eye faculty be called the eye consciousness?

original: ci ltar mig las de'i rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid de dang der mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar mig las de'i rnam par shes pa'i rten nyid de dang der mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba med ce na /
translated: How can the eye faculty be the support of the consciousness that is called ‚Äúeye consciousness,‚Äù since the eye faculty does not abide in a place?

original: skyed pa la thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir gnas dang rten du brjod do //
analyzed: skyed pa la thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis nye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir gnas dang rten du brjod do //
translated: It is called the basis and support because it is the uncommon cause of the generation of the other faculties, since it is the proximate cause of their generation.üîΩBut it is not said to be their basis in that context.

original: de'i gnas skabs su gsungs pa ma yin pa de de'i rten du gsungs par gyur zhe na 'bru'i rten pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs su gsungs pa ma yin pa de de'i rten du gsungs par gyur zhe na 'bru'i rten pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the basis of grain.

original: lhas byin rgyal po la brten cing gnas zhes brtags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhas byin rgyal po la brten cing gnas zhes brtags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that Devadatta is designated as the basis and support of the king.

original: gal te dbang po la phan pa dang gnod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de la gnas so zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po la phan pa dang gnod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de la gnas so zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is their basis because it benefits and harms the faculties, that is not so.

original: grib ma dang 'od dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang shing dang bcas pa la sogs pa gnas la yang /
analyzed: grib ma dang 'od dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang shing dang bcas pa la sogs pa gnas la yang /
translated: Because we see that shadows, light, reflections and so on and trees and so forth are bases that benefit and harm the faculties.

original: rjes su byed ba mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su byed ba mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because we see that they benefit and harm the faculties.

original: rgya mtsho zla ba zad pa dang 'phel ba'i rjes su byed ba bzhin 'di dag de la gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho zla ba zad pa dang 'phel ba'i rjes su byed ba bzhin 'di dag de la gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the basis of the faculties because the ocean and the moon are not the basis of the waxing and waning of the moon.

original: dbang po rnams yul la 'jug pa gcig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pas sha'i gong bu skye bo sun 'byin ba rdzi ma dang @124a * //
analyzed: dbang po rnams yul la 'jug pa gcig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pas sha'i gong bu skye bo sun 'byin ba rdzi ma dang @124a * //
translated: Because the sense faculties engage their objects in a single way, consciousness is like a lump of meat that is not a sentient being.üîΩ

original: thur ma la sogs pa rnams mi 'dzin te cha nye bar gyur bas dbang po'i yul du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thur ma la sogs pa rnams mi 'dzin te cha nye bar gyur bas dbang po'i yul du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness does not apprehend the mass of flesh, the eyelashes, the spoon, etc., because they are not the object-field of the sense-faculty, since they are not in contact with the sense-faculty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yul gyis bskal pa'i gzugs kyang mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yul gyis bskal pa'i gzugs kyang mi 'dzin no //
translated: For the same reason, it does not apprehend the form that is hidden or screened.

original: de lta ma yin na yul gyis bskal ba'i gzugs 'dzin pa la su zhig gegs byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yul gyis bskal ba'i gzugs 'dzin pa la su zhig gegs byed par 'gyur /
translated: If it were otherwise, what would prevent the consciousness from apprehending the form that is hidden or screened?

original: gal te dbang po'i yul nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa'i mig gis sha'i gong bu rnams 'dzin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i yul nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa'i mig gis sha'i gong bu rnams 'dzin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the eye consciousness were to apprehend the mass of flesh that is the object-field of the eye sense-faculty,

original: gang du gzugs kyi yul la de mi gnas bas de 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du gzugs kyi yul la de mi gnas bas de 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not apprehend the form that is hidden or screened, since it is not the object-field of the eye sense-faculty.

original: de'i phyir chos de dag gi rnam bar shes ba rnams de'i rten la sogs pa nye ba dang ring ba dag mi 'dzin te thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu'i yul nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de dag gi rnam bar shes ba rnams de'i rten la sogs pa nye ba dang ring ba dag mi 'dzin te thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu'i yul nyid do //
translated: Thus the consciousnesses of these factors do not apprehend the near or the distant, because of the difference in the object-field of the specific cause.

original: gzhan dag na re sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyis myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩgzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams la mtha' du ma'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'bras bu nyid kyis myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no // gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams la mtha' du ma'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The sense faculties are the effect of the mind and mental factors, like a sprout and so on.üîΩOthers say: The sense faculties are the effect of the mind and mental factors, like a reflection and so on.

original: ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu'i yul de bzhin du de'i rgyud du gtogs pa la yang rnam par shes pa dang yid ni mig la sogs pa'i yul ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu'i yul de bzhin du de'i rgyud du gtogs pa la yang rnam par shes pa dang yid ni mig la sogs pa'i yul ma yin zhing /
translated: Just as the object is not a common effect, in the same way, the mind and the mental faculty are not objects of the eye faculty and so on,

original: de rnam par shes pa'i rgyud ma yin pa'i phyir de ltar dbang po brten pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa cha shas dang bcas pa nyid dang du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba sngar nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa'i rgyud ma yin pa'i phyir de ltar dbang po brten pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa cha shas dang bcas pa nyid dang du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba sngar nyid du bshad do //
translated: because they are not a continuum of consciousness. Thus, it was previously explained that the sense faculties would be consciousness, have parts, and be multiple.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir lhag ma dbang po'i rdul phra rab bzhin du rdul phra rab gcig kyang de'i rten du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir lhag ma dbang po'i rdul phra rab bzhin du rdul phra rab gcig kyang de'i rten du mi rung ngo //
translated: Because there is no distinction, like the atoms of the sense faculties, a single atom is not suitable as their basis.

original: ci 'di dag yul dang phrad pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci 'di dag yul dang phrad pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Do these sense faculties contact their objects?

original: the tshom 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: the tshom 'di ga las she na /
translated: From what is this doubt?

original: gnyi ga yang bsnyad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang bsnyad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are seen to be mentioned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du mig ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams la thogs so zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du mig ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams la thogs so zhes gsungs na /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, ‚ÄúThe eye is obstructed by these, agreeable and disagreeable forms.‚Äù

original: ma phrad pa la ni thogs pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: ma phrad pa la ni thogs pa mi rigs so //
translated: Obstruction is not tenable for that which does not make contact.

original: slar yang de lha'i mig gis sems can rnams la blta'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: slar yang de lha'i mig gis sems can rnams la blta'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Again, ‚ÄúHe sees sentient beings with the divine eye.‚Äù

original: ring ba gang dag yin pa dang nye ba gang dag yin pa zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: ring ba gang dag yin pa dang nye ba gang dag yin pa zhes gsungs na /
translated: And it is said, ‚ÄúThose that are distant and those that are near.‚Äù

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni nye ba dang ring ba'i rnam par gzhag pa mi srid do //
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni nye ba dang ring ba'i rnam par gzhag pa mi srid do //
translated: If there were contact with the object, the arrangement of distant and near would be impossible.

original: gal te yul dang phrad pa'i dbang du byas na yul 'dzin pa thams cad phrad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te yul dang phrad pa'i dbang du byas na yul 'dzin pa thams cad phrad pa nyid do //
translated: If it is from the point of view of contact with the object, then all apprehensions of the object are contact.

original: ci ste bar mtshams med par phrad na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste bar mtshams med par phrad na de'i phyir /
translated: If there is contact without an interval, then

original: mig dang yid dang rna ba ni /
analyzed: mig dang yid dang rna ba ni /
translated: the eye, the ear, and the mind

original: yul dang ma @124b phrad ;
analyzed: yul dang ma @124b phrad ;
translated: do not make contact with their objects.

original: 'di ltar gzugs rgyang ring po nas mthong zhing zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul dang ma phrad pa'o zhes bya bar shes par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs rgyang ring po nas mthong zhing zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul dang ma phrad pa'o zhes bya bar shes par byed do //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúone sees form from a distance‚Äù indicates that the sense faculty does not contact its object.

original: mig la yod pa'i mig sman mi mthong zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul dang phrad pa yin pa zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mig la yod pa'i mig sman mi mthong zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul dang phrad pa yin pa zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not see eye ointment‚Äù indicates that the sense faculty does not contact its object.

original: de lta yin pas yul dang ma phrad pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin pas yul dang ma phrad pa kho na'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since this is the case, it is certain that the sense faculty does not contact its object.

original: gang gi phyir yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa nyid ni gnyi ga ji lta bas smos pas yul dang phrad pa nyid bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa nyid ni gnyi ga ji lta bas smos pas yul dang phrad pa nyid bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the sense faculty is said to contact or not contact its object in the same way that both are possible, the sense faculty is said to not contact its object.

original: gang dag brten nas byung ste yul la gnas so zhes yul dang phrad bar 'dod ba de dag gis ni yang 'dod pa tsam du zad de nye ba dang ring ba dag la dus mnyam par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag brten nas byung ste yul la gnas so zhes yul dang phrad bar 'dod ba de dag gis ni yang 'dod pa tsam du zad de nye ba dang ring ba dag la dus mnyam par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who assert that the sense faculty contacts its object because it arises in dependence on its object and abides on the object are merely stating their opinion, because near and far objects are apprehended simultaneously.

original: chos 'di ni nag po la sogs pa 'gro ba dang ldan pa rnams la mthong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di ni nag po la sogs pa 'gro ba dang ldan pa rnams la mthong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: This is not seen in the case of the black and so on.

original: gal te mig ni 'od zer yin pa'i phyir mar me bzhin du thag nye ba dang ring ba dag lhan cig gsal bar byed pa mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig ni 'od zer yin pa'i phyir mar me bzhin du thag nye ba dang ring ba dag lhan cig gsal bar byed pa mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eye is like a lamp, because it is light, there is no contradiction in its illuminating both the distant and the near simultaneously,

original: blta bar 'dod pa mun khung du snang ba tshol ba'i phyir 'od zer nyid ma grub po //
analyzed: blta bar 'dod pa mun khung du snang ba tshol ba'i phyir 'od zer nyid ma grub po //
translated: we reply that the eye is not established as light, because one who desires to see seeks light in the dark.

original: gal te mig ni 'od zer nyung ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi snang ba tshol bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig ni 'od zer nyung ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi snang ba tshol bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eye seeks external light because it is weak in light,

original: nyung ngu ni mang pos zil gyis gnon par mthong ba'i phyir dmigs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyung ngu ni mang pos zil gyis gnon par mthong ba'i phyir dmigs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: we reply that it would not be an object, because the weak is seen to be overwhelmed by the strong.

original: dpe dang dpe can mtshungs pa yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: dpe dang dpe can mtshungs pa yang ma yin te ;
translated: The example and the exemplified are not similar,

original: bar med par phrad pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar med par phrad pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the lamp illuminates without contact.

original: mar me ni sdong bu dang mar la sogs pa phrad bsreg cing snang bar byed na /
analyzed: mar me ni sdong bu dang mar la sogs pa phrad bsreg cing snang bar byed na /
translated: The lamp burns and illuminates the wick and the oil, etc.,

original: mig ni mig sman la sogs pa shin tu nye ba rnams 'dzin par byed ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mig ni mig sman la sogs pa shin tu nye ba rnams 'dzin par byed ba ma yin no //
translated: The eye does not perceive what is very close to it, such as eye ointment.

original: mar me ni bar med par thams cad snang bar byed na /
analyzed: mar me ni bar med par thams cad snang bar byed na /
translated: The lamp illuminates everything without obstruction.

original: mig ni mdun gyi ri po dang shing la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa de'i phyir mig ni mar me lta bu'o zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mig ni mdun gyi ri po dang shing la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa de'i phyir mig ni mar me lta bu'o zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The eye does not perceive the mountain or the tree in front of it. Therefore, the eye is not like the lamp.

original: gal te mig ni 'od zer yin pa'i phyir mar me bzhin du thag nye ba dang ring ba dag lan cig gsal bar byed pa mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig ni 'od zer yin pa'i phyir mar me bzhin du thag nye ba dang ring ba dag lan cig gsal bar byed pa mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eye is like the lamp because it emits rays, it is not contradictory that it illuminates both the distant and the near at once.

original: shel la sogs pas chod pa yang dmigs pas ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang the tshom mthong ba'i phyir na mig ni yul dang phrad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shel la sogs pas chod pa yang dmigs pas ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dang the tshom mthong ba'i phyir na mig ni yul dang phrad pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it perceives what is obstructed by glass and so on, it does not contact its object, because it perceives what is not in contact. Since it is uncertain, the eye does not contact its object.

original: phrad pa yin na ni reng reng por blta ba mtho yor la mi yin snyam du de'i khyad par dag la the tshom za bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: phrad pa yin na ni reng reng por blta ba mtho yor la mi yin snyam du de'i khyad par dag la the tshom za bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: If it did contact its object, it would be unreasonable to doubt the characteristics of the object, thinking that a cairn is a man.

original: red red po dang phrad pa 'dzin pas khyad par med do snyam pa'i gtan tshigs ci /üîΩdpag tshad stong @125a * //
analyzed: red red po dang phrad pa 'dzin pas khyad par med do snyam pa'i gtan tshigs ci / dpag tshad stong @125a * //
translated: But the eye sensefaculty is not like this, for it does not grasp its objectfield by entering into a close relationship with it.

original: phrag du mas bskal ba dang phrad pa mi srid pa'i yang phyir te /üîΩlan cig phye ma thag tu mig zla ba dang phrad do zhes bya bar brjod par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: phrag du mas bskal ba dang phrad pa mi srid pa'i yang phyir te / lan cig phye ma thag tu mig zla ba dang phrad do zhes bya bar brjod par ni mi rigs te /
translated: The eye sensefaculty is not in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩThe eye sensefaculty is not in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.

original: de'i phyir mig ni yul dang ma phrad pa nyid yin no //üîΩde bzhin du sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so zhes bya ba rna ba yul dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig ni yul dang ma phrad pa nyid yin no // de bzhin du sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so zhes bya ba rna ba yul dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis shes par bya ba ste /
translated: It is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni sna la sogs pa ltar phrad pa'i yul kho na rtogs par 'gyur gyi ring ba ni ma yin no //üîΩsgra rgyang ring po nas thos so zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na ni sna la sogs pa ltar phrad pa'i yul kho na rtogs par 'gyur gyi ring ba ni ma yin no // sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: It is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.üîΩIt is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.

original: phyogs la sogs pa'i bye brag gi sgo nas nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa'i bye brag gi sgo nas nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is impossible for the eye sensefaculty to be in a close relationship with its objectfield, since the latter is sometimes distant.

original: lho phyogs kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi sgra'o //
translated: It is impossible for the eye

original: byang phyogs kyi'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi'o //
translated: The northern direction.üîΩNear.

original: nye ba'o // ring ba'o zhes de ltar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba'o // ring ba'o zhes de ltar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Far.

original: phrad pa la de mi rigs te dri la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phrad pa la de mi rigs te dri la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: But this is not possible for the sense faculties, because they are not like smell, etc.

original: snang yang phyogs la sogs pas bsnyad ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na mthong ba yod de /
analyzed: snang yang phyogs la sogs pas bsnyad ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na mthong ba yod de /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that the sense faculties are perceived by means of direction, etc.?

original: de ni yongs su rgyu ba'i rjes su phyogs ches gsal ba'i dri dmigs pa las rjes su rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yongs su rgyu ba'i rjes su phyogs ches gsal ba'i dri dmigs pa las rjes su rlom sems pa'o //
translated: It is seen, but that is due to the perception of the smell of the wind that blows from the direction in which the object is located.

original: yongs su mi rgyu ba'i mig dang rna ba dag dang de ltar mtshungs pa med do //
analyzed: yongs su mi rgyu ba'i mig dang rna ba dag dang de ltar mtshungs pa med do //
translated: The eye and ear do not move, and so they are not like that.

original: nye ba dang ring ba las gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i sgra 'dzin ba'i phyir nye ba ni phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye ba dang ring ba las gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i sgra 'dzin ba'i phyir nye ba ni phrad pa 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: Sound is grasped as clear or unclear due to being near or far, so the sense faculty that grasps it is near and does not contact it.

original: thams cad du thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyur gyur pas the tshom med do //
analyzed: thams cad du thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyur gyur pas the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt that the sense faculty is the specific cause of the object.

original: ring ba la ni thams cad du the tshom nyid du 'gyur te khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring ba la ni thams cad du the tshom nyid du 'gyur te khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But there is doubt about the object in the distance, because there is no specific cause.

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid gcig yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If the eye sense faculty were to contact its object field, then,üîΩin this world, the eye sense faculty would not see obscured form.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to contact its object field, then,

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni mi'i yul dag na'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni mi'i yul dag na'o //
translated: in this world, the eye sense faculty would not see obscured form.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.

original: gal te mig yul dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis rna ba la sogs pa dag las khyad par du gyur na ni /üîΩbsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig gzugs phra ba dang chod pa dang thag ring ba la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa skye bar mi 'gal te /üîΩ'bad rtsol gyi khyad par las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te mig yul dang ma phrad pa nyid kyis rna ba la sogs pa dag las khyad par du gyur na ni / bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig gzugs phra ba dang chod pa dang thag ring ba la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa skye bar mi 'gal te / 'bad rtsol gyi khyad par las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par skye bde ltar rna ba la yang brjod par bya'o //üîΩyul dang phrad ba nyid yin na ni lha'i dang lha'i ma yin pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par skye bde ltar rna ba la yang brjod par bya'o // yul dang phrad ba nyid yin na ni lha'i dang lha'i ma yin pa dag la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'bad rtsol don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.

original: 'di ni bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig dang rna ba skye bar mi 'gyur te /üîΩyid dang sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan pa rnams la lha'i mig dang rna ba skye bar mi 'gyur te /üîΩyid dang sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: If the eye sense faculty were to see by not contacting its object field, then it would not be different from the ear sense faculty, etc.üîΩIf the

original: gal te mig yul dang @125b ma phrad pa yin na ci'i phyir thag ring ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te mig yul dang @125b ma phrad pa yin na ci'i phyir thag ring ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the eye sense faculty does not contact its object, why does it not apprehend distant objects?

original: gzhan du mi 'dzin pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin te /üîΩgzhan du ma phrad pa 'dzin na la sogs pa bzhin du de yang ma phrad pa mi snang ba nye ba dag la yang mtshungs pas na mig ni yul dang ma phrad pa rung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'dzin pa'i rgyu yod pa ma yin te / gzhan du ma phrad pa 'dzin na la sogs pa bzhin du de yang ma phrad pa mi snang ba nye ba dag la yang mtshungs pas na mig ni yul dang ma phrad pa rung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: There is no cause for apprehending only proximate objects and not distant objects.

original: de la ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i rgyu 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ma phrad pa 'dzin pa'i rgyu 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it apprehends objects with which it does not come into contact, then it would also be possible for it to apprehend those that are not in contact with it, such as those that are not present, since it is similar in not coming into contact with them. Therefore it is not tenable that the eye sense faculty does not contact its object.üîΩWe do not assert that the eye sense faculty apprehends objects with which it does not come into contact.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu yang ma phrad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu yang ma phrad pa'o //
translated: The cause of destruction also does not come into contact with the object to be destroyed.

original: 'o na ci zhe na nus pa'i khyad par las te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na nus pa'i khyad par las te /
translated: What is it then? It is a specific potency.

original: gzhan du na dbang po thams cad kyi yul thams cad nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na dbang po thams cad kyi yul thams cad nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that all sense faculties would be the sense faculty of all objects.

original: yul dang ma phrad pa'i byed pa can rnams la yang nus pa'i nges pa mthong ste rdo khab len bzhin no //
analyzed: yul dang ma phrad pa'i byed pa can rnams la yang nus pa'i nges pa mthong ste rdo khab len bzhin no //
translated: We see that even those that do not come into contact with their objects have a specific potency, like a magnet.

original: khab len gyis kyang ma phrad pa'i lcags 'dren par byed de /
analyzed: khab len gyis kyang ma phrad pa'i lcags 'dren par byed de /
translated: A magnet attracts iron without coming into contact with it.

original: chod pa dang thag ring ba dang mngon du phyogs par mi gnas pa'i lcags thams cad 'dren nus pa ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: chod pa dang thag ring ba dang mngon du phyogs par mi gnas pa'i lcags thams cad 'dren nus pa ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: But it cannot attract all iron, whether near or far, or whether it is obstructed or not.

original: de bzhin du mig kyang yul dang ma phad pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig kyang yul dang ma phad pa yin mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, the eye does not see objects with which it is in contact.

original: ma phrad pa thams cad mthong ba ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang phrad pa la dper brjod pa ma phrad kyang ma chod la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de ltar chod pa dang thag ring ba rnams la 'byung ba ma yin pa de bzhin du chod pa dang thag ring ba'i yul las mig la yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi
analyzed: ma phrad pa thams cad mthong ba ni ma yin no // gzhan yang phrad pa la dper brjod pa ma phrad kyang ma chod la gzugs brnyan 'byung ba de ltar chod pa dang thag ring ba rnams la 'byung ba ma yin pa de bzhin du chod pa dang thag ring ba'i yul las mig la yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi
translated: But it does not see all objects with which it is not in contact.

original: bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa mi skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa mi skye'o zhe na /
translated: Moreover, the example of contact is not established, because even without contact, a reflection arises, but not when there is an obstruction or distance. In the same way, the eye does not produce a consciousness that has the nature of a reflection of the object in the eye, when the object is obstructed or distant.

original: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na yang 'di nyid mtshungs so //
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa nyid yin na yang 'di nyid mtshungs so //
translated: Even if there is contact with the object, the same difficulty arises.

original: gzhan du brjod par bya ba mtshungs par so sor gnas pa la mig sman nam ma thur ma phrad pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du brjod par bya ba mtshungs par so sor gnas pa la mig sman nam ma thur ma phrad pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, the same difficulty arises in the case of the eye ointment or collyrium, which is not seen when it is applied to the eye.

original: gzhan du mthong bo zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: gzhan du mthong bo zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the reason for the statement, ‚ÄúThe eye sees forms that are not in contact‚Äù?

original: 'di la nus pa'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa ni rung ba ma yin te phrad pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la nus pa'i yul gyi rnam par rtog pa ni rung ba ma yin te phrad pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible that the conceptual thought that has the capacity to grasp an object is the cause, because there is no difference in the contact.

original: dbang po'i 'jug pa phyi'i rten dang nang gi rnam pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'jug pa phyi'i rten dang nang gi rnam pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the eye sense faculty engages its object because of an external support or an internal aspect,

original: yul mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not grasp an object.

original: de'i phyir mig ni yul dang ma phrad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig ni yul dang ma phrad pa'o //
translated: Therefore the eye does not contact its object.

original: ji ltar yang sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar yang sna la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is it that the nose and so on?

original: nus pa tha dad pas sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pas sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the eye, because they have different capacities.

original: thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: But not all,

original: mig ni yul dang ma phrad pa'o zhes bya ba de'i shes par byed pa las phyi rol tu rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mig ni yul dang ma phrad pa'o zhes bya ba de'i shes par byed pa las phyi rol tu rtogs par bya'o //
translated: because the statement, ‚ÄúThe eye does not contact its object,‚Äù is understood to refer to external objects.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dri la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dri la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it does not grasp odors and so on that are simultaneous with it.

original: gzhan dag nang gi bdag nyid kho na'i grangs kyi zas kyi bya ba byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dag nang gi bdag nyid kho na'i grangs kyi zas kyi bya ba byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Others say that it performs the function of food only in its internal state, because it is said, ‚ÄúThe internal nutriment is that which is swallowed.‚Äù

original: nang smos pas de zas kyi bya ba byed do zhes @126a * //
analyzed: nang smos pas de zas kyi bya ba byed do zhes @126a * //
translated: Therefore, it is the internal food that performs the function of food.

original: zer ro // de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: zer ro // de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: 'di la nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no certainty in this matter.

original: rnam par shes pa kho na zas te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kho na zas te /
translated: Consciousness alone is food,

original: zas kyi bya ba byed par rtogs par byed do zhes so //
analyzed: zas kyi bya ba byed par rtogs par byed do zhes so //
translated: because it is understood to perform the function of food.

original: mar mes bum pa'i gzugs dang ga pur la sogs pa'i dri sbyar ba rnams kyis dri dang ldan pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mar mes bum pa'i gzugs dang ga pur la sogs pa'i dri sbyar ba rnams kyis dri dang ldan pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like a lamp that illuminates a pot or like perfumes that are mixed with camphor, etc.

original: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is not material.

original: phreng ba ni phan tshun 'dab chags bar 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: phreng ba ni phan tshun 'dab chags bar 'byung ba yin la /
translated: A garland is a series of flowers that are contiguous and uninterrupted.

original: de yang yul na mi gnas pa'i gzugs can rnams kho na yin na /
analyzed: de yang yul na mi gnas pa'i gzugs can rnams kho na yin na /
translated: And that is only of material things that do not abide in a place.

original: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas te /
analyzed: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na mi gnas te /
translated: The mind is not material, so it does not abide in a place.

original: de'i phyir rang gi yul dang phrad pa ni mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi yul dang phrad pa ni mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for it to contact its object.

original: gang gi phyir phrad par 'dod pa ni phrad pa'i yul 'dzin par byed cing ma phrad ba la ni de ltar rnam par dpyod pa rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phrad par 'dod pa ni phrad pa'i yul 'dzin par byed cing ma phrad ba la ni de ltar rnam par dpyod pa rtsom par byed do //
translated: For one who desires contact grasps the object of contact, but one does not begin the analysis of that which is not in contact.

original: yid ni phreng ba nyid du mi nus pas mig la sogs pa rnams la ji lta bar rnam par dpyad pa ni ma byas so //
analyzed: yid ni phreng ba nyid du mi nus pas mig la sogs pa rnams la ji lta bar rnam par dpyad pa ni ma byas so //
translated: The mind is not capable of being a garland, so it is not analyzed as are the eye, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba rnams mi 'dzin pa'i phyil yid ni ma phrad pa'i yul can mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba rnams mi 'dzin pa'i phyil yid ni ma phrad pa'i yul can mo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the mind has a non-contiguous object-field because it does not grasp simultaneous and conjoined entities.

original: de dag ni lhan cig skyes ba'i dri la sogs ba ni 'dzin pa'i phyir mtha' du ma'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lhan cig skyes ba'i dri la sogs ba ni 'dzin pa'i phyir mtha' du ma'o //
translated: But that is not so, because it grasps simultaneous smell, etc.

original: yang kha cig ni rna ba'i nang du yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni rna ba'i nang du yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some say that the ear also grasps sound within the ear.

original: yang gi sgra ni thag ring po nas kyang thos pa'i rnam pa yul dang ma phrad ba yin par sems so //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni thag ring po nas kyang thos pa'i rnam pa yul dang ma phrad ba yin par sems so //
translated: The word also is meant to indicate that the ear grasps sound from a distance, and thus has a non-contiguous object-field.

original: kha cig na re sgra rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i rim pa ba rnam bar 'dod pa rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rna ba ni yul dang phrad pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sgra rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i rim pa ba rnam bar 'dod pa rtogs par byed pa'i phyir rna ba ni yul dang phrad pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The ear sense faculty is only in contact with its object field, because it is admitted that it is the cause of the understanding of the order of the succession of the sounds of speech.

original: de yang de lta ma yin te lag par bcangs pa'i dril bu'i sgra 'gags ma thag tu sgra mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de lta ma yin te lag par bcangs pa'i dril bu'i sgra 'gags ma thag tu sgra mi thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because one does not hear the sound of a bell that is being rung in a closed fist.üîΩWho can stop the sound that comes from afar in the manner of a wave?

original: re zhig kyang gang zhig bar nas chu rlabs kyi tshul du 'ong ba'i sgra de 'dzin pa sus bzlog / de'i phyir dril bu'i yul na gnas pa'i sgra kho na 'dzin gyi chu rlabs kyi tshul du rna bug gi bu gar phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig kyang gang zhig bar nas chu rlabs kyi tshul du 'ong ba'i sgra de 'dzin pa sus bzlog / de'i phyir dril bu'i yul na gnas pa'i sgra kho na 'dzin gyi chu rlabs kyi tshul du rna bug gi bu gar phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the sound that is in the object field of the bell that is heard, not the sound that arrives in the auditory cavity in the manner of a wave.

original: gal te mar me 'gags pa ni 'od lan cig pa bzhin du sgra'i rgyu 'gags pa na 'bras bu'i sgra 'gag go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mar me 'gags pa ni 'od lan cig pa bzhin du sgra'i rgyu 'gags pa na 'bras bu'i sgra 'gag go zhe na /
translated: If you say: The sound that is the cause of the sound of the bell ceases at the same time as the flame of the lamp, then the sound that is the effect of the sound of the bell ceases.

original: 'jig pa gzhan ma yin pas 'bras bu'i sgra 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa gzhan ma yin pas 'bras bu'i sgra 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: The sound that is the effect of the sound of the bell does not cease, because its destruction is not different from itself.

original: skad cig ma dang po nyid khas blang bar bya zhing rgyud tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po nyid khas blang bar bya zhing rgyud tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first moment must be accepted, because the two are different continua.

original: mar me dang gsal ba dag sems @126b dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mar me dang gsal ba dag sems @126b dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the flame and the lamp, or the mind and mental factors.

original: sgra ni mar me dang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni mar me dang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not like the lamp,

original: de la mar me dang gsal ba dag mtshungs pa'i rgyu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mar me dang gsal ba dag mtshungs pa'i rgyu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the lamp and the flame are established as the same cause.

original: de'i k'a ra n'a b'a la phan cig zhig pa 'gal ba med de sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i k'a ra n'a b'a la phan cig zhig pa 'gal ba med de sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The destruction of the lamp and the flame are not contradictory, like the mind and mental factors.

original: rgyud tha mi dad ba ni sgra ste /
analyzed: rgyud tha mi dad ba ni sgra ste /
translated: Sound is not a different continuum,

original: der rgyu ma yin pa 'jig pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'jig pa dang / sa bon 'jig pa dang myu gu 'jig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: der rgyu ma yin pa 'jig pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'jig pa dang / sa bon 'jig pa dang myu gu 'jig pa bzhin no //
translated: because the destruction of the cause is not the destruction of the effect, like the destruction of the seed and the destruction of the sprout.

original: des na rgyu tha dad ba'i phyir sgra snga ma zhig pa dang / (ngan song gi rgyu/) sgra phyi ma skye bas de 'dzin ba sus zlog par byed /
analyzed: des na rgyu tha dad ba'i phyir sgra snga ma zhig pa dang / (ngan song gi rgyu/) sgra phyi ma skye bas de 'dzin ba sus zlog par byed /
translated: Therefore, since the former sound and the latter sound are different causes, who can stop the former sound from ceasing and the latter sound from arising?

original: de'i phyir rten brten ba las skye ba nyid sgrar yid ches te rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye'o //üîΩphrad par yongs su brtags na ni sgra la thag ring ba dang nye ba nges par mi 'gyur te reg bya bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten brten ba las skye ba nyid sgrar yid ches te rna ba'i rnam par shes pa skye'o // phrad par yongs su brtags na ni sgra la thag ring ba dang nye ba nges par mi 'gyur te reg bya bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, the ear consciousness arises from the sound that is its object-field, and from the ear that is its basis.üîΩIf the ear were to grasp sound through contact, then the ear would not be able to grasp distant sounds, just as it does not grasp nearby sounds.

original: sbrang bu'i dar dir gyi sgra yang dbang bo dang nye ba 'dzin par byed de ro la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sbrang bu'i dar dir gyi sgra yang dbang bo dang nye ba 'dzin par byed de ro la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The ear grasps the sound of a mosquito even though it is distant.

original: bar med pas na rna ba yul dang ma phrad pa nyid do //
analyzed: bar med pas na rna ba yul dang ma phrad pa nyid do //
translated: The ear does not come into contact with its object-field, because there is no interval between them.

original: yang rgyu cis de la yang dril bu la sogs pa'i gzugs mig gis ma dmigs she na /
analyzed: yang rgyu cis de la yang dril bu la sogs pa'i gzugs mig gis ma dmigs she na /
translated: Why is it that the eye does not see the form of a bell that is nearby?

original: dpe ston pa rnams na re /
analyzed: dpe ston pa rnams na re /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says:
