original: mig dang gzugs dag la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dag la lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for the eye and form to come together, such as light.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: dmigs pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa la gegs byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it obstructs the object-field and because there is no cause for it to do so.

original: yang mun pa dmigs pa la gegs byed pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang mun pa dmigs pa la gegs byed pa ci zhe na /
translated: Again, why is darkness an obstruction to the eye?

original: snang ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it obstructs light.

original: ci zhes snang ba'i gegs la bltos ba med pa'i mig la sogs pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir dang / gal te snang ba'i gegs kyi rgyu las de bzhin du yod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dngos po la sogs pa'i rgyu'i don te /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa bzhin sus zlog par byed /
analyzed: ci zhes snang ba'i gegs la bltos ba med pa'i mig la sogs pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir dang / gal te snang ba'i gegs kyi rgyu las de bzhin du yod pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dngos po la sogs pa'i rgyu'i don te / gzugs la sogs pa bzhin sus zlog par byed /
translated: Since there is not the slightest eye, etc. that does not depend on light as an obstruction, and since the eye consciousness, etc. exist in dependence on light as a cause, what prevents the eye, etc. from being the cause of the eye consciousness, etc. in the same way that form, etc. are?

original: ci ste snang ba'i gegs la bltos pa med ba de lta na yang mun pas chod ba rnams su mar mo'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste snang ba'i gegs la bltos pa med ba de lta na yang mun pas chod ba rnams su mar mo'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that even though it does not depend on an obstruction to light, the eye consciousness, etc. do not arise in the dark because the eye, etc. and the object, form, etc. are incomplete,

original: thams cad kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu ma tshang ba'i phyir mi skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu ma tshang ba'i phyir mi skye ba nyid do //
translated: then nothing would arise from anything, because everything is incomplete in terms of cause and effect.

original: gegs kyi rgyu yod pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gegs kyi rgyu yod pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the eye, etc. are incomplete in terms of cause,

original: gegs kyi rgyu ni de'i rgyu dang 'gal ba las /
analyzed: gegs kyi rgyu ni de'i rgyu dang 'gal ba las /
translated: because the cause of an obstruction is the cause of that which is incompatible with it.

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya'i dngos su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya'i dngos su ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is posited in this way, but not directly.

original: 'dir gzhan gyi phyogs su 'byin pa dang / rang gi phyogs gnas par @127a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyi phyogs su 'byin pa dang / rang gi phyogs gnas par @127a * //
translated: Here, the opponent's position is set forth and then our own position is stated.üîΩ

original: byed pa mang du bshad pa gang yin pa de dag ni gzhung lci ba'i 'jigs pas rnam par dpyad pa ma byas so //
analyzed: byed pa mang du bshad pa gang yin pa de dag ni gzhung lci ba'i 'jigs pas rnam par dpyad pa ma byas so //
translated: Here, we have not analyzed the many statements that refute the positions of others and establish our own position, fearing prolixity.

original: gsum gzhan du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum gzhan du zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three are different,

original: gzhan du zhes smos pa ni yul dang phrad pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes smos pa ni yul dang phrad pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù is stated in order to ascertain that they contact their objects.

original: gal te yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa yin par 'dod na ni de ltar na gzhan du dang gzhan du ma yin pa zhes bya bar smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul dang phrad pa dang ma phrad pa yin par 'dod na ni de ltar na gzhan du dang gzhan du ma yin pa zhes bya bar smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is accepted that they contact and do not contact their objects, then it would be said that they are different and not different.

original: sna ji ltar yul dang phrad pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sna ji ltar yul dang phrad pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How does the nose sense faculty contact its object?

original: gang las the tshom za zhe na /
analyzed: gang las the tshom za zhe na /
translated: From what is there doubt?

original: dri'i rten me tog la sogs ba thag ring po nas 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri'i rten me tog la sogs ba thag ring po nas 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it apprehends the support of smell, such as a flower, from a distance,

original: ro dang reg bya dag ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ro dang reg bya dag ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but it is not like that for taste and tactility.

original: dbugs ma rngub par dri mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /üîΩdbugs rngub ba dang bcas pas dri dang ldan pa'i me tog gis bsgos pa'i rlung sna'i dbang po dang 'dab chags par skyes ba na dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dbugs ma rngub par dri mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la / dbugs rngub ba dang bcas pas dri dang ldan pa'i me tog gis bsgos pa'i rlung sna'i dbang po dang 'dab chags par skyes ba na dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because one does not smell an odor without inhaling.üîΩWhen a flower with an odor is placed in contact with the nose sense faculty, one smells it when one inhales.

original: dri'i 'byung ba chen pos drangs /
analyzed: dri'i 'byung ba chen pos drangs /
translated: Or, the odor is drawn in by the great elements that are the support of the nose sense faculty.üîΩOr, the odor that is born in contact with the nose sense faculty is smelled.

original: sna'i dbang po dang 'dab chags par skyes pa'i dri 'dzin ba'i phyir dang / drangs pa med pas ma rngubs ba la dri dang dbang po phrad pa med pa de'i phyir sna ni yul dang phrad pa nyid du nges so //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po dang 'dab chags par skyes pa'i dri 'dzin ba'i phyir dang / drangs pa med pas ma rngubs ba la dri dang dbang po phrad pa med pa de'i phyir sna ni yul dang phrad pa nyid du nges so //
translated: But when one does not inhale, there is no contact between the odor and the sense faculty. Therefore, it is certain that the nose is restricted to its object field.

original: yul dang ma phrad pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: yul dang ma phrad pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it were not restricted to its object field,

original: mig dang rna ba bzhin du rngub pa dang bcas pas dang ; ma rngubs pa gnyis la khyad par 'ga' yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig dang rna ba bzhin du rngub pa dang bcas pas dang ; ma rngubs pa gnyis la khyad par 'ga' yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: then there would be no difference between inhaling and not inhaling, as in the case of the eye and ear.

original: dus thams cad du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would smell at all times.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: 'di ni don tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni don tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a different meaning.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang bcas pas dri 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang bcas pas dri 'dzin pa la /
translated: The nose apprehends odor when it is conjoined with inhalation.

original: de la phrad par 'dzin pa nyid ci ltar grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la phrad par 'dzin pa nyid ci ltar grub par 'gyur /
translated: How can it be established that it apprehends what is conjoined with it?

original: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun mi reg pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun mi reg pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since atoms do not touch each other,

original: dbang po dang po nye bar skyes pa'i yul 'dzin pas phrad pa 'dzin no zhes zer ro //üîΩsna dang lce dang lus zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po dang po nye bar skyes pa'i yul 'dzin pas phrad pa 'dzin no zhes zer ro // sna dang lce dang lus zhes bya ba la /
translated: some say: The sense faculty apprehends the object that arises in proximity to it.

original: aa dhy'ar ba ae sha lakshya te /
analyzed: aa dhy'ar ba ae sha lakshya te /
translated: The nose, tongue, and body are said to be conjoined with their objects.üîΩThe nose, tongue, and body are said to be conjoined with their objects because they do not apprehend their objects without being conjoined with them.

original: 'dir tha mi dad par bstan pa med pa'i phyir yul dang dbang po dag yul dang phrad pa'i dbang du byas nas dbugs ma rngubs bar dri mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes rgyu gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir tha mi dad par bstan pa med pa'i phyir yul dang dbang po dag yul dang phrad pa'i dbang du byas nas dbugs ma rngubs bar dri mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes rgyu gsungs so //
translated: Here, since it is not taught that they are not distinct, the reason is stated: because they do not apprehend odor without inhalation.

original: 'o na ci /
analyzed: 'o na ci /
translated: Well then, what?üîΩHere, the attainment of the object is liberation.

original: (gang 'dir thob/) y'a tra br'apti moksham te (rgya dpe gcig na x 'dir ldan bar sgro btags pa mtshon no/) des yul dang phrad pa gsum gsungs @127b so ;
analyzed: (gang 'dir thob/) y'a tra br'apti moksham te (rgya dpe gcig na x 'dir ldan bar sgro btags pa mtshon no/) des yul dang phrad pa gsum gsungs @127b so ;
translated: Thus he states that the three sense faculties are conjoined with their objects.

original: / sna ni rang nyid dang nye bar skyes pa'i dri 'dzin par byed kyi /
analyzed: / sna ni rang nyid dang nye bar skyes pa'i dri 'dzin par byed kyi /
translated: The nose perceives the odor that is born in its proximity.

original: mig gzhan du yang thag ring po na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gzhan du yang thag ring po na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the eye does not perceive the form that is far away, or that is obstructed.

original: dris pa la 'di nges par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dris pa la 'di nges par brjod par bya ste /
translated: This question should be answered:

original: dbugs ma rngubs par dri mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa 'di ni mngon par zhen pa tsam mo //
analyzed: dbugs ma rngubs par dri mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa 'di ni mngon par zhen pa tsam mo //
translated: Because odor is not perceived when there is no inhalation of breath, this is mere attachment.

original: kha cig phrad pa'i dngos po don gzhan 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig phrad pa'i dngos po don gzhan 'dod de /
translated: Some maintain that contact is a different thing,

original: dper na bye brag pa rnams kyi gzhan du nam mkha'i khams kyis chod pa dang nye bar skye ba dang / gzhan du bdag nyid 'jig rten gyi khams kyis chod par skye'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa rnams kyi gzhan du nam mkha'i khams kyis chod pa dang nye bar skye ba dang / gzhan du bdag nyid 'jig rten gyi khams kyis chod par skye'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas maintain that the element of space is born in a different place, and that the self is born in a different world-sphere.

original: de'i phyir phrad pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes pa dris so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na zhes pa dris so ;
translated: Therefore, what is this so-called contact?

original: /'dab chags par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba lan te /
analyzed: /'dab chags par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba lan te /
translated: The answer is: It is the arising of the two in the same place.

original: de ltar na 'dab chags bar 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i phrad pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dab chags bar 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i phrad pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that there is no contact other than that of the flying birds.

original: 'dab chags bar 'byung ba yang kha cig gi ltar na nam mkha'i khams ma gtogs pa'i gzugs kyis mchod pa nyid kyi phyir yin la /
analyzed: 'dab chags bar 'byung ba yang kha cig gi ltar na nam mkha'i khams ma gtogs pa'i gzugs kyis mchod pa nyid kyi phyir yin la /
translated: In the case of flying birds, according to some, it is because they are supported by the element of space, since they are not supported by form.

original: gzhan dag gi ltar du gzugs thams cad kyis mchod pa nyid kyi phyir yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ltar du gzugs thams cad kyis mchod pa nyid kyi phyir yin no //
translated: According to others, it is because they are supported by all forms.

original: ci rdul phra rab rnams zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la gal te phan tshun reg na cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci rdul phra rab rnams zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la gal te phan tshun reg na cha shas dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the atoms touch each other, they would have parts.

original: cha shes med pa nyid yin na yang sems dang sems las byung ltar reg pa med do //
analyzed: cha shes med pa nyid yin na yang sems dang sems las byung ltar reg pa med do //
translated: If they do not touch, they would be like mind and mental factors, which do not touch each other.

original: ci ste mi reg na de lta yin yang gsum ni yul dang phrad pa'o zhes bya bar 'gal te ma reg ba ni phrad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste mi reg na de lta yin yang gsum ni yul dang phrad pa'o zhes bya bar 'gal te ma reg ba ni phrad pa ma yin no //
translated: If they do not touch, then it contradicts the statement that the first three are contact with an object, because that which does not touch is not contact.

original: 'dir ni rdzas kyi rdul phra rab la mngon par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni rdzas kyi rdul phra rab la mngon par 'dod kyi /
translated: Here, the subtle particle is asserted to be substantial.

original: 'dus pa'i rdul phra rab ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rdul phra rab ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the subtle particle of the aggregate,

original: de ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has parts.

original: 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'dres par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúThey would merge‚Äù means that the objects would not be different.

original: de'i cha shas kyi dngos bo med par thal bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i cha shas kyi dngos bo med par thal bar snang ngo //
translated: It is evident that the consequence is that the part of that would be a thing that does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyi mi reg go //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyi mi reg go //
translated: Therefore, it does not touch in its entirety.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis reg na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis reg na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: But if it touches in one part,

original: 'ga' zhig gis reg cing 'ga' zhig gis mi reg na cha shas dang bcas pa dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis reg cing 'ga' zhig gis mi reg na cha shas dang bcas pa dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if it touches in one part and does not touch in another, the consequence is that it has parts.

original: gzhan yang rdul phra rab gang yin pa de rnams gal te phyogs gcig gis phan tshun reg na de rnams gos mtshungs pas de nas rdul phra rab gzhan dang reg pas rdzas rnams 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rdul phra rab gang yin pa de rnams gal te phyogs gcig gis phan tshun reg na de rnams gos mtshungs pas de nas rdul phra rab gzhan dang reg pas rdzas rnams 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if those subtle particles touch each other in one part, then, since they are similar in being covered, they would merge into one substance, because they would touch each other in another part.

original: de nyid du gnas pa nyid @128a * //
analyzed: de nyid du gnas pa nyid @128a * //
translated: If they remain just as they are,

original: yin na / phyogs gcig reg pas khyad par ci zhig byed /
analyzed: yin na / phyogs gcig reg pas khyad par ci zhig byed /
translated: what difference does it make if they touch in one part?

original: ci ste mi reg na rdul phra rab de rnams phan tshun cha shas su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ci ste mi reg na rdul phra rab de rnams phan tshun cha shas su mi rung ngo //
translated: If they do not touch, then those subtle particles are not suitable to have parts.

original: reg pa'i mtshan nyid can thogs pa las sgra 'byung ba mthong ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i mtshan nyid can thogs pa las sgra 'byung ba mthong ste /
translated: Sound is seen to arise from obstruction, which has the characteristic of contact.

original: 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is:

original: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: How then?

original: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma yin zhing /
translated: If it is not by all of itself,

original: phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin na /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin na /
translated: and it is not by one part,

original: phan tshun mi reg ba'i phyir ji ltar sgra 'grub bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun mi reg ba'i phyir ji ltar sgra 'grub bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is sound established, since they do not touch each other?

original: de nyid kyi phyir te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of that very fact.

original: gang gi phyir rdul phrang ba phan tshun mi reg pa de nyid kyi phyir sgra 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdul phrang ba phan tshun mi reg pa de nyid kyi phyir sgra 'grub bo //
translated: Because those subtle particles do not touch each other, sound is established.

original: lag pas lag pa la zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lag pas lag pa la zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: As for the statement, ‚Äúhand on hand,‚Äù

original: gos mtshungs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gos mtshungs pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: the thought is that it is like cloth.

original: de'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, obstruction would be lost.

original: de med na thogs pa med bas gang las sgra 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na thogs pa med bas gang las sgra 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: If that does not exist, then since there is no obstruction, from what would sound arise?

original: ldan pa'i dus mi 'thad pas gzegs zan pa ltar ldan ba las sgra 'byung bar khas blang par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: ldan pa'i dus mi 'thad pas gzegs zan pa ltar ldan ba las sgra 'byung bar khas blang par yang mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not accept, as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas do, that sound arises from conjunction.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gsung rab las 'byung ba dag kho na la ldan pa'i ming ngam phrad ba zhes gtogs so //
analyzed: gsung rab las 'byung ba dag kho na la ldan pa'i ming ngam phrad ba zhes gtogs so //
translated: The term conjunction or contact is applied to whatever occurs in the scriptures.

original: 'byung chen 'ga' zhig gis ni 'byung ba'i khyad par gzhan 'dab chags su skyes pa na gang zhig sgra bskyed par 'gyur ba phrad pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob la /
analyzed: 'byung chen 'ga' zhig gis ni 'byung ba'i khyad par gzhan 'dab chags su skyes pa na gang zhig sgra bskyed par 'gyur ba phrad pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob la /
translated: When some great elements generate other specific great elements in a continuous series, the contact that generates sound is called conjunction.

original: de dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra 'dzin bas 'dir ci ste mi dpyod /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra 'dzin bas 'dir ci ste mi dpyod /
translated: Why do you not investigate sound that arises simultaneously with that?

original: ji ltar bsags pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bsags pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How can a collection not disintegrate?

original: bong ba dang so phag la sogs pa ste de dag gi rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun ma 'byar pa'i phyir brgyab na bye ma 'dus pa bzhin ji ltar ma 'jig par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bong ba dang so phag la sogs pa ste de dag gi rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun ma 'byar pa'i phyir brgyab na bye ma 'dus pa bzhin ji ltar ma 'jig par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: A collection is a mass of things such as clods of earth, bricks, and so on. Since the subtle particles of those things do not adhere to each other, how can a collection not disintegrate when struck, like a pile of sand?

original: rlung gi khams kyis gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyis gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is held together by the wind element.

original: gal te rlung gi khams ni /
analyzed: gal te rlung gi khams ni /
translated: If the wind element

original: brdabs pa'i dngos po rnams la 'bral ba'i rgyur mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: brdabs pa'i dngos po rnams la 'bral ba'i rgyur mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is not the cause of the separation of things that are struck?

original: 'di la ni gcig tu nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la ni gcig tu nges pa med de /
translated: There is no certainty in this.

original: sems can gyi las kyi dbang gis byung ba'i rlung gi khams kha cig ni 'jig par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi las kyi dbang gis byung ba'i rlung gi khams kha cig ni 'jig par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Some of the elements of wind that arise through the power of the actions of sentient beings are engaged in destruction,

original: dper na 'jig pa'i tshe'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig pa'i tshe'i lta bu'o //
translated: like those at the time of the destruction of the world.

original: kha cig ni 'dzin bar zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dzin bar zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Some are engaged in holding,

original: dper na chags ba'i tshe'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chags ba'i tshe'i lta bu'o //
translated: like those at the time of creation.

original: 'di yang snga ma dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di yang snga ma dang mtshungs so //
translated: This is the same as before.

original: ma rig pa'i phyir rlung gi khams kyis 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phyir rlung gi khams kyis 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of ignorance, the element of wind is not able to hold.

original: reg par khas blangs pa nyid ni yang de nyid thogs pa med par nyid dang cha shas dang bcas pa nyid kyi @128b skyon no ;
analyzed: reg par khas blangs pa nyid ni yang de nyid thogs pa med par nyid dang cha shas dang bcas pa nyid kyi @128b skyon no ;
translated: If you accept contact, then there is the fault that it is not obstructed and has parts.üîΩBut if you do not accept contact, then you must explain how the body sense faculty apprehends objects.

original: / ma reg pa nyid du 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: / ma reg pa nyid du 'dzin par byed de /
translated: You may say that it apprehends without contact,

original: dper na lus kyi dbang po ma reg par kho nar lus kyi rnam par shes ba skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lus kyi dbang po ma reg par kho nar lus kyi rnam par shes ba skye ba bzhin no //
translated: like the arising of a body consciousness without the body sense faculty contacting its object.

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun mi reg na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun mi reg na /
translated: If the subtle atoms do not touch each other,

original: da ni ji ltar 'dab chags bar zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'dab chags bar zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: then how can they be aggregated?

original: phan tshun phrad pa med par 'dab chags pa nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: phan tshun phrad pa med par 'dab chags pa nyid mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that they are aggregated without mutual contact.

original: de dag gi dbus na cung zad med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi dbus na cung zad med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the middle of those, there is nothing at all.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: Like the form of light, etc.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Again means moreover.

original: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg gam phyogs gcig gis reg ces nyes pa brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg gam phyogs gcig gis reg ces nyes pa brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: There is no fault means the fault that was stated, ‚ÄúDo they touch with their entire selves or with a part of themselves?‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re da ni ji ltar 'dab chags par phrad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de nyid nyes pa med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re da ni ji ltar 'dab chags par phrad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de nyid nyes pa med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that there is no fault in what was said, ‚ÄúThen how can they be aggregated?‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba la /üîΩgal te 'dus ba rnams phan tshun reg pa na'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba la / gal te 'dus ba rnams phan tshun reg pa na'o //
translated: If that is so,üîΩif the aggregates touch each other,

original: ci reg pa'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci reg pa'i rgyu can gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: then do they touch due to contact?

original: reg pa rgyur yod la de ni reg pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: reg pa rgyur yod la de ni reg pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: Contact exists as a cause, and that is caused by contact.

original: reg pa zhig skye ba'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: reg pa zhig skye ba'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Contact arises, or

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi reg ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi reg ba'o //
translated: that which is contact of another.üîΩCaused by non-contact, that which has non-contact as a cause.

original: ma reg pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni ma reg brgyur gang la yod pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te rdul phra rab rnams ni phan tshun ma reg bsam reg pa'o //
analyzed: ma reg pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni ma reg brgyur gang la yod pa'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te rdul phra rab rnams ni phan tshun ma reg bsam reg pa'o //
translated: The phrase is to be analyzed in this way. The atoms are not in contact with each other, but are in contact with contact.

original: rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the cause.

original: reg pa'am ma reg pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: reg pa'am ma reg pa yang rung ste /
translated: Whether there is contact or not,

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin ba de ni de'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin ba de ni de'i rgyu ste /
translated: that which is the cause of something is the cause of that.

original: rgyu'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said because of the cause.

original: res 'ga' ni ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyis zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyis zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
translated: Sometimes, caused by non-contact, etc.

original: gang gi tshe bsags ba'i rdul phra rab rnams zhig bar gnas pa de'i tshe ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyis ma reg pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsags ba'i rdul phra rab rnams zhig bar gnas pa de'i tshe ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyis ma reg pa'o //
translated: When the accumulated atoms are destroyed and remain, then non-contact is caused by non-contact.

original: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab rnams bsags bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ma reg ba'i rgyu can gyis reg pa'o //üîΩgang gi tshe bsags pa dang ldan pa bsags pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab rnams bsags bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe ma reg ba'i rgyu can gyis reg pa'o // gang gi tshe bsags pa dang ldan pa bsags pa ste /
translated: When the subtle particles come together, they are in contact through having non-contact as their cause.üîΩWhen they are in a collection, they are in contact through having contact as their cause.

original: 'dus pa rnams 'dus pa de'i tshe reg ba'i rgyu can gyis reg pa ste nyi zer gyi rdul ni rgyun gyi skad cig gnyis pa ma phrad ba'i rgyu can ma phrad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus pa rnams 'dus pa de'i tshe reg ba'i rgyu can gyis reg pa ste nyi zer gyi rdul ni rgyun gyi skad cig gnyis pa ma phrad ba'i rgyu can ma phrad pa ste /
translated: The particles of sunlight are in non-contact through having non-contact as their cause in the second moment of the continuum.

original: de ni phan tshun mi reg bsam reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phan tshun mi reg bsam reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to be in contact, although they do not touch each other.

original: slob dbon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dbon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: rags pa tshogs pa'i dbang du byas te phra mo la reg par brjod do //
analyzed: rags pa tshogs pa'i dbang du byas te phra mo la reg par brjod do //
translated: From the perspective of the collection of the coarse, it is said that the subtle particles are in contact.

original: de'i rgyu can ni rags pa la ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyis reg par brjod de nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can ni rags pa la ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyis reg par brjod de nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Through having that as their cause, the coarse are said to be in contact through having non-contact as their cause. There is no fault.

original: gang gi tshe 'dir gzugs de'i rkyen @129a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dir gzugs de'i rkyen @129a * //
translated: When here the condition of form is the cause of the eye consciousness,

original: tshogs pa las 'dzin par byed pa'i rlung gi khams dang mi 'gal bar de las bzlog pa skye ba de'i tshe reg pa'i rgyu can gyis ma reg par skye ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa las 'dzin par byed pa'i rlung gi khams dang mi 'gal bar de las bzlog pa skye ba de'i tshe reg pa'i rgyu can gyis ma reg par skye ste /
translated: The element of wind that holds the collection together is not opposed to the arising of the opposite, i.e., the separation of the collection. At that time, the coarse, i.e., the collection, arises without contact, having contact as its cause.

original: rags pa 'dus pa'i rgyu can gyis phra mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir nyi zer gyis rdul 'dzin par byed pa'i rlung gi /
analyzed: rags pa 'dus pa'i rgyu can gyis phra mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nyid kyi phyir nyi zer gyis rdul 'dzin par byed pa'i rlung gi /
translated: The meaning is that the subtle, i.e., the atoms, have contact as their cause.üîΩFor that very reason, the wind element that holds the dust particles together with the sun‚Äôs rays is said to be without contact, having contact as its cause, because it is not generated, and because it is subtle.

original: khams ma skyes pa la de med pa'i phyir dang phra ba'i phyir 'dus pa rnams la ni de ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyis ma reg pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: khams ma skyes pa la de med pa'i phyir dang phra ba'i phyir 'dus pa rnams la ni de ma reg pa'i rgyu can gyis ma reg pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The collection of atoms is said to be without contact, having contact as its cause.

original: de'i phyir 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin par mngon no snyam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin par mngon no snyam mo //
translated: Therefore, this is the intention here.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis gang ma reg pa la rgyu bshad pa /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis gang ma reg pa la rgyu bshad pa /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas explain that which is without contact as a cause.

original: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg na 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis reg na 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is contact through the whole self, there would be a mixture.

original: rdzas rnams skad cig pa nyid la reg pa'i dus mi srid pa'i phyir de la ni mi gus so //
analyzed: rdzas rnams skad cig pa nyid la reg pa'i dus mi srid pa'i phyir de la ni mi gus so //
translated: Since contact is not possible for momentary substances, we do not respect that explanation.

original: skad cig mar 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig mar 'dzin pa dang 'gal ba la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause of the contradiction with the apprehension of momentariness is stated:

original: skad cig ma phyi mar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi mar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it would remain in the second moment.

original: reg pa'i skad cig ni skyes pa'i skad cig pas phyi ba yin te /
analyzed: reg pa'i skad cig ni skyes pa'i skad cig pas phyi ba yin te /
translated: The moment of contact is later than the moment of birth,

original: bdag nyid thob ma thag tu phan tshun reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thob ma thag tu phan tshun reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because immediately after attaining its own nature, it contacts the other.

original: skad cig ma phyi mar gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi mar gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It does not remain in the second moment,

original: de'i phyir reg pa'i dus su 'gags pa'i phyir de mi reg go //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa'i dus su 'gags pa'i phyir de mi reg go //
translated: because it ceases at the time of contact, it does not contact.

original: reg pa ni gos mtshungs par skye ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni gos mtshungs par skye ba ste /
translated: Contact arises simultaneously with the cloth,

original: de yang skad cig ma phyi mar gnas pa med par yang yul tha dad pa'i rgyu las 'gal ba med do zhes de ltar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang skad cig ma phyi mar gnas pa med par yang yul tha dad pa'i rgyu las 'gal ba med do zhes de ltar bsam par bya'o //
translated: and that is not contradicted by the cause of different objects, even without remaining in the second moment. This is how it should be considered.

original: 'dab chags pa la reg go snyam du 'du shes par zad do //
analyzed: 'dab chags pa la reg go snyam du 'du shes par zad do //
translated: It is merely the perception that contact occurs in a continuous series.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs las 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs las 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this and the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika system?

original: 'di ni gzugs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bar du nam mkha' yang me 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bar du nam mkha' yang me 'dod do //
translated: In this system, not only form, but also space is asserted to be fire.

original: btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs ma yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs ma yin no //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika system does not accept the system of the Venerable Ones.

original: 'di la rgyu nyid gsungs ba de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu nyid gsungs ba de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reason is stated: ‚ÄúIf it were not so, etc.

original: gal te btsun pa'i lugs las gzhan du rdul phra rab kyi bar dag tu nam mkha' 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te btsun pa'i lugs las gzhan du rdul phra rab kyi bar dag tu nam mkha' 'dod na'o //
translated: If space were accepted as the intervals between the subtle particles, etc.

original: bar stong pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni gzugs gzhan gyis ma bkag pa dag tu'o //
analyzed: bar stong pa dag tu zhes bya ba ni gzugs gzhan gyis ma bkag pa dag tu'o //
translated: The intervals between the particles are not obstructed by other forms.

original: 'gro ba la 'gog pa ni thogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba la 'gog pa ni thogs pa ste /
translated: Obstruction to movement is resistance.

original: de ni rdul phra rab kyi bar stong pa dag la mi rigs pas thogs ba dang bcas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rdul phra rab kyi bar stong pa dag la mi rigs pas thogs ba dang bcas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not reasonable that the intervals between the subtle particles are obstructed, resistance would fail.

original: gnas brtan 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: gnas brtan 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The elder Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par yang mi bya sdang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: btsun pa'i lugs 'dod par yang mi bya sdang bar mi bya'o //
translated: The system of the Venerable Ones should neither be accepted nor rejected.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: btsal bar bya ste /
translated: It should be investigated.

original: gal te 'di dag la bar cung zad med na de lta na @129b cha shas dang bcas pa'am go sa gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag la bar cung zad med na de lta na @129b cha shas dang bcas pa'am go sa gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If these particles have no intervals, then they would have parts or they would occupy the same place.

original: nyes pa snga ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ji ltar btsun ba'i lugs 'dod ces zer ro //
analyzed: nyes pa snga ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ji ltar btsun ba'i lugs 'dod ces zer ro //
translated: because it does not escape the previous error.

original: yang ji skad du 'dus pa rnams ni cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir reg par 'gyur bas zhes lan smra ba /
analyzed: yang ji skad du 'dus pa rnams ni cha shas dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir reg par 'gyur bas zhes lan smra ba /
translated: But if you say that the collection of atoms is tangible because it has parts,

original: rdul phra rab rnams las bsags pa dag ces bya brgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams las bsags pa dag ces bya brgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: then the text should read: ‚ÄúThe collection of atoms is tangible.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rdul phra rab phan tshun ltos pa rnams gzugs su rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rdul phra rab phan tshun ltos pa rnams gzugs su rung ste /
translated: Just as atoms, which are mutually dependent, are susceptible to being broken up,

original: 'dus pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /üîΩrdul phra rab rnams bsags pa kho na la reg gi /
analyzed: 'dus pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du / rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa kho na la reg gi /
translated: but the collection is not,üîΩso too the collection of atoms is tangible, but the atoms are not.

original: 'dus pa dag la ni ma yin te 'dus pa rnams rdul phra rab las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag la ni ma yin te 'dus pa rnams rdul phra rab las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The collection is not different from the atoms.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams la 'dres par 'gyur ba dang / cha shas dang bcas pa nyid kyi nyes pa ni 'dus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams la 'dres par 'gyur ba dang / cha shas dang bcas pa nyid kyi nyes pa ni 'dus pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the error of being mixed up and having parts belongs to the collection, not to the atoms.

original: 'on te phyogs gcig gis reg na ni cha shas dang bcas pa dag tu thal bar 'gyur pa zhig na zhes gang smras pa de la bshad pa ni gal te rdul phra rab la phyogs tha dad pas rtogs na ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig gis reg na ni cha shas dang bcas pa dag tu thal bar 'gyur pa zhig na zhes gang smras pa de la bshad pa ni gal te rdul phra rab la phyogs tha dad pas rtogs na ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la
translated: The response to that is: If the subtle particle is cognized by a different direction, then.

original: / phyogs chas tha dad pa ni phyogs tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: / phyogs chas tha dad pa ni phyogs tha dad pa ste /
translated: A different direction is a different part.

original: shar gyi gzhan nyid yin la nub kyang gzhan nyid du yin /
analyzed: shar gyi gzhan nyid yin la nub kyang gzhan nyid du yin /
translated: The east is different, and the west is also different.

original: steng ni gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: steng ni gzhan nyid yin /
translated: The top is different,

original: 'og gi bar du yang yin no //
analyzed: 'og gi bar du yang yin no //
translated: and so is the bottom.

original: de ltar na phyogs tha dad pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir reg pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi ma reg pa yang cha shas dang bcas bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs tha dad pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir reg pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi ma reg pa yang cha shas dang bcas bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because a different direction exists, not only does it follow that it touches, but it also follows that it has parts.

original: gal te phyogs tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin na ni reg kyang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phyogs tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin na ni reg kyang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not cognized by a different direction, then it follows that it does not touch.

original: gang du zhe na cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: gang du zhe na cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du ste /
translated: Where? In having parts.

original: go sa gcig par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: go sa gcig par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in one place.

original: phyogs cha tha dad par brjod pa ni cha shas dang bcas par brjod pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: phyogs cha tha dad par brjod pa ni cha shas dang bcas par brjod pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúin different directions‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúhaving parts.‚Äù

original: cha shas med par khas blangs pa nyid kyis phyogs cha tha dad pa bzlog par byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: cha shas med par khas blangs pa nyid kyis phyogs cha tha dad pa bzlog par byas pa nyid do //
translated: The denial of different directions is the denial of having parts, since it is accepted that there are no parts.

original: gal te rdul phra rab phyogs cha tha tha dad pas mngon par brjod pa 'di dgongs pa yin par shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab phyogs cha tha tha dad pas mngon par brjod pa 'di dgongs pa yin par shes par mi bya ste /
translated: But if you think that the expression ‚Äúhaving parts‚Äù is not intended to refer to the divisibility of the smallest particle,

original: phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis kyang ma yin no //
translated: then it is not tenable to say that it has parts in one place but not in another.

original: ma reg pa la cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ma bshad do //
analyzed: ma reg pa la cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ma bshad do //
translated: If it does not touch, then it does not have parts.

original: 'o na go sa mtshungs pa de nyid 'dir brjod pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na go sa mtshungs pa de nyid 'dir brjod pa ci zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the expression ‚Äúhaving parts‚Äù refers to the same spatial location,

original: reg kyang thal bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba slob dpon gyi dgongs par shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: reg kyang thal bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba slob dpon gyi dgongs par shes par mi bya'o //
translated: then you should not think that the master intended to say that it does not follow that it touches.

original: rdul phra rab las gzhan pa ci zhig gi cha shas dang gang gis cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab las gzhan pa ci zhig gi cha shas dang gang gis cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: What other thing besides the smallest particle has parts, and by virtue of which it is not said to have parts?

original: de ni rdul phra rab nyid du mi 'gyur zhes pa'i tshig gis 'phangs @130a * //
analyzed: de ni rdul phra rab nyid du mi 'gyur zhes pa'i tshig gis 'phangs @130a * //
translated: The master‚Äôs statement ‚ÄúIt would not be a smallest particle‚Äù implies this.

original: pa de cha shas dang bcas pa'o //üîΩgal te phyogs cha tha dad par brjod pa las kyang /
analyzed: pa de cha shas dang bcas pa'o // gal te phyogs cha tha dad par brjod pa las kyang /
translated: and the part that is not in contact is that which is in contact with parts.üîΩIf you say that the atom is described as having parts because it is in contact with other atoms in different directions,üîΩthen the atom would have six parts,üîΩbecause it is in contact with six other atoms in the six directions.

original: tsatatpa ra me b'a ne yam /
analyzed: tsatatpa ra me b'a ne yam /
translated: But if you say that the atom is described as having parts because it is in contact with other atoms in different directions,

original: de bzhin nyid 'dren par /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'dren par /
translated: then the atom would have six parts,üîΩbecause it is in contact with six other atoms in the six directions.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang las brjod do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang las brjod do //
translated: But if you say that the atom is described as having parts because it is in contact with other atoms in different directions,üîΩthen the atom would have six parts,üîΩbecause it is in contact with six other atoms in the six directions.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: rdul phra rab dang nye ba las zas kyi dri la sogs pa 'dzin pas sna la sogs bas phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod kyi sna dang dri la sogs pa'i rdul phrar ba rnams phan chun reg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang nye ba las zas kyi dri la sogs pa 'dzin pas sna la sogs bas phrad pa 'dzin par 'dod kyi sna dang dri la sogs pa'i rdul phrar ba rnams phan chun reg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The nose and so on are said to apprehend contact because they apprehend the smell of food and so on that is close to the subtle particles. But the subtle particles of the nose and smell and so on do not mutually contact each other.

original: ma reg pa'i phyir sgrib ba dang thogs pa ma yin zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ma reg pa'i phyir sgrib ba dang thogs pa ma yin zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they do not contact each other, they are not obstructed or impeded, and they are not said to be impeded.

original: yang reg bya'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun reg gam ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang reg bya'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun reg gam ci zhe na /
translated: Do the subtle particles of tangibility contact each other?

original: reg par mi byed de 'dres pa dang cha shas dang bcas pa nyid kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg par mi byed de 'dres pa dang cha shas dang bcas pa nyid kyi skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not contact each other, because the error of being mixed and having parts would ensue.

original: gal te reg bya yang phan tshun reg par mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te reg bya yang phan tshun reg par mi byed na /
translated: If tangible things do not touch each other,

original: de lta na 'o na reg bya ma yin pa'i rgyu med do //üîΩkim pu na ste sh'am bi bar ma sprashta r'u pa ma dya le na ce di tye na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na reg bya ma yin pa'i rgyu med do // kim pu na ste sh'am bi bar ma sprashta r'u pa ma dya le na ce di tye na /
translated: then there is no cause for the non-tangible.üîΩkim punar asya r≈´pasya hetur na bhavati?

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba la ma ltos pa yod ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba la ma ltos pa yod ba ma yin zhing /
translated: Derived form does not exist without depending on the primary elements.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyang der 'byung ba de'i phyir reg bya ma yin pa'i gzugs gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyang der 'byung ba de'i phyir reg bya ma yin pa'i gzugs gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
translated: And the primary elements are present there. Therefore, you should say that there is another kind of form that is not tangible.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid ta sya h'i la te /üîΩbi bar d'u pa r'u pa sya ts'a nye na /üîΩ(ci yang de rnams rgyas pa reg ba dang ba'i gzugs /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs nyid ta sya h'i la te / bi bar d'u pa r'u pa sya ts'a nye na / (ci yang de rnams rgyas pa reg ba dang ba'i gzugs /
translated: The primary elements are the cause of that form.üîΩIf the form is distant,

original: 'ga' yang zhes pa 'di) bi ba ra /üîΩr'u pe na bha bi ta byi /
analyzed: 'ga' yang zhes pa 'di) bi ba ra / r'u pe na bha bi ta byi /
translated: is there any form that is derived from the primary elements and is not tangible?üîΩThere is no such form.

original: de yang gzhan du mi gnas so //
analyzed: de yang gzhan du mi gnas so //
translated: It is not possible that it exists in one place and not in another.

original: de khas blangs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de khas blangs pa nyid de /
translated: That is accepted.

original: bi bar / med pa'i phyir /üîΩbi ba ra /
analyzed: bi bar / med pa'i phyir /üîΩbi ba ra /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: gzugs kyis de chod pa dag tu rdul phra rab dag gis reg par thal ba'i phyir rdul phra gzugs kyi yang gzhan gyi rab rnams gos mtshungs pa nyid dam /üîΩcha shas dang bcas pa nyid ni pa pa ri hri te (gzugs kyis bsgom par bya'o/) 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyis de chod pa dag tu rdul phra rab dag gis reg par thal ba'i phyir rdul phra gzugs kyi yang gzhan gyi rab rnams gos mtshungs pa nyid dam / cha shas dang bcas pa nyid ni pa pa ri hri te (gzugs kyis bsgom par bya'o/) 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to touch, then the atoms of form would touch, and it would follow that form would be obstructed by form.üîΩTherefore atoms are not equal in size, or else they would have parts.

original: gang yang bu ga gzugs kyi bar stong ba dag tu de las gzhan rgyas pa'i pa'i rdul phra rab kyi skabs la gegs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang bu ga gzugs kyi bar stong ba dag tu de las gzhan rgyas pa'i pa'i rdul phra rab kyi skabs la gegs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the space that is the interstice between forms is not obstructed by the atoms of other elements.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid skabs kyi gegs so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid skabs kyi gegs so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says that the obstruction of space is the obstruction of the opportunity for arising.

original: phan tshun go sa (lan nyid ma yin no/) skyes pa la sgrib pa dang thogs pas thogs pa nyid du mi rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun go sa (lan nyid ma yin no/) skyes pa la sgrib pa dang thogs pas thogs pa nyid du mi rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Obstruction and contact are not suitable in the context of arising, but it is not unsuitable in the context of obstruction.

original: rang gi yul du skyed par sgrub pa la sdang ba ni de dag thogs ba dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: rang gi yul du skyed par sgrub pa la sdang ba ni de dag thogs ba dang bcas pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore those that obstruct the generation of their object field are asserted to be obstructed.

original: aa t'a pi (yang) sya ('gyur) dharma ti tse (chos nyid 'di) yam ya (gang/) ste thogs pa dang bcas pa yul tha mi dad @130b pa nyid do //üîΩnges par rdul phra rab rnams rdul phra rab de rnams dang reg pa las gos mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa t'a pi (yang) sya ('gyur) dharma ti tse (chos nyid 'di) yam ya (gang/) ste thogs pa dang bcas pa yul tha mi dad @130b pa nyid do // nges par rdul phra rab rnams rdul phra rab de rnams dang reg pa las gos mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd also‚Äù means ‚Äúand also this dharma, this nature, is yam, that is, it is obstructed, because it is not different from the object.üîΩIt is certain that the atoms touch one another, because they are covered by the atoms.

original: ae ti tatarha rdul phra rab cha shas dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ae ti tatarha rdul phra rab cha shas dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúEtai·∏• tarhi, the atoms would have parts,

original: gnyis kyi cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because two atoms would have a part that is not shared,‚Äù

original: slob dpon dpal len na re /üîΩaa bee de shye n'a ba sth'a nam /
analyzed: slob dpon dpal len na re / aa bee de shye n'a ba sth'a nam /
translated: the master ≈örƒ´lƒÅta says:

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAvayavina·∏• na upalabhyante.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, it is said, ‚ÄúAvayavina·∏• sarve·π£ƒÅm alpatara·∏• paramƒÅ·πáava·∏•‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir aa bhirbha go sya bee de shye na bh'a b'a ta zhes bya ba thams cad kyi nyung ba nyid ni rdul phra rab pa rnams su smra'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir aa bhirbha go sya bee de shye na bh'a b'a ta zhes bya ba thams cad kyi nyung ba nyid ni rdul phra rab pa rnams su smra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe smallest of all are the atoms.‚Äù

original: 'di 'o na /
analyzed: 'di 'o na /
translated: If that is so,

original: aa bee de shye khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa bee de shye khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be accepted that the atoms are not seen.

original: gal te b'a yam go skabs yon pa lnga rnams aa bee de shye (yul dang bral ba ma yin gnas skabs/) zhes bya ba bye ba brgya stong rnams kyi aa bee de shye (cha shas 'di yul dang bral ba med pa'i phyir/) ko bi bandha: de bzhin du
analyzed: gal te b'a yam go skabs yon pa lnga rnams aa bee de shye (yul dang bral ba ma yin gnas skabs/) zhes bya ba bye ba brgya stong rnams kyi aa bee de shye (cha shas 'di yul dang bral ba med pa'i phyir/) ko bi bandha: de bzhin du
translated: then the hundred thousand ko·π≠is of ‚Äúnot free from objects‚Äù would be ‚Äúnot free from objects‚Äù due to the parts.

original: aa bee de sha ka'i rdul phra rab ji snyed pa thams cad kyang de snyed du gyur na 'gro ba mtha' dag rdul phran tsam du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa bee de sha ka'i rdul phra rab ji snyed pa thams cad kyang de snyed du gyur na 'gro ba mtha' dag rdul phran tsam du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If all the atoms of ‚Äúnot free from objects‚Äù were that many, it would follow that all migrating beings would be the size of an atom.

original: tsa ts'a phu nar aa bee de shyam rdul phra rab gcig gi phul las lnga 'dus pa'i yul ches /
analyzed: tsa ts'a phu nar aa bee de shyam rdul phra rab gcig gi phul las lnga 'dus pa'i yul ches /
translated: Since the object of the fivefold gathering in the tip of a single atom of ‚Äúnot free from objects‚Äù is vast,

original: (yul dang bral ba ma yin pa'i gegs/) yangs pa'i phyir de'i cha shas nyid ma reg par yang khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: (yul dang bral ba ma yin pa'i gegs/) yangs pa'i phyir de'i cha shas nyid ma reg par yang khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: its parts should be accepted as not touching.

original: de'i phyir thams cad 'dus ba rnams las rbe sh'am bh'a ba da bhi ni bha gi tva me sham n'a be de shyi di ti /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad 'dus ba rnams las rbe sh'am bh'a ba da bhi ni bha gi tva me sham n'a be de shyi di ti /
translated: Therefore, all the gatherings are ‚Äúthe bhaga that is not free from the parts of the object.‚Äù

original: myur du 'jug bas zhes yang yul dang bral ba ma yin pa'i /
analyzed: myur du 'jug bas zhes yang yul dang bral ba ma yin pa'i /
translated: It is not that they are not separated from the object.

original: bya ba ni lta ba dang nyan pa'i phyed pa myur du 'jug pas so //
analyzed: bya ba ni lta ba dang nyan pa'i phyed pa myur du 'jug pas so //
translated: The function is the rapid engagement of seeing and hearing.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a whirling firebrand.

original: dper na yul gzhan du myur du 'jug pas na mgal me la 'khor lo'i blor 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yul gzhan du myur du 'jug pas na mgal me la 'khor lo'i blor 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, because of rapid engagement in another place, there is the idea of a wheel in a whirling firebrand.

original: dbang po'i yul ('di rnams thams cad dngos po /üîΩcha shas nyid 'di rnams du ba min 'bral ba zhes so/) / phra rab rnams ji snyed pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul ('di rnams thams cad dngos po / cha shas nyid 'di rnams du ba min 'bral ba zhes so/) / phra rab rnams ji snyed pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: As many as there are atoms of the sense faculties and objects.

original: sna la sogs pa dag gis ni dbang po'i rdul phra rab dag las ches lhag pa'i yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams mi gtogs so //
analyzed: sna la sogs pa dag gis ni dbang po'i rdul phra rab dag las ches lhag pa'i yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams mi gtogs so //
translated: The sense faculties such as the nose do not include the atoms of the objects that are greater than the atoms of the sense faculties.

original: 'di ltar dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni yul ches chung ba la yang de snyed cig byed ba dang bcas kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni yul ches chung ba la yang de snyed cig byed ba dang bcas kyi /
translated: Thus, the atoms of the sense faculties are associated with the smallest objects, but not with greater objects.

original: ches nyung ba dang ches mang ba dag lam yin te /
analyzed: ches nyung ba dang ches mang ba dag lam yin te /
translated: They are not associated with fewer or greater atoms.

original: de lta na de dag yul dang phrad pa nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de dag yul dang phrad pa nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, they would contact their objects, but not otherwise.

original: mig dang rna ba dag gi ni ma nges par bshad pa'i phyir sngar bshad pa rnams la mnyam pa kho na 'dzin no zhes nges pa bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dag gi ni ma nges par bshad pa'i phyir sngar bshad pa rnams la mnyam pa kho na 'dzin no zhes nges pa bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said that the eye and ear are indeterminate, it is certain that they apprehend only what is equal.

original: res 'ga' ni chung ste zhes bya brgya cher 'byung ba la 'di skad du /üîΩyul ma nges pa'i phyir lhag par 'dzin gyi mag la me'i 'khor lo bzhin du myur @131a * //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni chung ste zhes bya brgya cher 'byung ba la 'di skad du / yul ma nges pa'i phyir lhag par 'dzin gyi mag la me'i 'khor lo bzhin du myur @131a * //
translated: Sometimes they apprehend a small object, sometimes a large object.

original: du 'jug pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du 'jug pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the object is indeterminate, they apprehend it in excess, but not because they engage quickly, like the spokes of a whirling firebrand.

original: ma phrad par khyad par med pa ni khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir rim gyis 'dzin par mi rigs pa de'i phyir thams cad kyis re shig rdul phra rab rnams kho na lan gcig 'dzin no //
analyzed: ma phrad par khyad par med pa ni khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir rim gyis 'dzin par mi rigs pa de'i phyir thams cad kyis re shig rdul phra rab rnams kho na lan gcig 'dzin no //
translated: Since there is no difference in the noncontact, it is not reasonable that they apprehend gradually because there is no cause for a difference. Therefore, all of them apprehend only atoms at one time.

original: mig phye ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig phye ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: When the eyes are open, they apprehend a large object.

original: tsam smos pa ni myur du bsgyur bar rtog pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩtshad ni lus can gyi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir na yid la tshad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tsam smos pa ni myur du bsgyur bar rtog pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro // tshad ni lus can gyi rdzas la brten pa'i phyir na yid la tshad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated to counter the notion that the eye and so on are quickly transformed.üîΩThe mind has no size because it is not a substance that possesses a body.

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a substance that possesses a body because it is not a body.

original: de'i phyir 'di la tshad mi dpyad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la tshad mi dpyad do //
translated: Therefore, its size is not analyzed.

original: dbang po nyams pa rnams la rten yod kyang gzugs mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag rten las gzhan yin no zhes bya bar nges mod kyi /
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa rnams la rten yod kyang gzugs mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir mig la sogs pa dag rten las gzhan yin no zhes bya bar nges mod kyi /
translated: Even though the eye sense faculty and so on have a support in those whose sense faculties are impaired, they do not see form. Therefore it is certain that the eye sense faculty and so on are different from their support.

original: de dag tu'am ji ltar gnas pa ni ma nges pas de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de dag tu'am ji ltar gnas pa ni ma nges pas de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: But it is not certain that they exist in those places, so the root text asks,

original: yang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa 'di dag gi zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang mig gi dbang po la sogs pa 'di dag gi zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhere are the eye and so on located?‚Äù

original: mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi gnas tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni dka' mod kyi /
analyzed: mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi gnas tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni dka' mod kyi /
translated: It is difficult to determine the location of the eye sense faculty and so on because they are not apprehended by the eye.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams yul tha dad par gnas pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa rnams skye ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar gang dag ji ltar gnas pa de brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams yul tha dad par gnas pa'i phyir dang / 'dus pa rnams skye ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar gang dag ji ltar gnas pa de brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Since those that are impeded are located in different places and those that are assembled are generated, it is necessary to state how they are located.

original: re zhig mig gi rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩmig gi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: re zhig mig gi rdul phra rab rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / mig gi 'bras bu ste /
translated: First, the atoms of the eye sense faculty are located in the middle of the eye,üîΩin the middle of the eye disk that is half seen.

original: mthong phyed kyi dkyil 'khor la go snyod kyi me tog bzhin du yul la mngon du phyogs par gnas so //
analyzed: mthong phyed kyi dkyil 'khor la go snyod kyi me tog bzhin du yul la mngon du phyogs par gnas so //
translated: They are located facing the object, like the flower of the thorn apple.

original: go snyod kyi me tog smos pa ni phan tshun ma 'brel bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go snyod kyi me tog smos pa ni phan tshun ma 'brel bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the flower of the thorn apple is to indicate that they are not mutually connected.

original: phan tshun ma 'brel ba'i phyir gyes par thal zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir kha dog dang bas bkag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phan tshun ma 'brel ba'i phyir gyes par thal zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir kha dog dang bas bkag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To prevent the qualm, ‚ÄúIt follows that they are dispersed because they are not mutually connected,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúbecause they are obstructed by color and so on.‚Äù

original: kha dog dang smos pa ni shel ltar lta ba'i gegs bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang smos pa ni shel ltar lta ba'i gegs bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of color is to eliminate the qualm that they are like crystal.

original: bla 'og na gnas na nang ma rnams la sgrib par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bla 'og na gnas na nang ma rnams la sgrib par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they were located above and below, they would obscure the internal bases.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun mi sgrib bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun mi sgrib bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThey do not obscure each other, etc.‚Äù

original: shel gyi cha shas dag ni phan tshun mi sgrib ste //
analyzed: shel gyi cha shas dag ni phan tshun mi sgrib ste //
translated: The parts of a crystal do not obscure each other.

original: phan tshun bsgribs na shel gyis bsgribs pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun bsgribs na shel gyis bsgribs pa'i gzugs mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did obscure each other, then a crystal would not hold a form that is obscured by it.

original: rna ba'i bu ga gi nang na gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rna ba'i bu ga gi nang na gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ear sense faculty is located in the interior of the ear holes.

original: rna ba'i bu ga ni rna khung gi bu ga'i mthar thug pa'o //üîΩmtshul ba'i nang na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rna ba'i bu ga ni rna khung gi bu ga'i mthar thug pa'o // mtshul ba'i nang na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ear holes are the openings of the ear canals.üîΩThe nose sense faculty is located in the interior of the nose.

original: sna'i nang na rten dang 'dra bang kha thur du bltas pa'o //
analyzed: sna'i nang na rten dang 'dra bang kha thur du bltas pa'o //
translated: The interior of the nose is like a tube with the mouth facing downward.

original: skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam @131b zhig ma khebs pa ni ma khyab pa'o //
analyzed: skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam @131b zhig ma khebs pa ni ma khyab pa'o //
translated: The sense faculties do not pervade their entire object field.

original: grag go'i skra ni srid par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag go'i skra ni srid par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculties are taught to exist in the dimension of a hair tip.

original: thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa skyed na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa skyed na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If all of them generate consciousness, etc.

original: lo'i sgra ni der lus mi 'jig pa ni las kyis gzung ba'i phyir yin gyi thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni der lus mi 'jig pa ni las kyis gzung ba'i phyir yin gyi thams cad kyis rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúyear‚Äù is used because the body does not disintegrate there due to karma, but not because it does not produce consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù means

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rdul phra rab pa'i yul gyi rdul phra rab gcig gis rnam par shes pa skyed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rdul phra rab pa'i yul gyi rdul phra rab gcig gis rnam par shes pa skyed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a single subtle particle of the object of the sense faculties does not produce consciousness.

original: yid ni gcig pu zhig kho na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid ni gcig pu zhig kho na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten du 'gyur la /
translated: Only one mental faculty serves as the basis for the mental consciousness.

original: chos gcig dang du ma yang lnga po dag gi zhes khyad par du byas so //üîΩrten dang dmigs pa ni bsags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gcig dang du ma yang lnga po dag gi zhes khyad par du byas so // rten dang dmigs pa ni bsags pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One dharma and many dharmas are distinguished as the objects of the five sense consciousnesses.üîΩBecause the basis and object are accumulated means

original: bsags pa la brten pa'i phyir dang bsags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsags pa la brten pa'i phyir dang bsags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the basis is accumulated and because the object is accumulated.

original: bstan du med pa yang don gang gis she na /
analyzed: bstan du med pa yang don gang gis she na /
translated: How is it imperceptible?

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes smos so //
translated: For that very reason is stated.

original: ci mig ni rnam par shes pa na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci mig ni rnam par shes pa na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Does the eye see when it is in the present?

original: 'di ni rten nges par bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtsams kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni rten nges par bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtsams kyi /
translated: This is stated in order to indicate the certainty of the basis,

original: rten bstan par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //üîΩtha ma'i rten 'das zhes bya ba ni gong du drug po 'das ma thag pa yi /
analyzed: rten bstan par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no // tha ma'i rten 'das zhes bya ba ni gong du drug po 'das ma thag pa yi /
translated: but not in order to indicate the basis itself.üîΩThe basis of the last is past.

original: zhes bya ba'i mdo der bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mdo der bstan zin to //
translated: This has already been indicated in the sutra, ‚ÄúThe six that have just passed away.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong rten bcas //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong rten bcas //
translated: The eye sees forms along with its support,

original: de la brten pa'i rnam shes min //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i rnam shes min //
translated: but not the consciousness that is based on it.

original: zhes bya ba de nyid du lnga po rnams kyi rten da ltar byung ba'i dngos por gyur pa'i don nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nyid du lnga po rnams kyi rten da ltar byung ba'i dngos por gyur pa'i don nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In that passage, the basis of the five is the present state of the eye, etc., because they are the objects of the present state.

original: tha ma'i rten 'das zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha ma'i rten 'das zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis of the last is past.

original: tha ma ni 'dod pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: tha ma ni 'dod pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The last is the order of the desire realm.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i rten ni 'das pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i rten ni 'das pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The basis of that mental consciousness is past,

original: de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: but not the present or future.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das pa yang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das pa yang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the five sense consciousnesses are also supported by the mental faculty.

original: lnga rnams kyi /
analyzed: lnga rnams kyi /
translated: The five are supported by the two.

original: de dag lhan cig skyes pa yin //
analyzed: de dag lhan cig skyes pa yin //
translated: They are also supported by the mental faculty.

original: zhes skyes na 'das pa mi rtogs la /üîΩ'das pa ni 'dod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: zhes skyes na 'das pa mi rtogs la / 'das pa ni 'dod pa yang yin te /
translated: If it were said that the five sense consciousnesses are supported by the mental faculty, then the five would not be supported by the past mental faculty.üîΩBut the past mental faculty is also asserted to be their support.

original: de'i phyir yang gi sgra ni de bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gi sgra ni de bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used to include the past mental faculty.üîΩThus it is understood that the five sense consciousnesses are supported by the past and present mental faculty, but not by the future mental faculty.

original: de ltar na lnga po rnams kyi 'das pa dang da ltar ba yin gyi ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin pas rten gyi rnam par gzhag pa yul dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhes pa shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lnga po rnams kyi 'das pa dang da ltar ba yin gyi ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin pas rten gyi rnam par gzhag pa yul dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhes pa shes par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore the five sense consciousnesses are not like the object in being supported.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dbang po gnyis kyi rten can yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dbang po gnyis kyi rten can yin la /
translated: Because the five sense consciousnesses are supported by two faculties,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi dbang po kho na'i rten can yin @132a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi dbang po kho na'i rten can yin @132a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
translated: and mental consciousness is supported by the mental faculty alone.

original: mu dang po ni mig yin no zhes bya ba rten gyi dngos po yin gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dbang por ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mu dang po ni mig yin no zhes bya ba rten gyi dngos po yin gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dbang por ni ma yin te /
translated: The first possibility is the eye sense faculty, which is the basis of the eye consciousness but is not its sense faculty as an equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung pa kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por nges pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung pa kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por nges pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Because it arises simultaneously with eye consciousness and because only minds and mental factors are definitely equivalent immediately preceding conditions, the eye sense faculty is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition of eye consciousness.

original: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second possibility is the immediately past mental factor of the phenomena element.

original: sems las byung ba rnams rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rten gyi dngos po kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rten gyi dngos po kho na yin gyi /
translated: Because mental factors are not the basis of consciousness, they are the basis of the equivalent immediately preceding condition but are not the basis of the sense faculty.

original: rten gyi dngos por ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi dngos por ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not the basis of the sense faculty because they are not the support of the sense faculty.

original: sems las byung ba smos pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba smos pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term mental factors is stated to exclude the nonassociated formative forces.

original: 'das ma thag pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa smos pa ni ma 'ongs pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmediately preceding‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the future.

original: de ma thag pa smos pa ni par dang bcas pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag pa smos pa ni par dang bcas pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmediately preceding‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the past and future.

original: gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yang yin la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid yin no // zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yang yin la /
translated: The third is the immediately preceding mind.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the support in the present and the immediately preceding support.

original: bzhi pa ni bshad pa lam gtogs pa'i chos rnams yin te zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bshad pa lam gtogs pa'i chos rnams yin te zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos por yang ma yin la /
translated: The fourth is the remaining entities, with the exception of the path.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: This is neither the support in the present nor the immediately preceding support.

original: de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams dang rna ba la sogs pa rnams dang / sems las byung ba mi skye ba'i chos can rnams dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams dang rna ba la sogs pa rnams dang / sems las byung ba mi skye ba'i chos can rnams dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: These are the objects such as form, the ear, etc., the mental factors that are unarisen, and the unconditioned.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang rang gi dbang po brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang rang gi dbang po brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same should be stated for the body consciousness up to the mind consciousness.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rna ba dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i sna dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i lus kyi dbang po ste mu dang po ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rna ba dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i sna dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i lus kyi dbang po ste mu dang po ni de lta bu'o //
