translated: The ear faculty is the basis of ear-consciousness, the nose faculty is the basis of nose-consciousness, the tongue faculty is the basis of tongue-consciousness, and the body faculty is the basis of body-consciousness. This is the first alternative.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin tshig snga ma dang sbyar ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin tshig snga ma dang sbyar ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mental faculty is the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: gang du sngar mthong ba'i tshig gis don go ba dang de ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang du sngar mthong ba'i tshig gis don go ba dang de ni tshig snga ma dang sbyor ba'o //
translated: When the meaning is understood by a word seen previously, it is connected with the previous word.

original: gang du phyi mar mthong ba'i tshig gis don go ba ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gang du phyi mar mthong ba'i tshig gis don go ba ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: When the meaning is understood by a word seen later, it is connected with the later word.

original: re zhig gang rten gyi dngos por yin pa de mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re zhig gang rten gyi dngos por yin pa de mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: First, whatever is a basis is also a condition being equivalent and immediately antecedent.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i yid ni de'i rten dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang yin no @132b chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i yid ni de'i rten dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang yin no @132b chos kyi khams sems las byung ba 'das ma thag pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The immediately past mind is the support and the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition.

original: de ni de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen kho na yin gyi rten ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen kho na yin gyi rten ni ma yin no //
translated: The immediately past mental factor of the phenomena element is the equivalent and immediately antecedent condition, but it is not the support.

original: yang ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga po rnams kyi yul da ltar ba kho na yin gyi 'das pa yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga po rnams kyi yul da ltar ba kho na yin gyi 'das pa yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the objects of the five sense consciousnesses only present and not past?

original: rten da ltar ba'i dbang gis yul rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rten da ltar ba'i dbang gis yul rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The object is posited by the power of the present support.

original: gzhan du na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dus gsum pa'i yul can ma yin par 'das pa kho na'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dus gsum pa'i yul can ma yin par 'das pa kho na'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, mental consciousness would not have objects of the three times, but would only have past objects.

original: gzhan yang rten dang lhan cig yul la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rten rnams kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i don la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rten dang lhan cig yul la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rten rnams kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i don la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because the object is engaged by the support, and because the supports do not engage hidden objects.

original: da ltar ba'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams nyid yul gyi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams yul ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams nyid yul gyi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams yul ma yin no //
translated: Present form, etc., is not the object of the past or future.

original: gzhan dag mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi yul 'das par yang sems te /
analyzed: gzhan dag mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi yul 'das par yang sems te /
translated: Others think that the past is the object of certain consciousnesses, such as visual consciousness, etc.üîΩIt is possible that a result arises from a condition that has already arisen, but not from a condition that has arisen simultaneously.

original: sngar skyes kho na'i rkyen gyis 'bras bu skyed pa rung gi lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du da ltar ba'i rkyen yang 'das pa kho na rung gi lhan cig skyes pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngar skyes kho na'i rkyen gyis 'bras bu skyed pa rung gi lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa dang / de bzhin du da ltar ba'i rkyen yang 'das pa kho na rung gi lhan cig skyes pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, it is possible that a present condition is past, but not that it is simultaneous.

original: rang gi rgyud 'dzin pa'i phyir 'das pa thams cad yul nyid du thal ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud 'dzin pa'i phyir 'das pa thams cad yul nyid du thal ba med do //
translated: But it is not possible that all past is the object, because it is not the object of the present mental consciousness.

original: gal te yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyu mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not possible for a nonexistent cause to exist,

original: de ni ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: that is not so,

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i rgyu 'dod do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i rgyu 'dod do //
translated: because we accept a past and present cause.

original: 'o na ci da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa da ltar byung ba de'i tshe 'das pa zhes brjod par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa da ltar byung ba de'i tshe 'das pa zhes brjod par byed ce na /
translated: But if the present and future are the objects of the present consciousness, then why is it said that the past is the object?

original: de lta na 'o na ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yul yin zhes brjod par bya'i 'das pa ni yul zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yul yin zhes brjod par bya'i 'das pa ni yul zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then it should be said that the present and future are the objects, but the past is not the object.

original: 'das pa yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'das pa yul ma yin pas so //
translated: Because the past is not the object.

original: dus gzhan gyi rkyen gyis dus gzhan gyi yul zhes bya ba rigs par brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi rkyen gyis dus gzhan gyi yul zhes bya ba rigs par brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the object of a different time is a condition of a different time.

original: gang zhig rkyen gyi ngo bo mi snang bas rnam par shes pa skyes pa de dmigs pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen gyi ngo bo mi snang bas rnam par shes pa skyes pa de dmigs pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the cause of the arising of consciousness, but does not appear as the nature of the condition, is called the objective condition.

original: gzhan du ni dmigs pa'i rkyen ma lus pa'i khyad par ci /
analyzed: gzhan du ni dmigs pa'i rkyen ma lus pa'i khyad par ci /
translated: Otherwise, what is the difference between the objective condition and all other conditions?

original: de'i rnam pa skye ba med par rnam par shes pa dus gzhan gyi dmigs pa 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa skye ba med par rnam par shes pa dus gzhan gyi dmigs pa 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Without the arising of its aspect, consciousness does not apprehend the object of a different time.

original: 'o na ci gang zhig da ltar byung ba'i yul la da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar rtogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci gang zhig da ltar byung ba'i yul la da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar rtogs par byed ce na /
translated: Well then, what is it that causes the present consciousness to arise in regard to a present object?

original: da ltar byung ba'i rgyu mtshan las da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la de'i rnam pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni rigs par brjod pa ma yin no //üîΩde'i rnam pa las rnam par shes pa la yul nges pa yang mi rigs @133a * //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rgyu mtshan las da ltar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la de'i rnam pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni rigs par brjod pa ma yin no // de'i rnam pa las rnam par shes pa la yul nges pa yang mi rigs @133a * //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that a present consciousness arises in the aspect of a present object, because the object has already ceased when the consciousness arises.üîΩIt is also unreasonable to say that the object is ascertained by the consciousness in the aspect of that object, because the object has already ceased when the consciousness arises.

original: so ; / de'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i yul nyid rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bor rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: so ; / de'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i yul nyid rnam par shes pa skye bar 'dod pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bor rnam par gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the present object itself is the objective condition of the present consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe de'i rnam par shes ba skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe yul dang bcas par 'gags pas na 'das pa yul du brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i rnam par shes ba skye bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe yul dang bcas par 'gags pas na 'das pa yul du brjod do //
translated: When the consciousness arises, the object has already ceased, but it is called the object because it is the object of the consciousness that has already ceased.

original: 'das pa yul du brjod ces bya bas 'das pa'i yul mig gi rnam par shes pa'i lam du ldan pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa yul du brjod ces bya bas 'das pa'i yul mig gi rnam par shes pa'i lam du ldan pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe past is called the object‚Äù does not mean that the past object is the object of the present eye consciousness,

original: de ltar zhar las byung bas chog go //
analyzed: de ltar zhar las byung bas chog go //
translated: This digression is sufficient.

original: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya ste /üîΩyang rnam par shes pa ni gnyis ka la rag lus te skyon zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid brtsam par bya ste / yang rnam par shes pa ni gnyis ka la rag lus te skyon zhes bya ba la /
translated: We must return to the main point.üîΩThe author of the treatise says:üîΩConsciousness arises in dependence on two.

original: gnyi ga la rag lus pa yang ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye'o zhes bya ba lung la grub ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga la rag lus pa yang ji ltar shes par bya zhe na / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye'o zhes bya ba lung la grub ste /
translated: How do we know that consciousness arises in dependence on two?üîΩFrom the scriptures and from reasoning.üîΩThe scriptures are established because it is said in the scriptures:

original: kha cig lung las mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: kha cig lung las mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du yid dang chos la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness arises in dependence on two, that is, on the eye and forms.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba ni rig bzhin pa rnams te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni rig bzhin pa rnams te /
translated: The reasoning is established because it is experienced.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa med pa las mi skye zhing gzugs la sogs pa nye yang mig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir long ba la sogs pa rnams la mi skye'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa med pa las mi skye zhing gzugs la sogs pa nye yang mig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir long ba la sogs pa rnams la mi skye'o //
translated: Visual consciousness, etc., do not arise from the eye, etc., when form, etc., are absent. Nor do they arise from the eye, etc., when form, etc., are present, but the eye, etc., are not operative, as in the case of one who is blind or asleep.

original: gal te yid la byed pa las skye bar bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yid la byed pa las skye bar bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But aren‚Äôt they said to arise from attention?

original: gzugs dang snang pa de las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa las 'gyur gyi mig yongs su grub pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang snang pa de las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar gnas pa las 'gyur gyi mig yongs su grub pa las ma yin no //
translated: They arise from the attention that is produced from form and light, not from the fully developed eye.

original: de bzhin du de las skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de las skyes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, visual consciousness arises from that attention.

original: de la ci'i phyir gnyis kho na nye bar bkod ce na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir gnyis kho na nye bar bkod ce na /
translated: Why are only these two mentioned?

original: yid la byed pa ni sems las byung ba yin zhing sems la brten pa yin pa'i phyir dang sems kyi rten du mi 'gyur bas nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems las byung ba yin zhing sems la brten pa yin pa'i phyir dang sems kyi rten du mi 'gyur bas nye bar bkod do //
translated: Attention is a mental factor and is based on the mind, but it is not the basis of the mind. Therefore, it is mentioned.

original: de dag gyur pas 'gyur nyid phyir //
analyzed: de dag gyur pas 'gyur nyid phyir //
translated: Because consciousness changes when they change.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of the above passage is as follows.

original: de dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba ni de dag gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par 'gyur ba ni de dag gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation of those is their change.

original: de dag rnam par 'gyur ro zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro ;
analyzed: de dag rnam par 'gyur ro zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro ;
translated: The word ‚Äúthose‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äútransformations.‚Äù

original: / phan pa dang gnod pa dang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / phan pa dang gnod pa dang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they follow the nature of being beneficial, harmful, clear, and unclear.

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dag ni rkyen la bltos pa yin la /
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dag ni rkyen la bltos pa yin la /
translated: Being beneficial and harmful depend on conditions.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid ces bya ba ni mig gi rang bzhin nyid do //üîΩrjes su byed pa'i sgra ni phan pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes @133b bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid ces bya ba ni mig gi rang bzhin nyid do // rjes su byed pa'i sgra ni phan pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes @133b bya ba nas /
translated: Being clear and unclear is the nature of the eye.

original: mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúfollow‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúfollow being beneficial‚Äù up to ‚Äúfollow being unclear.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du bde ba skye ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa dag mig sman dang rdul la sogs pa dag gis phan btags pa dang gnod pa byas pa'i rjes su byed cing
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni go rims bzhin du bde ba skye ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa dag mig sman dang rdul la sogs pa dag gis phan btags pa dang gnod pa byas pa'i rjes su byed cing
translated: The eye consciousness and so on are respectively the doors of the arising of pleasure and the arising of pain, and they conform to the benefit and harm of the eye and so on by means of eye medicine, dust and so on.

original: / de bzhin du gsal ba dang mi gsal bar skyes pas gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur ba nyid kyang rjes su byed de /
analyzed: / de bzhin du gsal ba dang mi gsal bar skyes pas gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur ba nyid kyang rjes su byed de /
translated: Similarly, they conform to the nature of the clear and unclear because they arise as clear and unclear.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam par gyur bas rnam par shes pa rnams 'gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam par gyur bas rnam par shes pa rnams 'gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the consciousnesses change due to the change of the eye and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag gyur pas de dag 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag gyur pas de dag 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not change due to the change of form and so on,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag gi phan pa dang gnod pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag gi phan pa dang gnod pa gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the benefit and harm of form and so on do not conform to the clear and unclear.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa yang mi gser gyis mig nyams pa rnams kyis dung ser por mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa yang mi gser gyis mig nyams pa rnams kyis dung ser por mthong ba yin la /
translated: In the same way, the eye consciousnesses of those whose eyes are affected by cataracts or by jaundice see a white shell as yellow.

original: rab rib la sogs pas gnod pa byas na gzugs rnam par 'gyur bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas gnod pa byas na gzugs rnam par 'gyur bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: And when the eye is affected by ophthalmia, etc., one sees forms as transformed.

original: de bzhin du mig mi gsal na gzugs rang gi mtshan nyid kyis tshang yang mig gi rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig mi gsal na gzugs rang gi mtshan nyid kyis tshang yang mig gi rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when the eye is not clear, the eye consciousness is not clear, even though the form is complete in itself.

original: de ltar na mig gsal na gzugs mi gsal yang de'i rnam par shes pa gsal bar skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mig gsal na gzugs mi gsal yang de'i rnam par shes pa gsal bar skye'o //
translated: Thus, when the eye is clear, the eye consciousness arises clearly, even though the form is not clear.

original: 'dir rten gyi don ni rjes su byed pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rten gyi don ni rjes su byed pa'i don yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of ‚Äúbasis‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúconforming to.‚Äù

original: shin tu legs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni ches legs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu legs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni ches legs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is very good‚Äù means ‚Äúit is excellent.‚Äù

original: lus rlung la sogs pas sun phyung ba dang rnam par dag pa las rnam par shes pa 'khrugs pa dang ma 'khrugs pa skye ste /
analyzed: lus rlung la sogs pas sun phyung ba dang rnam par dag pa las rnam par shes pa 'khrugs pa dang ma 'khrugs pa skye ste /
translated: The consciousness arises disturbed or undisturbed from the body‚Äôs disturbance or non-disturbance by wind, etc.

original: de de'i rten ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de de'i rten ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not its basis.

original: yod kyang rjes su byed do zhes brjod par bya ba de lta na de'i tshe yang rang gi rten gyi rjes su byed pa nyid do //üîΩgang zhig gi lus sdug bsngal bar skyes pa de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang lhan cig thams cad 'khrugs pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags nas rgyud de nyid la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'khrugs pa skye'o //
analyzed: yod kyang rjes su byed do zhes brjod par bya ba de lta na de'i tshe yang rang gi rten gyi rjes su byed pa nyid do // gang zhig gi lus sdug bsngal bar skyes pa de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang lhan cig thams cad 'khrugs pa'i lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'gags nas rgyud de nyid la yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'khrugs pa skye'o //
translated: Even if it does exist, it is still said to conform to the latter. In that case, it conforms to its own support.üîΩWhen the body is born as painful, the body consciousness is disturbed and ceases together with the feeling of pain. Then, a disturbed mental consciousness arises in that same stream.

original: de las bzlog pas ni 'khrugs pa ma yin pa skye ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni 'khrugs pa ma yin pa skye ste /
translated: When the body is born as pleasant, the body consciousness is undisturbed and arises together with the feeling of pleasure. Then, an undisturbed mental consciousness arises in that same stream.üîΩWhen the body is born as neither painful nor pleasant, the body consciousness is neither disturbed nor undisturbed and ceases together with the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain. Then, a mental consciousness that is neither disturbed nor undisturbed arises in that same stream.

original: de'i phyir de ni yid nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni yid nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it conforms to the mind itself.

original: gal te rang gi rten gyi rjes su byed na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rten gyi rjes su byed na /
translated: If it conforms to its own support,

original: ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa las zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa las zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can it be a pure consciousness when it is associated with impure dharmas?

original: zag pa'i chos thams @134a * //üîΩcad rten par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa'i chos thams @134a * // cad rten par mi 'gyur te /
translated: All impure dharmas are not its support,

original: rten med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be without a support.

original: gzhan du na lung du ma bstan pa'i mig las mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya /
analyzed: gzhan du na lung du ma bstan pa'i mig las mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya /
translated: Otherwise, it would be called a virtuous or nonvirtuous eye consciousness arising from a neutral eye.

original: gang la rnam par shes pa'i byed pa nyid kyis de bsnyad par rigs so snyam du bsam ste 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: gang la rnam par shes pa'i byed pa nyid kyis de bsnyad par rigs so snyam du bsam ste 'dri ba ni /
translated: The questioner thinks that it is reasonable to name something after its function,

original: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: so he asks, Why is it called eye consciousness?

original: rten gyi don bshad zin pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: rten gyi don bshad zin pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi 'dri ba ni /
translated: Since the meaning of basis has already been explained, the questioner asks, How is it not shared?

original: ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin zhe na /üîΩgzhan gyi mig gis gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin zhe na / gzhan gyi mig gis gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: How is it not shared?

original: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba las yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rigs mtshungs pa nyid yin yang sems can gyi rten tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye ba las yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa ni rigs mtshungs pa nyid yin yang sems can gyi rten tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not shared by another, because the mental consciousness and eye consciousness are of the same type, but they are different in that they are the basis of different sentient beings.

original: lus kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the body.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni dri la sogs pa rnams la ni yul dang phrad pa'i phyir srid pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa gzhan sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni dri la sogs pa rnams la ni yul dang phrad pa'i phyir srid pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa gzhan sna la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur pa rnams so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that smell and so on are objects of nose consciousness and so on, because they are objects that contact their sense faculty.

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley.

original: sgra dang myu gu 'byung ba rgyu du ma la rag las pa yin yang /
analyzed: sgra dang myu gu 'byung ba rgyu du ma la rag las pa yin yang /
translated: Although the arising of sound and the sprout depend on many causes,

original: rnga bo che dang nas gnyis thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang rten yin pa'i phyir rnga bo che'i sgra /üîΩnas kyi myu gu zhes de dag gis bstan gyi /
analyzed: rnga bo che dang nas gnyis thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang rten yin pa'i phyir rnga bo che'i sgra / nas kyi myu gu zhes de dag gis bstan gyi /
translated: the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley are taught by those terms because the drum and barley are not shared in common and are the basis.

original: dbyu gu la sogs pa dang chu la sogs pa dag ni rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra dag s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa dag la thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir de dag gis ma bstan te /
analyzed: dbyu gu la sogs pa dang chu la sogs pa dag ni rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra dag s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa dag la thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir de dag gis ma bstan te /
translated: But the sound of a pataha drum and so on is not taught by the term sprout of barley and so on, because the sound of a pataha drum and so on and the sprout of barley and so on are shared in common.

original: 'on kyang rnga bo che'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes bstan par nus so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnga bo che'i sgra nas kyi myu gu zhes bstan par nus so //
translated: But it is possible to teach that the sound of a drum is the sprout of barley.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du bstan par nus kyi yul rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du bstan par nus kyi yul rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, here, it is possible to demonstrate the eye consciousness up to the mind consciousness, but not the objects.

original: de lta mod kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa nyi bar bkod pa gzhan ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa nyi bar bkod pa gzhan ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, for what purpose is the eye consciousness specifically mentioned?

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis shes par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis shes par byed pa'i don to //
translated: It is for the purpose of making known the uncommon.

original: rigs mthun pa rnams kyang rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur na rigs tha dad pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa rnams kyang rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur na rigs tha dad pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes pa'o //
translated: If those of the same type become the basis of another consciousness, what need is there to mention those of different types?

original: gal te thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa bkag na rten bkag par gyur pas nye bar len pa don med pa can ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa bkag na rten bkag par gyur pas nye bar len pa don med pa can ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: But if the uncommon is refuted because of the refutation of form and so on, then since the basis is refuted, the appropriator would be pointless.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul la de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the object of the mental consciousness is not uncommon to other consciousnesses.

original: de dag yid kyi rnam par shes @134b pa'i rten gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag yid kyi rnam par shes @134b pa'i rten gyis ma yin no //
translated: They are not the basis of the mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rten du gyur pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten du gyur pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the eye is not common because it is the basis.

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba phan tshun gyi don du ston par byed do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba phan tshun gyi don du ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúcommon‚Äù indicates that it is the object of many.

original: gang gi phyir skye gnas gcig la gnas pa'i gzugs la yang skye gnas bzhi la gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye gnas gcig la gnas pa'i gzugs la yang skye gnas bzhi la gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'i /
translated: Because, even when the form exists in one birth, the visual consciousness exists in four births.

original: skye gnas gcig la gnas pa'i mig gi skye gnas gnyis la gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mi skye na /
analyzed: skye gnas gcig la gnas pa'i mig gi skye gnas gnyis la gnas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa yang mi skye na /
translated: The visual consciousness does not arise in two births when the eye exists in one birth.

original: skye gnas bzhi la gnas pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: skye gnas bzhi la gnas pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to speak of the visual consciousness existing in four births?

original: de bzhin du khams dang 'gro ba dang ris nges pa las kyang thun mong ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang 'gro ba dang ris nges pa las kyang thun mong ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is not common to the realms, destinies, and classes.

original: mig gzhan la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gzhan la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other sense faculties.

original: gal te yang skye gnas gzhan la gnas pa'i yid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye gnas gzhan la gnas pa skye mod kyi gcig gis cig car skye gnas du ma la gnas pa skyed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang skye gnas gzhan la gnas pa'i yid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye gnas gzhan la gnas pa skye mod kyi gcig gis cig car skye gnas du ma la gnas pa skyed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But even though the mental consciousness of one who is in a certain birth is produced by the mental faculty of another, it is not produced by one who is in another birth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag la ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the production of form, etc.

original: de'i phyir rten gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun nges pas rten rnams kho nas rnam par shes pa rnams rten gyi yul rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun nges pas rten rnams kho nas rnam par shes pa rnams rten gyi yul rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the consciousnesses are supported by the faculties, not by the objects, because they conform to the faculties and because they are determined by the faculties.

original: gzhan dag na re gnyi ga nang gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnyi ga nang gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that both are internal because they are included in the aggregates.

original: gzhan dag na re gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams las tha dad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams las tha dad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that both are counted as sentient beings, and therefore they are distinct from form, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa rkyen du ma las grub pa yin bzhin du yang gnyis kho na ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa rkyen du ma las grub pa yin bzhin du yang gnyis kho na ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why are only the two, the eye and form, mentioned, since eye consciousness is produced from many conditions?

original: rten dang dmigs pa nyid kyi sgo nas rkyen ches nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa nyid kyi sgo nas rkyen ches nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye and visible form are the most immediate conditions in terms of support and object-field.

original: snang ba med kyang mtshan mo rgyu ba rnams dang / nam mkha' med par chu la rgyu ba rnams dang / mching bu dang lhang tsher dang shel gyis bar du chod pa la mig rnam dang / gnyi ga med par lha'i mig dang ldan pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de ltar mig dang gzugs dag med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med kyang mtshan mo rgyu ba rnams dang / nam mkha' med par chu la rgyu ba rnams dang / mching bu dang lhang tsher dang shel gyis bar du chod pa la mig rnam dang / gnyi ga med par lha'i mig dang ldan pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba de ltar mig dang gzugs dag med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even when there is no light, the visual consciousness arises when there is movement at night, when there is movement in the water, when there is an obstruction by a crystal, a piece of glass or a cloud, and when there is the divine eye.

original: yid la byed pa yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bskyed pa la rkyen thun mong ba yin te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bskyed pa la rkyen thun mong ba yin te /
translated: Mental attention is the common condition for the arising of the six groups of consciousness.

original: mig dang gzugs dag ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dag ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: The eye and visible form are not like that.

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis kho na smos pa mdzes so //üîΩgdul bya'i dbang las khams rnams kyang bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis kho na smos pa mdzes so // gdul bya'i dbang las khams rnams kyang bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to mention only these two.üîΩThe elements are also taught from the perspective of the disciples.

original: yid la byed pa la sogs pa smos pa yang glang po che'i rjes lta bu la sogs pa rnams la'o zhes so //
analyzed: yid la byed pa la sogs pa smos pa yang glang po che'i rjes lta bu la sogs pa rnams la'o zhes so //
translated: The mention of mental attention, etc. is also for those who are like elephants.

original: yang lus gang la gnas te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang lus gang la gnas te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Again, in the passage, ‚ÄúAbiding in what body does one see with what eye?‚Äù

original: @135a * // gang la zhes bya ba ni 'dod par gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: @135a * // gang la zhes bya ba ni 'dod par gtogs pa'am /
translated: What means either belonging to the desire realm,

original: bsam gtan dang po'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'am /
translated: the first absorption,

original: gnyis pa'am / gsum pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis pa'am / gsum pa'am /
translated: the second, the third,

original: bzhi ba'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi ba'i sa pa'o //
translated: or the fourth absorption.

original: ci lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci lus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: What is the body like?

original: ci lus 'dod par gtogs na mig dang gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dag kyang 'dod par gtogs pa kho na yin pas na //üîΩde bzhin du lus bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na /
analyzed: ci lus 'dod par gtogs na mig dang gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dag kyang 'dod par gtogs pa kho na yin pas na // de bzhin du lus bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na /
translated: If the body belongs to the desire realm, then the eye, form, and consciousness also belong to the desire realm.

original: mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar du yin pa zhig gam /üîΩ'on te lus 'dod par gtogs na /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dag kyang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar du yin pa zhig gam / 'on te lus 'dod par gtogs na /
translated: Similarly, if the body belongs to the level of the fourth absorption, then the eye, form, and consciousness also belong to the level of the fourth absorption.

original: mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis pa yin pa nas de bzhin du lus bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dag kyang gzhan gyi sa pa'i bar du yin pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis pa yin pa nas de bzhin du lus bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa dag kyang gzhan gyi sa pa'i bar du yin pa zhig ce na /
translated: Or if the body belongs to the desire realm, then the eye, form, and consciousness belong to other levels, and so on, up to if the body belongs to the level of the fourth absorption, then the eye, form, and consciousness belong to other levels.

original: bzhi car yang phan tshun nges pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhi car yang phan tshun nges pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: All four are taught to be uncertain in relation to each other.

original: thams cad la bye brag yod de zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: thams cad la bye brag yod de zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúThere is a distinction in all cases.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa ma gtogs pa gzhan du skyes pa rnams kyi bzhi po 'di dag thams cad rang gi sa pa yin pa mi srid de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa ma gtogs pa gzhan du skyes pa rnams kyi bzhi po 'di dag thams cad rang gi sa pa yin pa mi srid de /
translated: Except for those born in the desire realm and the first absorption, it is impossible for those born in other places to have all four eyes of their own level.

original: 'dod pa dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa dag la ni rang gi mig gis rang gi gzugs rnams la lta ba na thams cad rang gis pa yang srid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa dag la ni rang gi mig gis rang gi gzugs rnams la lta ba na thams cad rang gis pa yang srid do //
translated: For those born in the desire realm and the first absorption, it is possible that all are of their own level when they see forms of their own level with their own eyes.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dod la'i khams su skyes pa rang gi mig gis zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dod la'i khams su skyes pa rang gi mig gis zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: To demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúOne born in the desire realm with eyes of one‚Äôs own level sees forms of one‚Äôs own level with eyes of one‚Äôs own level.‚Äù

original: de ltar bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa'i mig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúwith eyes of the third and fourth absorption levels‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i mig gis de'i sa pa dang sa 'og ma'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na gang gi sa pa yin pa de rgyas par bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i mig gis de'i sa pa dang sa 'og ma'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na gang gi sa pa yin pa de rgyas par bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one born in the desire realm views forms of its own level and lower levels with eyes of the first and second absorptions, so too,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i mig gis lta bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i mig gis lta bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: one should apply the extensive explanation of what level they belong to when viewing with the eyes of the third and fourth absorptions.

original: de la bsam gtan gsum pa'i mig gis 'dod par gtogs pa'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gsum pa'i mig gis 'dod par gtogs pa'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
translated: When viewing forms belonging to the desire realm with eyes of the third absorption,

original: gzugs dang lus ni 'dod par gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs dang lus ni 'dod par gtogs pa yin la /
translated: the form and body belong to the desire realm.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yin no //
translated: The eye consciousness belongs to the level of the first absorption.

original: mig ni gsum pa'i yin no //
analyzed: mig ni gsum pa'i yin no //
translated: The eye belongs to the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i gzugs la lta ba na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i gzugs la lta ba na /
translated: When viewing forms of the first absorption,

original: lus ni 'dod pa na spyod pa @135b yin la /
analyzed: lus ni 'dod pa na spyod pa @135b yin la /
translated: the body belongs to the desire realm.

original: gzugs rnams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni dang po'o //
translated: The forms and eye consciousness belong to the first absorption.

original: mig ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: mig ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'o //
translated: The eye belongs to the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
translated: When viewing forms of the second absorption,

original: lus ni 'dod par gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: lus ni 'dod par gtogs pa yin la /
translated: The body belongs to the realm of desire.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i yin no //
translated: The visual consciousness belongs to the first meditation.

original: gzugs rnams ni gnyis pa'i yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ni gnyis pa'i yin no //
translated: The visible form belongs to the second meditation.

original: mig ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa yin no //
analyzed: mig ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa yin no //
translated: The eye belongs to the third meditation.

original: rang gi gzugs rnams la lta ba na /üîΩlus dang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs rnams la lta ba na / lus dang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: When one sees the visible forms of the first meditation,üîΩthe body and the visual consciousness are as above.

original: gzugs dang mig ni gsum pa'i 'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang mig ni gsum pa'i 'o //
translated: The visible form and the eye belong to the first meditation.

analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mig gis 'dod par gtogs pa rnams la lta ba na /

analyzed: lus dang gzugs ni 'dod pa'i khams yin la /
translated: the body and the visible form belong to the realm of desire.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i yin no //
translated: The visual consciousness belongs to the first meditation.

original: mig ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin no //
analyzed: mig ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin no //
translated: The eye belongs to the third meditation.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams la lta ba na /üîΩlus ni snga ma dang 'dra la gzugs rnams dang rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams la lta ba na / lus ni snga ma dang 'dra la gzugs rnams dang rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i yin no //
translated: When one sees the visible forms of the first meditation,üîΩthe body and the visible form belong to the realm of desire.

original: mig ni bzhi pa'i yin no //
analyzed: mig ni bzhi pa'i yin no //
translated: The visual consciousness and the eye belong to the first meditation.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa rnams la lta ba na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa rnams la lta ba na /
translated: When one sees the visible forms of the second meditation,üîΩthe body and the visible form belong to the realm of desire.

original: lus ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: lus ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin la /
translated: The body is of the desire realm.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni dang po'i yin no //

original: gzugs rnams ni gnyis pa'i yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ni gnyis pa'i yin no //
translated: The form is of the third absorption.

original: mig ni bzhi pa'i yin no //
analyzed: mig ni bzhi pa'i yin no //
translated: The eye is of the fourth absorption.üîΩWhen one of the first absorption sees the form of the third absorption, the body and consciousness are as before.

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa rnams la lta ba na lus ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The form is of the third absorption.üîΩThe eye is of the fourth absorption.üîΩWhen one of the first absorption sees the form of the fourth absorption, the body and consciousness are as before.üîΩThe form is of the fourth absorption.üîΩThe eye is of the fourth absorption.üîΩWhen one of the first absorption sees the form of its own level,üîΩthe body and consciousness are as before.üîΩThe form is of the first absorption.

original: rnam par shes pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i yin no //
translated: The eye is of the first absorption.üîΩWhen one of the third absorption sees the form of the third absorption, the body and consciousness are as before.üîΩThe form is of the third absorption.

original: gzugs ni gsum pa'i yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni gsum pa'i yin no //
translated: The eye is of the third absorption.üîΩWhen one of the third absorption sees the form of the first absorption, the body and consciousness are as before.üîΩThe form is of the first absorption.üîΩThe eye is of the third absorption.üîΩWhen one of the third absorption sees the form of the fourth absorption, the body and consciousness are as before.üîΩThe form is of the fourth absorption.

original: mig ni bzhi pa'i yin no //
analyzed: mig ni bzhi pa'i yin no //
translated: The eye is of the third absorption.

original: rang gi sa pa la lta na /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa la lta na /
translated: When one of the third absorption sees the form of its own level,üîΩthe body and consciousness are as before.

original: lus dang rnam par shes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lus dang rnam par shes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The form is of the third absorption.üîΩThe eye is of the third absorption.üîΩWhen one of the fourth absorption sees the form of the fourth absorption, the body and consciousness are as before.üîΩThe form is of the fourth absorption.

original: gzugs dang mig ni bzhi pa'i yin no //üîΩbsam gtan gsum pa'i mig gis lta ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang mig ni bzhi pa'i yin no // bsam gtan gsum pa'i mig gis lta ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eye is of the fourth absorption.üîΩWhen one of the fourth absorption sees the form of the first absorption, the body and consciousness are as before.üîΩThe form is of the first absorption.üîΩThe eye is of the fourth absorption.üîΩWhen one of the fourth absorption sees the form of the third absorption, the body and consciousness are as before.

analyzed: bsam gtan dang por skyes pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i mig gis 'dod pa'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
translated: The form is of the third absorption.üîΩThe eye is of the fourth absorption.üîΩWhen one of the fourth absorption sees the form of its own level,üîΩthe body and consciousness are as before.

original: gzugs rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin la /
translated: The form is of the fourth absorption.üîΩThe eye is of the fourth absorption.

original: lus dang rnam par shes pa dag ni dang po'i yin no //
analyzed: lus dang rnam par shes pa dag ni dang po'i yin no //
translated: Body and consciousness belong to the first absorption.

original: mig ni gsum pa'i yin no //
analyzed: mig ni gsum pa'i yin no //
translated: The eye belongs to the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
translated: When one sees the form of the first absorption,

analyzed: lus dang rnam par shes pa dang ngag rnams ni dang po'i yin la /

original: mig ni gsum pa'i yin no //

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gzugs rnams la lta ba na / lus dang @136a * //
translated: When one sees the form of the second absorption,

analyzed: rnam par shes pa dag ni dang po'i yin la /
translated: the body and consciousness belong to the first absorption.

original: gzugs ni gnyis pa'i yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni gnyis pa'i yin no //
translated: The form belongs to the second absorption.

original: mig ni gsum pa'i yin no //
analyzed: mig ni gsum pa'i yin no //
translated: The eye belongs to the third absorption.

original: rang gi gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
analyzed: rang gi gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
translated: When one sees one‚Äôs own form,

original: lus dang rnam par shes pa dag ni dang po'i yin la /
analyzed: lus dang rnam par shes pa dag ni dang po'i yin la /
translated: the body and consciousness belong to the first absorption.

original: mig dang gzugs ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: The eye and form belong to the third absorption.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mig gis lta ba'i yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mig gis lta ba'i yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: When one born in the second absorption and so on sees the form of the first absorption,

original: gzhan gyi mig ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mig ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //

original: bsam gtan bzhi par skyes pa'i mig ni rang gi sa pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi par skyes pa'i mig ni rang gi sa pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The eye of one born in the fourth absorption belongs to its own level.

original: gzhan gyi sa pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sa pa ni ma yin no //

original: rang dang gzhan gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba'i yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba'i yang zhes bya ba la /

original: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa'i rang gi sa pa'i gzugs ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gzugs dag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa'i rang gi sa pa'i gzugs ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gzugs dag go //

analyzed: lhag ma gong ma dang 'og ma dag ni gzhan gyi sa pa rnams so //

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi par skyes pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
